Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a motivated and analytical Junior Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. In this role, you will be working within the central Data team to derive insights from the group data warehouse for teams across the business. You will be partnering with the finance, marketing and product teams to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize SQL and Python for data analysis and problem solving.
Create and maintain data visualizations for effective storytelling.
Analyze core e-commerce KPIs to influence business strategies.
Ensure data stewardship to deliver accurate and reliable answers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Communicate and present complicated data analysis effectively to non-technical users.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience using Python specifically for creating Airflow dags is a plus.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control, GIT is a plus.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritise transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst (B2B) (m/f/d) - Product
Description:
Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable use of data to drive fast, accurate decision making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

Our B2B business is a huge growth driver for us. We are looking for a Data Analyst to support this growth by delivering consistent, accurate measurement of performance across all domains, from regular management reporting on partner performance, through product enhancements and experimentation and establishing new models for measuring our inventory.

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio‚Äôs business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio‚Äôs top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company‚Äôs data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 3 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Ideally some experience of B2B or B2B2C environments.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
Knowledge of Looker development
Basic knowledge of Python

Additional Information

What‚Äôs in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Opportunity

Salary: ¬£30k‚Äì¬£40k Per Annum




Launch Your Career as a Data Analyst!

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey as a Data Analyst?

We‚Äôve partnered with forward-thinking companies looking for skilled Data Analysts to join their teams. And here‚Äôs the best part: no prior experience is required to start your career!




How Does It Work?

At Fortray, we provide comprehensive training designed to equip you with cutting-edge data analysis skills. Through live online sessions led by experienced industry professionals, our program offers hands-on expertise to help you thrive in this dynamic field.

Our flexible training program is tailored for everyone‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre a student, a working professional, or considering a career change. With a schedule designed to suit your commitments, a rewarding career in data analytics is within your reach.




Are You Passionate About Data-Driven Insights?

We‚Äôre looking for individuals who excel at analyzing and interpreting data to drive informed decisions and enhance operational efficiency. As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that shape business strategies.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection: Gather and validate data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Data Preparation: Clean and preprocess datasets to resolve inconsistencies and prepare them for analysis.
Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyze data characteristics and derive key insights.
Visualization: Develop compelling reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Present findings clearly to stakeholders to support data-driven decision-making.
Cross-Functional Support: Partner with teams across departments to address their data needs and provide analytical solutions.
Database Management: Maintain and update databases to ensure integrity and accessibility.
Query Optimization: Enhance SQL queries for efficient data retrieval and analysis.
Performance Monitoring: Track and evaluate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to drive business performance.
Documentation: Create detailed documentation of methodologies and findings for clarity and reproducibility.




Skills & Experience

Proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI.
Strong understanding of statistical methods, data modeling, and analytical problem-solving.
Exceptional attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and address discrepancies.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present insights to stakeholders.




Start Your Data Analytics Career Today!

If you‚Äôre passionate about turning data into actionable insights and ready to kick-start a thriving career, we want to hear from you!

Submit your application and resume now and let Fortray guide you through expert training and certification. Together, we‚Äôll help you make a lasting impact as a Data Analyst!

Title: Data Analyst - 24 month contract
Description:
Description

At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It‚Äôs why we work with some of the world‚Äôs leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.

About This Role

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst. You will be responsible for surfacing data-driven results and insights for the wider Analytics Team as well as the core marketing function. In this position you will provide operational, economic, and financial analysis to frame data driven decisions - and implement KPIs and scorecards to track initiative progress/performance to encourage a focus on results and execution.

This position is open through a 24-month contract.

About You

Working with various teams, you will be exposed to a wide range of functions. From engineering, data science to marketing. You will provide your knowledge and skills to be a trusted analyst to the wider analytics team as well as, to our business stakeholders. You will be able to conduct multiple tasks simultaneously with support from leadership. Critical to the success of this role is your ability to develop insightful analysis, work effectively as part of a cross-functional team, and transform data to insight.

As a Data Analyst, you will...


Create and maintain basic reporting solutions using SQL and standard BI tools
Assist in developing regular performance reports and dashboards
Support data quality checks and basic process improvements
Help identify trends in key business metrics
Collaborate with Business stakeholders to understand and address business questions
Document analyses / Insights and maintain clear documentation of work
Support the analytics team in day-to-day reporting needs


About Audible

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners‚Äô imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. We are a global company with an entrepreneurial spirit. We are dreamers and inventors who are passionate about the positive impact Audible can make for our customers and our neighbors. This spirit courses throughout Audible, supporting a culture of creativity and inclusion built on our People Principles and our mission to build more equitable communities in the cities we call home.

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related)
1+ year of experience in a data analysis role
Proficiency in SQL: intermediate query writing
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel: Pivot tables, basic functions, data manipulation
Proficiency in Analysis: Basic statistical concepts and business metrics
Business fluency in English (written and spoken)
Experience with visualization tools: Basic reporting and dashboard creation on Tableau, QuickSight, or PowerBI


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Python or R
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Good communication skills and ability to explain analytical findings
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Experience working with large datasets


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

m/w/d

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Company - Audible GmbH

Job ID: A2913273

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Accountable

Accountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.




About the role

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.




Key Responsibilities




Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)
Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.




Performance Marketing Support (20%)
Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.




A quick word about data infrastructure

At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:

Our own database & its analytical datalake
Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)
Intercom (CRM)
BigQuery (ETL engine)
Gsheet & Looker (visualization)




It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.

We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure




Who you are
Data-driven problem solver

Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

Growth & experimentation mindset

You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.

Business & product sense

You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.

Technical skills

Proficiently in basic programming (Python)

Proactive & collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.

Bonus: marketing analytics experience

You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.




Requirements
Based in Berlin
Fluent in German
A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics




Why join Accountable?

üåç Work at a fast-growing fintech that‚Äôs making self-employment easier.

ü•ä Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.

üéØ¬†Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.

üí°You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.

ü§ù¬†Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Show more
HTML:
About Accountable

Accountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.


About the role

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.


Key Responsibilities


Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)
  • Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
  • Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
  • Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
  • Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
  • Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
  • Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.


Performance Marketing Support (20%)
  • Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
  • Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
  • Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
  • Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.


A quick word about data infrastructure

At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:

  • Our own database & its analytical datalake
  • Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)
  • Intercom (CRM)
  • BigQuery (ETL engine)
  • Gsheet & Looker (visualization)


It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.

We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure


Who you are
  • Data-driven problem solver

Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

  • Growth & experimentation mindset

You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.

  • Business & product sense

You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.

  • Technical skills

Proficiently in basic programming (Python)

  • Proactive & collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.

  • Bonus: marketing analytics experience

You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.


Requirements
  • Based in Berlin
  • Fluent in German
  • A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
  • Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics


Why join Accountable?

üåç Work at a fast-growing fintech that‚Äôs making self-employment easier.

ü•ä Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.

üéØ Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.

üí°You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.

ü§ù Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Location: Berlin, remote

About the customer: Big Pharma Company based in europe.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python to load and transform data.
Utilize Snowflake as a data source, ensuring optimal data retrieval and transformation processes.
Design and implement Power BI dashboards and reports to support data-driven decision-making.
Work with T-SQL and MS SQL Server for data extraction and querying.
Develop and optimize data models to improve data integrity and performance.
Utilize PowerApps and Power Automate to streamline business processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data quality, consistency, and security in compliance with industry standards.

Must-Haves:

Advanced proficiency in Python scripting and SQL.
Medium to advanced knowledge of Snowflake and T-SQL.
Strong experience with Power BI.
Basic to medium understanding of MS SQL Server.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Nice-to-Haves:

Experience with PowerApps and Power Automate.
Basic understanding of MS Access.
Deep knowledge of data modeling techniques.
Experience in the pharmaceutical industry.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

If you feel addressed or know someone who is suitable, please contact us as soon as possible. We would be happy to discuss the details with you.

Telefon: 030 2215 20520

Python, Snowflake, Power BI, T-SQL, MS SQL Server, PowerApps, Power Automate, Data Modeling, Data Pipelines, Pharmaceutical Industry

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst / Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have a passion for technology and a drive to make a positive impact? Join NeuroNation and help us shape the future of brain training!




About NeuroNation

NeuroNation is a leading brain training platform used by over 28 million people worldwide. We collaborate closely with scientists and universities to achieve the best results possible. Our engaging apps have received awards from major health insurance companies, such as the AOK, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Health. Also, NeuroNation has been awarded by Apple and Google. Our medical app can be prescribed by doctors in Germany, while costs are covered by the public health insurance.




The Role

In this dynamic role, you'll be a key member of our product team, driving data-driven initiatives and developing product features forward. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including backend and mobile developers, to ensure new features are implemented smoothly and according to our high standards. Your strong analytical skills and technical knowledge will be essential in translating business needs into actionable solutions.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the Growth and Product teams to support data-driven decisions for our mobile and web applications.
Analyze data and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify opportunities for performance optimization.
Conduct deep analyses on user behavior (data mining) to uncover patterns and provide actionable insights.
Maintain a growth mindset‚Äîconstantly seek learning opportunities to enhance your skills and the team's capabilities.
Act as a key support contact for BI-related topics within the organization.
Assist in managing the data warehouse and building internal reports to inform strategic decisions.
Work closely with Marketing, Customer Care, and CRM departments to ensure cohesive data insights across teams.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends in business intelligence and data analytics.




You're a perfect fit if you:

Have 1-2 years of experience in a technical or data-focused role (e.g., BI Analyst, Data Analyst).
Have been part of or closely collaborated with a product team delivering digital consumer or B2B products.
Have studied Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Possess strong experience in SQL, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, or similar database tools.
Have a passion for learning and staying current with the latest technologies in data analytics.
Are located in Berlin, Germany.
Possess strong problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset.
Speak English with excellent written and oral communication skills.
Are a team player who enjoys supporting and collaborating with colleagues.




Bonus points for:

You have advanced knowledge of R or Python
You have experience conceptualising and executing A/B tests.
You have been working on mobile applications
You have a basic knowledge of German, French, Spanish or Italian.




What we offer:

The opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of millions of people.
Work on cutting-edge technology that is used by a global audience.
A flexible work environment with core working hours of 9:30 am - 4:30 pm CET.




Don't hesitate to apply!

We're looking for talented individuals who are passionate about what we do. Submit your application and tell us why you'd be a great fit for NeuroNation!

Title: Statistician
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we‚Äôre rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 230 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag ‚Äì either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Statistical and data-sampling techniques such as regression, imputation, random forest, Monte Carlo, stratification, and/or clustering;
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;
  • Handling unstructured/imbalanced data.

What‚Äôs In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

üå± Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

üåç Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.


Tasks



Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.


Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.


Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.


Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements



You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.


Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.


Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.


Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.


Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits



Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement


An environment that offers room for personal and professional development


A centrally located office in Berlin City West


Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs


The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products


A pet-friendly environment


Salary progression based on length of service with the company


Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.





At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!




You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.




Get in touch with us now!




Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are looking for an experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our growing team and play a critical role in optimizing our marketing efforts across all paid channels. You don‚Äôt just analyze data - you have a deep understanding of the acquisition funnel and use data to uncover opportunities for growth, efficiency, and higher ROI.

If you are passionate about data-driven marketing and love turning insights into business impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!


Develop a holistic view of the acquisition funnel, from first touchpoint to conversion, and identify bottlenecks or opportunities for improvement
Define and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure marketing effectiveness
Analyze ad platform data (Google Ads, Meta, etc.) and web analytics (GA4) to optimize spend and improve conversion rates
Provide data-driven recommendations on budget allocation across channels
Support continuous testing and experimentation, including A/B tests and geo-lift studies
Work with data engineers and leverage BigQuery to ensure the marketing team has the right data infrastructure in place
Build dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with CRM and influencer marketing teams to align insights across different acquisition and retention efforts
Leverage Media Mix Modeling and other advanced analytics techniques to assess marketing impact


Your profile


3 to 5 years of experience in data analytics with a strong focus on performance marketing and acquisition funnels
University degree in Information Systems, Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science, or a related field
Strong SQL skills and experience working with BigQuery
Deep understanding of tracking data and ad platform analytics (Google Ads, Meta, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Qlik
Experience with testing methodologies (geo-lift tests, incrementality testing)
Ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Strong stakeholder management and the ability to challenge assumptions with data
Ideally knowledge of forecasting and predictive modeling and skills in Python or R for advanced analytics


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership and either Swapfiets bike rental or a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Junior Data & Marketing Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

We are seeking a highly motivated Junior data & Marketing Analyst to join our marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, acquiring, negotiating, maintaining, and optimising relationships with affiliate partners.

What You‚Äôll Do üéØ


Identifying and acquiring new potential partners.
Negotiating deal setups.
Optimizing and making sure campaigns are achieving quality requirements.
Building and maintaining relationships with partners.
Identifying and highlighting industry trends to maximize growth opportunities.
Generating weekly, and monthly reports for internal and external use.
Collaborating with all other departments to build and test both engaging and attractive new propositions for our partners to scale our Partnership.


What You‚Äôll Bring üí°


Strong ability with numbers; studies with engineering, economics, math are a big plus.
Some experience working with performance marketing.
Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills and a results-oriented mindset.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, while being a fast learner and effective collaborator.
Experience in the gaming industry is a plus.


What Makes You a Great Fit üåü


You're passionate about marketing and making an impact, with a strong desire to grow and take on new challenges.
An independent thinker who thrives with ownership and responsibility, driving results from day one.
A versatile and energetic team player who excels in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? üöÄ


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to share in Almedia‚Äôs success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth‚Äîwhether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Charles Levick have partnered with a market leader within the Energy Trading space, We have been commissioned to find a highly motivated Quantitative Analyst as they continue to expand their ever growing team.




Your role & responsibilities

Conduct quantitative analysis of the European energy market and its price drivers.
Provide traders with quantitative insights into market dynamics (e.g., through volatilities, sensitivities, and correlations).
Develop and apply mathematical models and tools to support commercial decision-making in areas such as product pricing, hedging, position management, and market analytics.
Collaborate closely with IT to refactor the existing framework for dispatch optimisation, covering all relevant timeframes from day-ahead to three years ahead.
Analyse, calibrate, and enhance quantitative models used for options trading and the green power sector.
Foster effective working relationships with traders, fellow analysts, and colleagues from risk management and other departments to ensure the smooth flow of information and informed decision-making.




Must Have

2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, in energy trading or a related field.
Completed education in physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or economics at the master's, diploma, or PhD level.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with a deep understanding of stochastic calculus, optimisation methods, and data science techniques.
Experience in quantitative modeling and pricing of commodity options and PPA products is a plus.
Advanced proficiency in object-oriented programming (preferably in Python).
Experience with modern cloud IT technologies (e.g., GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) is a plus.
A team player with excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a strong focus on results, commercial awareness, and the ability to work independently under pressure.
Proficient in written and spoken English; knowledge of additional languages is a plus.




Benefits & Package

Highly competitive salary
Lucrative bonus package
30 days of vacation entitlement
Health Care
Diverse training opportunities
Hybrid role







If this sounds like you, or something you wish to explore further, don't hesitate to reach out or apply:




Thanks,

Hamish

  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with a deep understanding of stochastic calculus, optimisation methods, and data science techniques.
  • Experience in quantitative modeling and pricing of commodity options and PPA products is a plus.
  • Advanced proficiency in object-oriented programming (preferably in Python).
  • Experience with modern cloud IT technologies (e.g., GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) is a plus.
  • A team player with excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a strong focus on results, commercial awareness, and the ability to work independently under pressure.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English; knowledge of additional languages is a plus.


Benefits & Package

  • Highly competitive salary
  • Lucrative bonus package
  • 30 days of vacation entitlement
  • Health Care
  • Diverse training opportunities
  • Hybrid role



If this sounds like you, or something you wish to explore further, don't hesitate to reach out or apply:


Thanks,

Hamish

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
√úber uns - Education Partners

Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners!

Bist du leidenschaftlich daran interessiert, digitale Erlebnisse zu schaffen, die wirklich etwas bewirken?

Wir bei Education Partners sind ein f√ºhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung und gestalten das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.

Deine Aufgaben

Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und m√∂chtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein f√ºhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.


Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst gro√üe und komplexe Datens√§tze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verst√§ndnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Gesch√§ftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern ‚Äì idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterst√ºtzt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Ma√ünahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualit√§t: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverl√§ssig erfasst werden. Daf√ºr unterst√ºtzt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst f√ºr eine effiziente Nutzung der verf√ºgbaren Datenquellen.


Dein Profil


Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgepr√§gtes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell und √ºbersetzt diese in pr√§zise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst gro√üe Datens√§tze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verst√§ndlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und wei√üt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.


Nice-to-Have:


Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Warum wir?


Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genie√üe die Flexibilit√§t, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen B√ºro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-L√∂sungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir f√∂rdern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (SKAN Attribution, LTV forecasting)
Description:
SLAY, founded in December 2022, has swiftly made its mark in the mobile world. The company developed 5 apps and games that reached the #1 spot in the App Store across 3 continents.




Backed by some of the world's most esteemed investors, including Accel, Kevin Weil, Riccardo Zacconi, Scott Belsky, and Ilkka Paananen, SLAY is rapidly growing and reaching millions of users.




Our mission is to create digital life through AI and become the leading company for virtual friends that live, grow and evolve like humans‚Äîstarting with Pengu. Pengu has become the biggest AI character app with its own IP in the US and Europe.


Tasks



Location: In-person working (Berlin). No remote/hybrid.


A-Players Only: We‚Äôre building a team of top-tier talent. A-players hire A-players. We‚Äôd rather invest in one exceptional person with an above-market salary they‚Äôre thrilled about than settle for multiple B-players at standard rates.


Drive: You‚Äôre relentless and motivated to do whatever it takes to succeed. You might have something to prove, a fire in your belly, or a mind that works differently. Work isn‚Äôt just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a core part of who you are and how you find purpose.


Grind. We work/text on weekends and at night. It‚Äôs ok to send messages at 3am.


Urgency: Move at lightning speed‚Äîturn weeks into days, hours into minutes. Smash through obstacles to get results. Respond instantly, not eventually.


Relentless. Winning comes first.Follow up 10x a day if needed. Triple-text or call if someone‚Äôs ghosting you. Persistence is your superpower.


Fast Firing: We move on quickly from anyone who isn‚Äôt an A-player. You‚Äôll need to be comfortable with this. Paid trials help us both figure out the fit upfront.


Mission-Driven: Our mission‚Äî‚ÄúBecoming the leading company for virtual characters‚Äù‚Äîexcites you. You‚Äôre here to make an impact.


Versatility: No task is beneath you. Wear many hats. No job is not your job.


EV-Based Decisions: We optimize for expected value, not comfort zones. No playing it safe with ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù choices.


Flat Structure: Flat company org. Titles reflect scope. No political promotion games.





If you‚Äôre an A-player ready to run hard and win big, this is your shot. Let‚Äôs build something extraordinary together.


Requirements



Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data analysis tools.


Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python or R).


Experience with predictive modeling techniques and forecasting LTV.


Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms relevant to marketing analytics.


Strong knowledge of attribution models, including probabilistic and multi-touch models.


Familiarity with mobile attribution challenges like SKAdNetwork (SKAN).


Experience with cloud data warehouses is a plus.


Having product sense, eyes for the details is great


No product managers


0-1, early stage data experience is great


Passion and experience building consumer-facing products! We‚Äôd love to hear about apps you‚Äôve made!

Title: Data Analyst - Performance Marketing (maternity cover)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Zalando‚Äôs Performance Marketing department is dedicated to deepening relationships with consumers outside of Zalando premises by delivering engaging and relevant digital ads. We drive profitable growth through data-driven decision-making while ensuring customer privacy and leveraging cutting-edge technology.

As a Data Analyst , you will play a key role in supporting our performance marketing analytics team. You will work closely with marketing professionals, product managers, and data teams to optimize Zalando‚Äôs marketing investments. Your primary focus will be handling ad hoc requests from business teams, responding to inquiries from marketing stakeholders, improving our KPI framework, and contributing to marketing measurement initiatives.

This role is a great opportunity for someone with strong analytical skills and a passion for marketing analytics, who thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.

Please note This is a maternity cover position, and the role is available until September 2026 .

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



Serve as a trusted analytical partner for our marketing teams, handling ad hoc data requests and performance inquiries.
Support marketing measurement initiatives, ensuring accuracy and relevance in tracking and reporting methodologies.
Improve and maintain our KPI framework to enhance performance monitoring and decision-making.
Assist in answering strategic business questions related to marketing investments, campaign performance, and optimization opportunities.
Contribute to the development of marketing measurement solutions and methodologies in collaboration with data and engineering teams.
Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making.
Support the continuous improvement of internal data processes, including defining data requirements and ensuring efficient data acquisition.



What We‚Äôre Looking For



Hold a degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, economics, mathematics, engineering, or a similar quantitative discipline.
Have 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Product Analyst, or similar role in a fast-paced business environment, ideally within marketing analytics.
Possess strong problem-solving abilities to answer ad hoc analytical questions, optimize marketing performance, and support decision-making with data-driven insights.
Are familiar with A/B testing principles, marketing measurement techniques, and causal inference methods (e.g., difference-in-differences, experimental design).
Have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation. Experience with Python for data analysis is a plus.
Have experience working with marketing data, tracking methodologies, and defining data requirements for performance measurement.
Can effectively translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences, including marketing and leadership teams.



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review
Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.



We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.
do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups
Opportunity to work from abroad for 30 (working) days per calendar year



Financial



Access to the employee shares program
40% shopping discount on products shipped and sold by Zalando, and 30% discount on Zalando Lounge
Discounts from a wide range of external partners
SBB Half Fare Travelcard



Family



4 weeks paid paternity leave and 17 weeks paid maternity leave
3 fully-paid child sick days per year
Free counseling, assistance, and referral service for all matters concerning yourself and your family via the F√ºrstenberg Institute.



About Zalando

It‚Äôs the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 48 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

HTML:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and German.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.



Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (on-chain)
Description:
About Neutron

Home to an expanding array of cutting-edge applications such as Astroport, Mars, Nolus, and others, Neutron is a rapidly growing smart contract platform that enables developers to build and scale breakthrough applications.

Neutron is the first Integrated Application network. Integrated Applications are smart(er) contracts that have the powers of appchains‚Äînative automation, arbitrary cross-chain interoperability, MEV recapture, custom fees and mempools, and more‚Äîin the form factor of a smart contract. As a result, Neutron empowers entrepreneurs to build better and more profitable applications that can onboard users from anywhere.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst you will work with on-chain and off-chain data to create report, spreadsheets and dashboards to enable data-driven decision making, facilitate operations and improve the community's visibility on the network and its ecosystem's tractions.

Responsibilities


Creating queries and dashboards to facilitate the monitoring of validator block and oracle signing performance, as well as tool to easily export the list of validators and their relevant metrics.
Custom on-chain metrics dashboards to be used internally as OKR/KPIs monitoring tools, potentially with automated reporting mechanisms.
Dashboards analyzing the distribution of liquidity and incentives on the network over time and the effectiveness of said incentives, ideally automating recommendations based on a provided framework.
Community oriented dashboards providing tokenomic and network health information including native token burn, network revenue and more at a glance
Orderbook liquidity, volume and user trends dashboards
Protocol-owned-liquidity monitoring and dashboards to track the utility, risk and value of POL initiatives over time
Collaborate with technical team to refine and optimize the presentation of data on dashboards, enhancing user experience and data accessibility


Qualifications


3+ years of practical experience in data analysis and statistical modeling techniques
Experienced with Google BigQuery
Proficient in Python, JavaScript, SQL and other data
Excellent knowledge of data science methodologies for data analysis, understanding of data types, themes, scientific challenges, and approaches, including statistical analytics
Proficiency in using data sources and applications for research purposes
Experience in cryptocurrencies, particularly with Cosmos, is highly advantageous
English B2+


What We Offer


Large token allocation
Remote work options
Opportunities for international travel
28 Voluntary paid day-off per annum
Comprehensive benefit package including:
Physical Well-being program,
Mental Health program,
Individual Training & Conference Attendance program,
English studies program,
Co-working space reimbursement

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion

We firmly believe in the strength of diverse and inclusive teams and are fully committed to providing equal employment opportunities. We actively seek out and hire the most talented individuals worldwide, regardless of gender, race, age, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, or place of origin.

If you‚Äôre ready to take the leap and join us in shaping the future of finance, apply today.
