Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als ‚ÄúData Analyst‚Äù (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und m√∂chtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein f√ºhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genie√üe die Flexibilit√§t, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen B√ºro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-L√∂sungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir f√∂rdern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst gro√üe und komplexe Datens√§tze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verst√§ndnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Gesch√§ftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern ‚Äì idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterst√ºtzt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Ma√ünahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualit√§t: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverl√§ssig erfasst werden. Daf√ºr unterst√ºtzt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst f√ºr eine effiziente Nutzung der verf√ºgbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgepr√§gtes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell und √ºbersetzt diese in pr√§zise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst gro√üe Datens√§tze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verst√§ndlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und wei√üt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen erm√∂glicht, die unsere Gesch√§ftsstrategie ma√ügeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We‚Äôre proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you‚Äôre interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 ‚Äì but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgepr√§gtes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell und √ºbersetzt diese in pr√§zise Handlungsempfehlungen.

Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.

Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen erm√∂glicht, die unsere Gesch√§ftsstrategie ma√ügeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you‚Äôve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards ‚Äì creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus ‚Äì particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you‚Äôll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you‚Äôll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don‚Äôt need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned ‚Äúgrown-up‚Äù startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N¬∞1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?

We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you‚Äôll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
  • Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
  • Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
  • Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
  • Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
  • Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
  • Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
  • Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
  • Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.

How You Will Contribute

  • Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
  • Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
  • Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
  • Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value

By the way - You don‚Äôt need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile

  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
  • Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
  • Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
  • Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
  • Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
  • Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you‚Äôre stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can‚Äôt wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone‚Äôs future financial growth.

We are looking for a

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm ‚Äì flexible working conditions available

Key Responsibilities:


Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data
Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency
Analyze problems to understand their root cause
Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions
Collaborate on data-related projects
Visualize data and turn data into stories
Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights
Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions
Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.



Your Profile:


Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions
Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R
Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning
Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation
Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions
Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations
Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams
Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent Team player



Nice if you have:


Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space
Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks
Experience in quantitative research



#EUR33

Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:


Immerse yourself in a welcoming, trust-filled atmosphere as part of our agile teams and explore the fantastic opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Put your health first by engaging in a variety of supported sports and leisure activities ‚Äì it's important to us!
Empower your growth and professional development with Riverty‚Äôs training sessions and customized development plans. Together, we'll learn, evolve, and achieve success.
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Experience the best of both worlds with our flexible working arrangements, which let you mix on-site teamwork and remote work to create the perfect professional experience that suits your life.



Please note, benefits could be different depending on location or agreement details, and they may alter over time. We'd be delighted to explore these benefits in greater depth during an interview.

About Us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.

Our world is growing. And we‚Äôre here. Together, we‚Äôre finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‚Äòs build a more sustainable financial future, together.

We keep what we promise:

More information on riverty.com/careers.‚ÄØAre you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application ‚Äì with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Country: Germany

State/Region: Baden-W√ºrttemberg

City: Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm

Postal Code: 76532

Job ID: 276394

Benefits:


At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

Wir freuen uns √ºber Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines fr√ºhesten Eintrittstermins.

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Sch√∂neberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You‚Äôll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe‚Äôs automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch)
Description:
√úber uns

Getreu unserem Motto ‚Äì People is what makes us us ‚Äì sind uns deine nachhaltige Ausbildung und Weiterentwicklung, deine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance und deine Happiness sehr wichtig. Konkret stellen wir mit 32 Urlaubstagen, 60 % mobilem Arbeiten, bis zu 4 Wochen pro Jahr ‚Äì im europ√§ischen Ausland ‚Äì der M√∂glichkeit remote zu arbeiten, Sabbatical und √úberstundenausgleich sicher, dass dir im FUSE-Agentur-Leben nichts fehlt.

In unserem derzeit √ºber 60-k√∂pfigen Team sowie unseren Kund*innen haben wir unser perfektes Match bereits gefunden. Wenn du noch auf der Suche bist, bei ‚Äûpopkulturellem Relevanzmarketing‚Äú neugierig wirst und f√ºr Social Media, Influencer Marketing oder Gaming & Esports brennst, dann lass uns zusammen loslegen! Denn : Action Creates Impact .

Dein Job

Als (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch) bearbeitest du als Teil unseres Data und Analytics Teams in erster Linie die Anfragen unserer Kunden nach Social Media Reportings sowie Social Listening Analysen und beherrschst den Spagat zwischen analytischem und kreativem Denken, um die Kolleg:Innen in deinem und anderen Teams mit datenbasierten Insights zu Kundenmeinungen, M√§rkten, Zielgruppen, Marken und ihren Social Media-Umfeldern zu versorgen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Datenbeschaffung / Toolbedienung

Du bist pr√§zise, schnell, zuverl√§ssig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung gro√üer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsf√§hig, dich diesbez√ºglich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere L√∂sungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine t√§glichen Begleiter.

Studiendurchf√ºhrung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu k√∂nnen, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schlie√ülich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht r√ºberzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei Pr√§sentationen.

Datenanalyse

Auswertungslogiken passend zu den gegebenen Fragestellungen und Erkenntnisinteressen erstellen, Dimensionierungen & Kategorisierungen f√ºr Inhaltsanalysen planen und entwickeln, Daten ausz√§hlen, filtern, darstellen, vergleichen, interpretieren, daraus kreative Idee und Empfehlungen ableiten. Das ist dein Playground. Deine Affinit√§t zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souver√§ner Umgang auch mit gro√üen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind f√ºr dich selbstverst√§ndlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen F√§higkeiten, auch ein Gesp√ºr f√ºr gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbst√§ndig, willst aber auch noch st√§ndig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf H√∂he des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse f√ºr unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. Au√üerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erf√§hrst du stets R√ºckenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest f√ºr Kunden - die unsere Werte ‚ÄûBOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.‚Äú leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum f√ºr pers√∂nliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k
Description:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k




Your Responsibilities:

Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.




Your Qualifications:

Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.




What We Offer:

35-hour workweek (full-time).
Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
Flexible working hours
Remote working opportunities.
30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
Centrally located offices
Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Show more
HTML:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k


Your Responsibilities:

  • Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
  • Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
  • Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
  • Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.


Your Qualifications:

  • Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
  • Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
  • Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
  • Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
  • Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.


What We Offer:

  • 35-hour workweek (full-time).
  • Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working opportunities.
  • 30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
  • Centrally located offices
  • Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
  • Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.




Qualification Path:




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Germany for the last 2 Years consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Germany
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of 70+ ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world's most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+ team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to learn more about what it's like to work here

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven't done before. You might just discover skills you didn't know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About you

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst, where you'll ensure our data is clean, accessible, and ready for analysis. As a core member of our analytics team, you‚Äôll ensure our data infrastructure effectively supports self-service analytics, insightful reporting, and business intelligence across the organization.Apply software engineering practices to analytics code, including version control, testing, and continuous integration.

What You‚Äôll Do üéØ


Design, build, and maintain clean, scalable, and performance-optimized data models using SQL and dbt.
Automate and streamline data validation, testing, and reporting processes.
Take ownership of data analysis for a designated domain, collaborating closely with Product Analysts, Data Scientists, and Business Stakeholders to meet their analytical and reporting needs.
Proactively monitor data integrity, identify issues, and perform root cause analysis.
Maintain comprehensive data documentation and definitions for easy reference and understanding.
Train business users on utilizing the data platform and data visualization tools effectively.


What You‚Äôll Bring üí°


Experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker to create insightful dashboards.
Strong experience in data engineering and analytics, with proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and performance optimization.
Knowledge of data validation, testing frameworks, and version control best practices (Git).
Familiarity with modern data stacks (dbt, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, Dagster/Airflow) and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP).
Excellent communication skills for training and supporting business users.
Ability to maintain detailed data documentation and definitions.


What Makes You a Great Fit üåü


Passionate about transforming data into actionable insights.
A detail-oriented problem-solver who excels in a collaborative environment.
Eager to innovate and continuously improve data processes.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? üöÄ


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to share in Almedia‚Äôs success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth‚Äîwhether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Data Analyst in Bioinformatics and Ecology (f/m/x)
Company: Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB)
Description:
The Department of Evolutionary and Integrative Ecology at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB, www.igb-berlin.de) invites applications for a Data Analyst focusing on genomic and ecological data. The position will be located in Berlin-Dahlem. It will also include managing and analysing large datasets and supporting IGB‚Äôs Competence and Technology Platform on Research Data Management.

Your role


Process and analyse genomic and molecular data from environmental samples and non-model organisms
Manage and analyse experimental and field data
Write data management plans and support researchers in the department to implement these plans following best practices
Support IGB research teams as a member of the IGB Research Data Management group
Apply and support the development of data visualisation tools


Your profile


University degree in bioinformatics, computational ecology, statistics, computer science, data science, or equivalent expertise, including from the private sector
Competence in R and one or more additional programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, C#)
Experience in data mining, scholarly databases, and the management, curation and analysis of data following FAIR data principles and Open Science practices
Very good English communication skills; German skills desirable
Excellent social skills, service orientation and ability to work in an international and diverse team
Prior knowledge of freshwater science is advantageous


Our offer

We offer an international and dynamic work environment located in our new Joint Biodiversity Building in Berlin-Dahlem. You will become part of a motivated team that encourages active participation and new ideas. We promote your professional development through qualifications and further training opportunities, and we actively support the compatibility of family and career.

This is a full-time position, but it is also suitable for part-time work. You will be paid according to the collective agreement for the public sector (TV√∂D Bund) and benefit from flexible working hours, a 39-hour work week, 30 days of vacation, a company pension scheme, and a subsidy for public transportation. The contract is initially limited to two years with the option of permanent employment. The salary class will be based on qualifications and assigned duties.

Given our commitment to diversity, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender and gender identity, origin, nationality, religion, belief, health and physical disabilities, age or sexual orientation. IGB is committed to increasing the number of women in this field, therefore applications from women are particularly welcome. Various measures are in place at IGB to support gender equality. We support the reconciliation of work and family life. Applicants with a disability will be given preference if they are equally qualified.

Are you interested?

Then apply by 06.04.2025 by submitting your documents (up to 2-page cover letter, CV, certificates/references, brief overview of your past projects) and stating the reference number 06/2025 exclusively via our recruitment platform at www.igb-berlin.de/en/jobs. Any questions can be directed to Jonathan Jeschke (Jonathan.Jeschke@igb-berlin.de).

"Research for the future of our freshwaters" is the mission of IGB ‚Äì Germany‚Äôs largest and one of the leading international centres for freshwater research. In order to investigate different aspects of freshwater ecosystems, their biota and societal relevance, we unite a wide range of disciplines and understand research as a joint effort. With more than 350 employees and guests from all over the world, we conduct research at five locations in Berlin and at Lake Stechlin (Brandenburg). IGB is a member of the German Leibniz Association and the Forschungsverbund Berlin e. V. www.igb-berlin.de

The Department of Evolutionary and Integrative Ecology at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB, www.igb-berlin.de) invites applications for a Data Analyst focusing on genomic and ecological data. The position will be located in Berlin-Dahlem. It will also include managing and analysing large datasets and supporting IGB‚Äôs Competence and Technology Platform on Research Data Management.

Your role

  • Process and analyse genomic and molecular data from environmental samples and non-model organisms
  • Manage and analyse experimental and field data
  • Write data management plans and support researchers in the department to implement these plans following best practices
  • Support IGB research teams as a member of the IGB Research Data Management group
  • Apply and support the development of data visualisation tools

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 4+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more
