Title: (Junior) Data Engineer
Description:
Team

The Risk Controlling & Regulatory Reporting is a key function within the company that is responsible for generation of reports for regulatory and risk controlling purposes for Raisin.

To this extent, we build and maintain data pipelines using Snowflake, Looker, Airflow (MWAA) and dbt that process financial data and transform it. We then make these accessible to our regulatory and risk teams, who rely on this data to perform internal audits and report KPIs to regulatory authorities

Your Responsibilities


Work on scalable data pipelines to efficiently process and analyze large volumes of data, utilizing Snowflake, Looker, Airflow and dbt.
Collaborate with stakeholders to help translate their requirements into technical steps and coordinate the projects you drive with them.
Monitor and improve the health of our data pipelines.
Promote knowledge sharing within the team to foster collaboration and continuous learning
Stay updated on emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and bring new ideas to enhance the technical set-up.


Your Profile


Solid experience with Airflow, Python programming and SQL / dbt.
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake is a plus.
Knowledge of AWS services and Docker is a plus.
Bachelors in Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant quantitative fields
Strong analytical and quantitative approach to problems
Familiarity with Data Engineering best practices, including Data Quality and Observability.
Comfortable working in a dynamic and changing environment, with a strong sense of responsibility.
Eagerness to learn and grow through on-the-job learning.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As Part Of Our Team, You Will Benefit From


Employee Development Budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 and four full training days per year.
Access to Babbel for continuous language learning.
Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.
Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.
Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than ‚Ç¨20 per month.
Love cycling? With JobRad, lease the bike of your choice and enjoy tax savings, plus Raisin covers your monthly insurance costs.
A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.
Do you miss being in the office? The Deutschland Ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with ‚Ç¨25 per month.


About Us

Raisin is the trailblazer in the savings and investment space. Founded in 2012, the fintech company started by opening the $95+ trillion deposits and investments market of the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States to consumers.

Today, Raisin serves more than one million customers in these three markets, offering savings products as well as investment and pension products. This makes the Berlin-based fintech one of the leading global savings and investments marketplaces. Savers get a wider choice of attractive products with the ability to move their money freely. In addition, financial service providers get best-in-class marketplace solutions for their customers, and banks get better access to retail funding.

Raisin operates its own B2C marketplaces in Europe and the U.S. under the brands Raisin and WeltSparen. In Germany, the company offers ETF-based investment and retirement products in addition to savings products. Raisin works with over 400 banks and financial service providers from over 30 countries

We are backed by renowned international investors such as b2venture, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, Greycroft, Headline, Index Ventures, Latitude Ventures, Orange Ventures, PayPal Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Ribbit Capital, Vitruvian Partners and M&G.

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which connects more than 75 different nationalities.

In total, we have 7 offices across the world: Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Madrid, Manchester, Munich and New York.

We also think it‚Äôs important to take the time to celebrate our hard work and achievements together, with events like our yearly summer and winter party, as well as a couple of smaller get-togethers.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:

Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und m√∂chtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.

Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterst√ºtzt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.

Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst f√ºr eine effiziente Nutzung der verf√ºgbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgepr√§gtes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell und √ºbersetzt diese in pr√§zise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst gro√üe Datens√§tze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verst√§ndlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und wei√üt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.

Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen erm√∂glicht, die unsere Gesch√§ftsstrategie ma√ügeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (on-chain)
Description:
About Neutron

Home to an expanding array of cutting-edge applications such as Astroport, Mars, Nolus, and others, Neutron is a rapidly growing smart contract platform that enables developers to build and scale breakthrough applications.

Neutron is the first Integrated Application network. Integrated Applications are smart(er) contracts that have the powers of appchains‚Äînative automation, arbitrary cross-chain interoperability, MEV recapture, custom fees and mempools, and more‚Äîin the form factor of a smart contract. As a result, Neutron empowers entrepreneurs to build better and more profitable applications that can onboard users from anywhere.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst you will work with on-chain and off-chain data to create report, spreadsheets and dashboards to enable data-driven decision making, facilitate operations and improve the community's visibility on the network and its ecosystem's tractions.

Responsibilities


Creating queries and dashboards to facilitate the monitoring of validator block and oracle signing performance, as well as tool to easily export the list of validators and their relevant metrics.
Custom on-chain metrics dashboards to be used internally as OKR/KPIs monitoring tools, potentially with automated reporting mechanisms.
Dashboards analyzing the distribution of liquidity and incentives on the network over time and the effectiveness of said incentives, ideally automating recommendations based on a provided framework.
Community oriented dashboards providing tokenomic and network health information including native token burn, network revenue and more at a glance
Orderbook liquidity, volume and user trends dashboards
Protocol-owned-liquidity monitoring and dashboards to track the utility, risk and value of POL initiatives over time
Collaborate with technical team to refine and optimize the presentation of data on dashboards, enhancing user experience and data accessibility


Qualifications


3+ years of practical experience in data analysis and statistical modeling techniques
Experienced with Google BigQuery
Proficient in Python, JavaScript, SQL and other data
Excellent knowledge of data science methodologies for data analysis, understanding of data types, themes, scientific challenges, and approaches, including statistical analytics
Proficiency in using data sources and applications for research purposes
Experience in cryptocurrencies, particularly with Cosmos, is highly advantageous
English B2+


What We Offer


Large token allocation
Remote work options
Opportunities for international travel
28 Voluntary paid day-off per annum
Comprehensive benefit package including:
Physical Well-being program,
Mental Health program,
Individual Training & Conference Attendance program,
English studies program,
Co-working space reimbursement

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion

We firmly believe in the strength of diverse and inclusive teams and are fully committed to providing equal employment opportunities. We actively seek out and hire the most talented individuals worldwide, regardless of gender, race, age, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, or place of origin.

If you‚Äôre ready to take the leap and join us in shaping the future of finance, apply today.

Title: Working Student - Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Working Student to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

As a Working Student in Data Science, you will have the opportunity to work on Machine Learning model improvements and bring them into production. If this sounds exciting, read on!

Job Description


Support the development and improvement of pricing models using both traditional tabular data and deep learning approaches
Carry out data analysis and preparation for machine learning models
Help maintain and optimise existing ML models
Collaborate with the data science team as a whole
Learn and apply best practices in Machine Learning and Data Science


Qualifications


Currently enrolled in or completed university degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related technical field. Students from other degree programmes can also be considered if they have relevant Machine Learning project experience
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and ML
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, previous ML experience or projects is a plus
Good analytical and problem-solving skills and strong English communication skills


Additional Information


International teams
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Join our Early Career Program, get a fair salary and experience our AUTO1 world cross-functionally through special internal events
Be part of Europe's leading digital automotive platform!


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We‚Äôre proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you‚Äôre interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 ‚Äì but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide

HTML:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We‚Äôre proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.


We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.


Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)


Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company


What you would do:


Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.


You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.


  • Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
  • Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
  • Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions



What this job requires:


  • 4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
  • Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
  • Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
  • Experience with Git and Docker


Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you‚Äôre interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.


What Zertificon offers you


  • Flexible working hours and home office possible
  • Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
  • Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
  • Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance

  • Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
  • Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 ‚Äì but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
  • Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
  • Great market potential worldwide

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you‚Äôre stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can‚Äôt wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: (Senior) Business Intelligence | Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Bei Superchat gestalten wir die Kommunikation zwischen Unternehmen und ihren Kund*innen neu. Unsere Mission ist klar: Die Kommunikation mit einem Unternehmen sollte so einfach und nat√ºrlich sein wie ein Gespr√§ch mit deinen Freunden.




Superchat ist aktuell stark am Wachsen und damit stehen viele spannende Themen an. Wir suchen dich als Unterst√ºtzung! üöÄ


So k√∂nnte dein Tag aussehen:



Du baust unsere erste BI-Infrastruktur und Reporting-Systeme auf, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu erm√∂glichen und unser Wachstum zu unterst√ºtzen


Du erstellst Datenpipelines und Modelle, die Daten effizient strukturieren und als Grundlage f√ºr Analysen und Berichte dienen


Du analysierst gro√üe Datens√§tze, √ºbersetzt sie in klare Insights und unterst√ºtzt damit wichtige Entscheidungen


Du arbeitest eng mit Stakeholdern zusammen, um L√∂sungen zu entwickeln und Fragen wie Marketing-Performance und ROI zu beantworten


Du f√ºhrst Experimente durch, analysierst die Ergebnisse und entwickelst daraus Wachstumsstrategien f√ºr Sales und Marketing

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of 70+ ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world's most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+ team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to learn more about what it's like to work here

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven't done before. You might just discover skills you didn't know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About you

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst, where you'll ensure our data is clean, accessible, and ready for analysis. As a core member of our analytics team, you‚Äôll ensure our data infrastructure effectively supports self-service analytics, insightful reporting, and business intelligence across the organization.Apply software engineering practices to analytics code, including version control, testing, and continuous integration.

What You‚Äôll Do üéØ


Design, build, and maintain clean, scalable, and performance-optimized data models using SQL and dbt.
Automate and streamline data validation, testing, and reporting processes.
Take ownership of data analysis for a designated domain, collaborating closely with Product Analysts, Data Scientists, and Business Stakeholders to meet their analytical and reporting needs.
Proactively monitor data integrity, identify issues, and perform root cause analysis.
Maintain comprehensive data documentation and definitions for easy reference and understanding.
Train business users on utilizing the data platform and data visualization tools effectively.


What You‚Äôll Bring üí°


Experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker to create insightful dashboards.
Strong experience in data engineering and analytics, with proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and performance optimization.
Knowledge of data validation, testing frameworks, and version control best practices (Git).
Familiarity with modern data stacks (dbt, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, Dagster/Airflow) and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP).
Excellent communication skills for training and supporting business users.
Ability to maintain detailed data documentation and definitions.


What Makes You a Great Fit üåü


Passionate about transforming data into actionable insights.
A detail-oriented problem-solver who excels in a collaborative environment.
Eager to innovate and continuously improve data processes.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? üöÄ


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to share in Almedia‚Äôs success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth‚Äîwhether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

  • Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
  • Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
  • Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.

We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth‚Äîwhether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 4+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!


With ‚Ç¨35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.




We believe in:





Common code access


No gatekeepers


Simplicity over industry standards


Embracing the small change


Each API is a product


Baked in quality





We‚Äôre looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.


Deine Aufgaben



Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.


Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.


Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.


Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.


Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.


Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.



Dein Profil



You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)


You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.


Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.


You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.


You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.


You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.


You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.


You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).



Benefits



Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.


Attractive & competitive compensation.


Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.


Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.


Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.


Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Title: Data Analyst - Dataiku
Description:
Headline Notes Before Application:

Hybrid Permanent Role In London - Salary ¬£40-50k

**MUST have Dataiku / SQL & PYTHON Experience**

Sector: Financial Services

No Graduate Visa's / Sponsorship Offered




We are recruiting for a Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless transition and efficient operation of data projects from the QA environment to production. In this role, you will be responsible for:




Issue Resolution & Escalation: Proactively resolving issues impacting critical data projects and escalating them when necessary.
Domain Expertise & Continuous Learning: Enhancing project outcomes through deep domain knowledge and fostering continuous learning within the team.
Service Monitoring & Data Insights: Utilising tools such as Dataiku, Alteryx, Tableau, and PowerBI to develop dashboards, monitor service metrics, and deliver actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Automation & Efficiency: Leveraging SQL, Python, and R to identify automation opportunities and streamline support and maintenance processes.
Documentation Management: Ensuring accurate and up-to-date documentation across processes, systems, and team structures.
Project Prioritisation & Promotion: Supporting project prioritisation and assisting in the controlled promotion of data projects from QA to production.
Backup & Disaster Recovery: Contributing to the development and implementation of robust backup and disaster recovery strategies.
Environment Health Checks: Conducting regular health checks on QA and production environments to guarantee system stability and optimal performance.

Knowledge and Experience

Experience with Alteryx: Essential for managing data workflows.
Software Delivery: Proven track record of delivering high-quality, unit-tested software within a commercial environment.
Design Principles: Practical experience in applying appropriate design patterns and principles.
Financial Sector Exposure: FX and broader financial knowledge is desirable, along with experience in financial systems.

Technical Skills

Data Engineering: Proficiency in using Alteryx and Dataiku
Data Visualisation: Experience with Tableau and PowerBI.
Programming: Strong coding skills in SQL, Python, and R.

Personal Attributes

Proactive: A self-starter with the ability to make an immediate and tangible impact.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous in ensuring precision and quality.
Resourceful: Capable of navigating challenges with innovative solutions.
Collaborative: Thrives in a team-based environment.
Innovative: Continuously seeks new ways to enhance processes and drive success.




Additional Information

This is a full-time, permanent position offering a hybrid working arrangement within the IT team based in the London office. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment, catering to a diverse mix of stakeholders and contributing to a rapidly evolving fintech landscape.




What You Get in Return

Along with a competitive salary, this role offers an attractive benefits package that includes private medical health insurance.

If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and join a leading fintech bank on its growth journey, we encourage you to apply and be part of a company that is redefining the future of payments.

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Job Title: Research Associate

Location: West London with hybrid working 2-3 days in the office.

Salary: ¬£28,000-36,000 per annum (depending on experience)




Are you passionate about data and market research? We‚Äôre seeking a Research Associate to join our dynamic research & consultancy business.




In this role, you‚Äôll undertake international research, analyse data, and contribute to insightful reports across the banking, retail technology, and payments sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in market intelligence.




What you‚Äôll do:

Conduct primary and secondary research, including surveys and executive interviews
Analyse data and produce reports for industry leaders
Contribute to newsletters and consulting projects
Work independently and as part of larger teams on global projects
Take on project management responsibilities as you progress




What we‚Äôre looking for:

Minimum two years' post-degree experience (not necessarily in research)
Strong writing, communication, and numerical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Language skills are a bonus in particular European languages




Why Join them?

This company are committed to supporting your professional development, offering a diverse and collaborative working environment. If you‚Äôre looking to develop a career in market intelligence, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.¬†

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).




We‚Äôre looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you‚Äôll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You‚Äôll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more.¬†




What you'll do:
You‚Äôll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10‚Äôs of billions of data points per day!!)
You‚Äôll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps.¬†
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You‚Äôll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you‚Äôll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love.¬†
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus








About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

  • Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
  • Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
  • Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________


Required Experience:

  • Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
  • Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
  • Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________


Benefits and Opportunities

  • Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
  • Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
  • Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
  • Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________


Candidate Profile:

  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
  • Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
  • Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
  • Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k-¬£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If you‚Äôre a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Power BI Reporting Analyst

Location: London, SW1E (hybrid working model)

Contract length: 4 months

Pay rate: ¬£250.00 per day




About the Company

Our client is a leading provider of innovative accounting software solutions, helping businesses streamline financial processes and make data-driven decisions. They are seeking a skilled Power BI Reporting Analyst to join their team and support their mission of delivering actionable insights through advanced data analytics.




Role Overview

The Power BI Reporting Analyst will play a crucial role in analyzing complex datasets, developing reports, and providing meaningful insights that drive business strategy. This individual will work closely with senior stakeholders, translating complex data findings into clear, understandable narratives. The role requires strong expertise in Power BI and SQL, with a focus on extracting, analyzing, and visualizing data to support decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets using SQL to support business needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights.
Identify trends, patterns, and insights to optimize business strategies and enhance product offerings.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders, including executives, to translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity while improving data processes and workflows.
Work cross-functionally with teams including Finance, Product, and Marketing to provide data-driven support.
Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in data analytics and visualization tools.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Power BI Reporting Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
Strong proficiency in Power BI for creating dashboards and reports.
Hands-on experience with SQL for data extraction, querying, and manipulation.
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear and actionable insights for senior stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and business intelligence tools is advantageous.
A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field is preferred, but candidates with relevant experience from any industry are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Exponential-e

Want to be part of a leading British-owned tech company? Established in 2002, we are achieving year on year revenue growth and reinvesting 95% of our profits back into our people and technology.







Your new role:

Collect, analyse, and interpret revenue operations data to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth
Working with the systems team, develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for leadership and revenue teams
Support revenue forecasting, pipeline analysis, and performance tracking
Ensure data integrity and consistency across the different platforms and tools
Conduct revenue analysis, churn analysis, and customer segmentation to improve retention and lifetime value (LTV)







What you‚Äôll need to succeed:

Degree in Data Analytics, Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field
Experience in data analysis, preferably in a Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or Marketing Analytics role
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Sisense, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Experience working with CRM platforms (Salesforce) and marketing automation tools







What we offer:

Involved in varied projects that make a positive impact on critical services on a local and national level
Range of employee initiatives on offer including the green team, employee forum, women‚Äôs network and culture club
Dedicated Learning and Development team and access to a range of training, courses and certification support
Comprehensive benefits including on-site cafe with free barista coffee, birthday leave, charity leave, vitality health cover and holiday purchase scheme to gain an extra 5 days leave!
