Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction

Main Responsibilities

The Data Analyst is a key role in our journey to becoming a data driven organisation. This is a key operational role, which supports the CIO and Head of Data (Framework Owner) responsibilities for development, implementation and day-to-day operation of Data Management Frameworks. Specifically, this involves activities related to metadata management, data harmonisation, data quality score carding, data quality issue analysis, data profiling and data lineage; thereby establishing data governance and ongoing maturity of the Bank's prioritised business outputs.

This role provides fundamental support and guidance for Information Area Owners and data stewards, as well as project teams to translate their data requirements (aligned to data policy and frameworks) into data outcomes using technical (profiling, mining, score carding) and business analysis skills. Ongoing impact is being made through the data analyst skillset where the ability to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions, work arounds and technical thinking, showcases the way forward for a more mature and holistic data service.

The role reports directly to the Data Technical Lead and is part of a team of data analysts responsible for embedding best practice data governance and quality practices across the Bank whilst also helping support the wider change initiatives across the organisation.


Analytical problem solving with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management.
Quantitative proficiency in order to work across multiple data sets and information areas.
Problem solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Detailed scrutiny of data transformations and Data lineage in order to operationalise the Ab Initio system.
Undertake activities to support the enterprise-wide data catalogue, to document business glossary definitions, taxonomies, ontologies and alignment to Handelsbanken Group conceptual data models and standards.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the metadata management system and data dictionaries, working collaboratively with data owners and their teams.
Document source to target technical data lineage and data quality controls along the data flow for reports and business outputs.
Analyse data quality root causes and understand business problems, partnering with business and technology teams to remediate data quality issues.
Build data outcomes using technical data profiling, mining, utilising data analysis skills.
Undertake quantitative analysis using Power BI, Excel and SQL experience to source, analyse, normalise and process data across multiple data sets.
Conduct data analysis to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions.
Interpret data flows and models to understand lineage gaps and resolve missing data quality controls.
Apply best practice data quality and metadata management principles to resolve data quality issues and address underlying causes.
Support the development of trusted sources for critical data, working with other stakeholders including data consumers, data producers, data owners and stewards to define requirements.


Ideal Candidate

Research (by Harvard University) shows that women are particularly likely to second guess themselves and not apply - so if you are worried you don't meet all the criteria, get in touch anyhow and let us do the worrying‚Ä¶


Be passionate about data quality and continuously strive to promote data quality through the development of system and process controls.
Apply technical thinking with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management
Demonstrate detailed scrutiny of technical and business data flows and transformations in order to operationalise data lineage management.
Demonstrate experience leading data management activities to implement data frameworks and establish data controls and monitor their effectiveness.
Experience of leading data quality initiatives that have provided tangible efficiencies and/or business value.
Experience of data quality management, master data management and reference data management
Working knowledge of statutory frameworks such as CCPA, GDPR, BCBS and Data Protection Act
Demonstrate experience of problem-solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Experience using data visualisation tools to present complex analysis is essential e.g. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView
Strong presentation skills both written and oral, experienced in presenting complex data concepts to a business audience i.e. running workshops and formal data governance meetings.
Knowledge and understanding of master data elements and processes, understanding of static versus transactional data challenges.
Experience and/or knowledge of data quality and lineage tools: Ad Initio, Collibra, Informatica, IBM MDM etc.
Experience of data modelling is ideal but not essential.


Company Information

Handelsbanken is a relationship bank with a decentralised way of working, a strong local presence thanks to a nationwide network of branches, and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a local business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a bespoke service. The focus is always on the need of the individual customer and not on the sale of specific products.

We are embarking on an exciting Business Transformation journey. This transformation will significantly enhance our technology system systems, processes and services, bringing evolution to our ways of working. Join us in this transformative journey, where your dedication, adaptability and commitment will play a crucial role in shaping the future of banking for our valued customers.

The Bank is deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities. This is so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work that encourages everyone to apply, regardless of socio-economic background, age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), veteran status, marital and civil partnership status, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Check our Handelsbanken website for further information

At Handelsbanken, we deeply value our unique culture and values including trust in and respect for each individual. We take pride in nurturing a work environment where people flourish, and where they are empowered to take decisions in their areas of expertise. We take a long term perspective in everything we do and want each employee who joins us to build a long terms successful career with the Bank.

What is in it for you?


We have a wide range of learning and development available, empowering and enabling our colleagues to take ownership of their own development.
Competitive Salary and an extensive range of benefits is provided, including private medical insurance, income protection and life assurance
A market-leading pension contribution of 15% paid by the bank, which can be invested in a wide range of funds (including ESG and Shariah funds)


Application next steps

Your journey with us begins once you have submitted your application. One of our Handelsbanken recruiters will be reviewing your details and will later organise a phone conversation if you match the role requirements. If there is a mutual fit, we will extend an invitation for you to participate in an interview.

There will be a combination of technical and competency based interviews.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process ‚Äì just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.

Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process ‚Äì just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst (Visa Sponsoring)
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst (Visa Sponsoring) | SaaS Scale-Up | ¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000 per annum | London, UK




About the Company:

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS scale-up based in London, employing a team of 50 talented professionals who are passionate about transforming industries through software innovation. They specialise in delivering advanced software solutions tailored to the needs of a diverse, expanding client base. Focused on staying ahead of the curve, the company leverages the latest technologies and fosters a culture of continuous improvement, establishing itself as a frontrunner in the SaaS field.




About the Role:

The Data Analyst role presents an exciting opportunity for individuals interested in data management and analysis. In this position, you‚Äôll be responsible for extracting, cleaning, and analysing large datasets to deliver actionable insights that inform business decisions and contribute to the development of top-tier SaaS products. With comprehensive training and development resources, this role allows you to grow your analytical abilities and become proficient with advanced data tools in a fast-paced, agile setting. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, detail-focused, and eager to drive data-informed decisions.




Responsibilities:

Extracting data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing this data in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine.
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Collaborating with engineering and product development teams to implement and refine data collection techniques.
Assisting in the design and implementation of databases and data collection systems.
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy in all analytics activities.
Participating in ongoing education and training to stay abreast of industry developments and advancements in data analysis tools and techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R) and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




Benefits:

A competitive salary range of ¬£40,000 to ¬£50,000 with potential for bonuses.
Extensive career development opportunities, including significant training in advanced data science techniques and tools.
Access to the latest tools and technologies in data science.
Regular team events, workshops, and networking opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Opportunity: Data Analyst




My client is renowned publisher looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role is pivotal in supporting both internal and external studio partners, focusing on data-driven strategies to enhance marketing and growth efforts for PC and Console titles.




Role Overview: You will be responsible for establishing robust data and reporting systems. By leveraging data and analytical expertise, the analyst will help shape marketing strategies, identify new opportunities, and address challenges. This role involves close collaboration with the marketing team, agency partners, and studios to provide actionable insights and recommendations.




Key Responsibilities:




Seamlessly integrate data from various systems to ensure accurate and consistent reporting.
Analyze the effectiveness of paid media campaigns and marketing initiatives to determine the most impactful tactics.
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards that offer insights into the success of growth and marketing efforts.
Ensure proper tracking mechanisms are in place for accurate attribution across PC and console platforms.
Transform raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
Work with the marketing team to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and forecast objectives.
Support the development of marketing attribution models and media mix models to optimize budget allocations.




Key Skills & Experience:




Relevant education in marketing and/or data analysis.
Over 2 years of experience in a marketing analytics role, preferably within the games industry.
Proficient in using Web Analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics).
Working knowledge of SQL and Python for data extraction and manipulation.
Advanced understanding of data integration from various sources, including CRM, web analytics, and paid media platforms.
Exceptional attention to detail to ensure consistent data quality across reports.
Proven ability to translate technical information into clear, actionable insights.
A passion for gaming and a strong understanding of industry trends and innovations.




Benefits:




Generous holiday allowance.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health/dental insurance and a pension plan.
Hybrid work setup with 2 days a week in the London office.




Equal Opportunities:




My client is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. They welcome candidates from all backgrounds and are dedicated to creating a positive work culture that embraces diversity, equality, and inclusion. All candidates must have the legal right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst, Category Development
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst in the Category Development team, you will support the rapid growth of our business by analysing our huge datasets to uncover insights that drive improvements across our category & supply chain performance.

You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo, and make high-impact recommendations. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won‚Äôt just support decisions‚Äîyou‚Äôll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that build our understanding of performance and customers, embedding these learnings into the Category & In-Stock team's day-to-day decision making.
Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights.
Influence both strategic and tactical decision-making in our EU Leadership and Category Management teams through strong communication, and by proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Build the necessary models and tools to inform our pricing strategies, helping Category Managers maintain a competitive position versus our competitors while maximising margin opportunity.
Provide clear insight into the value and success of different buying policies we have built into our Stock Ordering Tool to ensure we are hitting the target levels of Waste and Availability.
Partner with our Customer Insights team, supporting them with their customer and competitor research projects and helping to embed learnings into the Category teams.
Partner with our MFC Operations team to ensure that inventory compliance reporting & capacity tooling are providing In-Stock team with correct insights they can use to adjust their buying decisions.
Proactively build and nurture a culture of data-driven decision making through coaching & supporting teams to increase their data literacy and confidence.


You Have:


3-5 years of experience in analytics or data science - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, supply chain.
A strong understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design.
Expert skills in SQL / Python, able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets.
Experience with dbt is a strong plus
Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience with Looker and LookML in particular is strongly preferred.
A strong and confident communication style, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
A high degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.


Benefits:


Company RSU‚Äôs (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
Rakuten Viber is one of the most popular and downloaded apps in the world. Working with us provides a unique opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of our users and to be part of the journey that makes us a super-app. Our mission is to make people‚Äôs lives easier by enabling meaningful connections, from precious moments with family and friends, through managing business relationships to pursuing their passions.

Our Data Analyst team provides insights on how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Business Solutions unit and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker, etc.) and a business mindset.

Responsibilities:


Deliver cutting-edge analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels, and analytical functions
Report on key performance metrics against targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Liaise with stakeholders, such as Product, Marketing, Analytics and Data Science teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in improving user experiences
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports, and data models


Requirements:


4-5 years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Knowledge of A/B testing principles and statistical analysis techniques
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field


Advantages:


Experience in product analytics role with driving impact and shaping product direction
Experience with Python and ETL
Experience with simple ML algorithms and technical skills

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
Job description:

¬†

Job Title: ESG Data Analyst

Corporate Title: Analyst

Reporting to: Head of Investment (Equity)

Department: Nomura Asset Management - Equity

¬†

¬†

Company Overview

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning approximately 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Wealth Management, Investment Management, and Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking). Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Department Overview

Nomura Asset Management UK Global Equity team manages a range of mainly developed market Global Equity portfolios on behalf of retail & institutional clients to a total of around $7bn assets under management. The process is highly team-oriented, and Research Analyst recommendations have significant impact on portfolio decisions. ESG analysis is integrated into the investment process of our NAM UK Global Equity team and a significant amount of asset under management is in ESG/Sustainability strategies (SFDR 9 & 8).

¬†

¬†

Role Overview

You will support and help implement the overall ESG analysis, strategy and reporting as part of the team and working closely with our Sustainable Investment specialist. This role is integral to our increasing ESG footprint with clients, and ideally, we are looking for a highly motivated candidate that has a blend of initial ESG experience (independent of background) and solid data/analysis skills. If you are motivated to making a real contribution to this team‚Äôs ESG strategy, this is the right position for you.

¬†

¬†

Main Duties and Responsibilities

Working with our Sustainable Investment Specialist, support the implementation of the team‚Äôs sustainability strategy with respect to our Global Equity Funds.
Identify areas for improvement and solutions for better ESG integration into the investment process.
Support stock analysts in ESG analysis and monitoring of ESG controversies and risks.
Support our Engagement and Proxy Voting process, with Investee companies across the Team.
Help maintain, analyse, and report Engagement and Proxy voting databases and assist with report writing for both internal and external stakeholders.
Support the collection of data, measurement of investee companies‚Äô impact through products and services and report writing.
Support Climate reporting and analysis.
Assist and medium-term take on own topical engagement/collaboration projects on specific ESG/Impact issues.
Help to improve current ESG procedures, including data collection, analysis, monitoring, and reporting.
Support responses to internal and external ESG specific client queries.
Adhere to the NAM code of conduct and all regulatory requirements.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Skills & Experience

Ideally a couple of years of experience in an ESG role, in an Investment, Corporate or ESG data provider organisation.
Ideally Bachelor/Postgraduate in a Sustainability related topic; post graduate ESG qualifications a plus.
Some familiarity with ESG concepts, data, Climate, ESG reporting etc.
Experience in managing database/reporting tasks; ideally some experience with MSCI, ISS, Sustainalytics data.
Self-organisation and self-motivation.
Attention to detail.
Clear and concise communication.
Interest in investment.
MS Office, particularly Excel; ideally some database knowledge.

¬†

Attributes

Genuine passion for environmental and social issues and for exploring how to help better bring this into real world practice from an investment function.
Enthusiastic and motivated team player.
Willingness to learn and take on responsibility.

¬†

Nomura competencies¬†

¬†

Trusted Partner¬†

Acquire professional behaviours and foundational skills¬†
Communicate to others with respect¬†
Acquire basic knowledge and skills necessary for the role¬†
Continue to engage in self-improvement activities as a financial service professional¬†

¬†

Entrepreneurial leadership ¬†

Perform all tasks proactively with a sense of ownership¬†

¬†

Teamwork & Collaboration

Acquire professional behaviours and communication skills¬†
Seek advice from senior colleagues and act accordingly¬†

¬†

Influence¬†

Understand the role, responsibilities and business strategy and act accordingly¬†

¬†

Integrity ¬†

Understand the significance and importance of corporate philosophy, professional ethics, compliance risk management and code of conduct.

¬†

¬†

Right to Work

The UK Government have taken steps to reduce net migration to the UK by limiting the number of overseas workers from outside the EEA coming to the UK for employment. Please note that whilst we are able to consider applications from overseas workers from outside the EEA (who require a Tier 2 (General) visa) we can only employ them if we can provide evidence that there are no other suitable candidates for this vacancy from inside the EEA.

Please contact us if you are visiting our offices and require any form of personal assistance or physical adaptations to be provided for your appointment. A member of staff will be happy to help.

¬†

¬†

Diversity Statement

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. If you require any assistance or reasonable adjustments due to a disability or long-term health condition, please do not hesitate to contact us.

¬†

Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Show more

  • Self-organisation and self-motivation.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Clear and concise communication.
  • Interest in investment.
  • MS Office, particularly Excel; ideally some database knowledge.

 

Attributes

  • Genuine passion for environmental and social issues and for exploring how to help better bring this into real world practice from an investment function.
  • Enthusiastic and motivated team player.
  • Willingness to learn and take on responsibility.

 

Nomura competencies 

 

Trusted Partner 

  • Acquire professional behaviours and foundational skills 
  • Communicate to others with respect 
  • Acquire basic knowledge and skills necessary for the role 
  • Continue to engage in self-improvement activities as a financial service professional 

 

Entrepreneurial leadership  

  • Perform all tasks proactively with a sense of ownership 

 

Teamwork & Collaboration

  • Acquire professional behaviours and communication skills 
  • Seek advice from senior colleagues and act accordingly 

 

Influence 

  • Understand the role, responsibilities and business strategy and act accordingly 

 

Integrity  

  • Understand the significance and importance of corporate philosophy, professional ethics, compliance risk management and code of conduct.

 

 

Right to Work

The UK Government have taken steps to reduce net migration to the UK by limiting the number of overseas workers from outside the EEA coming to the UK for employment. Please note that whilst we are able to consider applications from overseas workers from outside the EEA (who require a Tier 2 (General) visa) we can only employ them if we can provide evidence that there are no other suitable candidates for this vacancy from inside the EEA.

Please contact us if you are visiting our offices and require any form of personal assistance or physical adaptations to be provided for your appointment. A member of staff will be happy to help.

 

 

Diversity Statement

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. If you require any assistance or reasonable adjustments due to a disability or long-term health condition, please do not hesitate to contact us.

 

Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Data Analyst, Company Intelligence
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - Company Intelligence

Employment Type: Full-time

Comp: Circa ¬£35K Basic Salary +Bonus

Location: Fully remote

Company: STOIX




About Us: STOIX is a challenger brand within Finance Executive Search and Interim Management. We combine best-in-class RecTech and AI with top quality human talent to support our clients in making truly transformative hires. Our mission is simple: to redefine the search experience. We reject traditional and unimaginative methodologies that often yield disappointing outcomes. A certified B Corp, we believe that it is possible to do good business whilst behaving with integrity. We work in a smart and flexible way, providing our clients and candidates with a high quality service whilst maintaining a healthy balance that allows our team to live life to the fullest.




Role Overview: We are seeking a data driven individual to join our fast growing, dynamic team! The Data Analyst - Company Intelligence plays a crucial role in building out a new client service for STOIX. STOIX has been helping our clients grow by hiring best in class people, and we now also partner with select clients to support their decision making around potential acquisitions. Additionally this position is responsible for gathering, organizing, and interpreting complex data to provide strategic insights that inform candidate sourcing and client engagement.




Key Responsibilities:

Company Data Acquisition and Management:

Conduct comprehensive research to gather relevant data on target companies, including organizational structures, financial performance, industry trends, and competitive landscapes.
Maintain and update a robust database of company information, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Utilize various data sources and tools to extract and compile information efficiently.

Data Analysis and Interpretation:

Analyze company data to identify key trends, patterns, and insights that are relevant to assignments.
Develop and generate reports and presentations that effectively communicate findings to internal stakeholders.
Create detailed organizational charts and company maps to visualize relationships and hierarchies.

Strategic Support:

Provide strategic insights by identifying potential candidate pools and target companies.
Assist in the development of client presentations and proposals by providing data-driven market intelligence.
Contribute to the development of best practices for data collection and analysis.

Data integrity:

Ensure that all data is kept up to date, and that data is entered in a correct way.
Work to make sure that any data that is collected is done so in a way that is compliant with data protection laws.




Qualifications:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, databases).
Excellent research and information gathering abilities.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
An interest in business and how companies work




Why us?:

Competitive salary and benefits package. However much we love the job, money matters and we have a compensation scheme that rewards our people for the hard work that they put in.
Flexibility. We love what we do, but we all have lives and responsibilities outside of work and we provide a working environment that supports that.
Culture. We are a diverse group of individuals that bring different skills and experience to the business and genuinely enjoy working together. Though driven and ambitious, we work as a team and believe that, by working collaboratively with each other, we all enjoy work more and get better results for our clients and our business.
Reputation. We are still a young firm but have a great reputation to maintain. Our clients love working with us and we maintain a 100% record of delivery on retained mandates.
We do things differently! We are constantly learning and growing and are keen to hire people with ideas to bring to the table. If you have best in class skills in the executive search industry and want to leverage them in a forward-thinking, collaborative and fast-growing business, then get in touch.




We‚Äôre passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. Companies that are diverse in age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and perspective are proven to be better companies. More importantly, creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work is the right thing to do

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme‚ÄØ

Locations: London

Starting Salary: ¬£28,000‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject Experience in analysing data.
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants.‚ÄØ

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Graduate Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:Working as a Data Science Analyst, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at ¬£28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.
Show more

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of London‚Äôs largest property maintenance teams. We‚Äôre always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. We‚Äôre looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. You‚Äôll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst ‚Äî Foodbuy

Foodbuy is a leading food procurement organisation based in the UK. With over ¬£1 billion of managed spend, we bring together the widest range of foodservice and hospitality clients to buy food and everything associated with it. We work closely with our clients to deliver expert procurement services, saving them time and money and enabling them to focus on what really matters to their businesses.

We are offering an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Junior Data Analyst, supporting NHS Supply Chain: Food. You will work closely with experienced professionals across supply chain and procurement, gaining valuable knowledge and experience while contributing to initiatives that directly impact patient feeding across the NHS.

Key Responsibilities


Process large amounts of raw data from multiple sources, cleansing, collating, and preparing it for upload to data warehouse systems (Cognos)
Identify data issues and communicate them to relevant teams or suppliers to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Create customer-facing switching templates using the prepared data to highlight savings opportunities
Use business intelligence tools such as Cognos BI and Power BI to develop dashboards and reporting templates
Interpret and present data insights to drive commercial and strategic objectives
Produce monthly customer and client-facing reports to support business performance, growth, and savings targets
Collaborate with procurement, account management, and finance teams to understand requirements and deliver effective analytical solutions
Provide ad-hoc data analysis for stakeholders across the business



Skills And Experience Required


Strong numerical and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail
Ability to analyse and evaluate large volumes of data from multiple sources
Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge, including pivot tables and complex formulas
Organised and able to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Effective communicator with the ability to collaborate across functions
Creative thinker with a continuous improvement mindset



What We Offer

We value our people and offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:


Contributory pension scheme
Career development through Career Pathways and MyLearning programmes
Digital GP access for you and your family, plus wider healthcare benefits
Exclusive travel discounts with TUI, Expedia, Booking.com, and more
Supermarket discounts at Tesco, Sainsbury's, Morrisons, and others
Up to 44% off cinema tickets
Cash rewards every time you spend, redeemable with top brands
Free wellness, mindfulness, and exercise classes
The ability to share discounts and offers with friends and family

Title: Data Analyst - Remote (UK)
Description:
About Us

At Dines, our mission is simple yet powerful: 'To serve those who serve.' We empower hospitality businesses with a cutting-edge POS and payments platform, helping renowned festivals, events, theatres, and restaurants across the UK and Ireland operate seamlessly.

We're more than just a technology provider√¢‚Ç¨‚Äùwe're a trusted partner built on three pillars: Relationships, Service, and Delivery. Our clients love us because we genuinely have their backs, and we take pride in being there when they need us most.

As we continue to grow, we're looking for passionate individuals who share our vision and want to be part of something exciting. We'd love to hear from you if you thrive in a fast-paced, team-driven environment where your work directly impacts businesses.

The Role

As a Data Analyst, you'll transform big data into actionable insights for leading food and beverage (F&B) businesses. Your work will directly impact how festivals, restaurants, and theatres make decisions, making you a key player in the industry.

This is a hands-on role that requires accuracy, insight, and problem-solving. You'll work closely with developers, clients, and internal teams, ensuring data integrity and helping businesses make informed, data-driven decisions.

What You'll Do


Ensure data accuracy ‚Äì Ensure the accurate flow of data and collaborate with developers to maintain data integrity.
Build dashboards & reports ‚Äì Use QuickSight and other tools to simplify complex data for clients.
Investigate customer data queries ‚Äì Provide clear, accurate resolutions to client concerns.
Support internal teams ‚Äì Deliver insights to improve company strategies and decision-making.
Write & refine SQL queries ‚Äì Manage large datasets efficiently to extract meaningful insights.


What We're Looking For


Detail-oriented ‚Äì Ensures data accuracy and integrity.
Problem-solver ‚Äì Tackles complex data challenges effectively.
Proactive & curious ‚Äì Continuously improves processes and uncovers insights.
Clear communicator ‚Äì Translates data into actionable insights for all teams.
Adaptable & independent ‚Äì Thrives in a fast-paced, self-driven environment.
Team player ‚Äì Collaborates across departments to drive decisions.
SQL proficiency & data analysis ‚Äì Strong analytical skills with SQL capabilities.
F&B experience is a plus ‚Äì Passion for data matters most; industry knowledge can be learned.


Why Join Dines?


Remote & Flexible: Work from anywhere in the UK and up to 30 days abroad annually.
Generous Leave: 30 days plus eight public holidays (five of which are flexible).
Personal Budgets: Invest in your well-being, learning, and workspace.
Impactful Work: Play a key role in shaping how top hospitality brands succeed.


Next Steps

After Reviewing Applications (please Submit a Cover Letter Along With Your CV!), We Will Invite Selected Candidates To Our Interview Process, Designed To Be Efficient And Engaging


Initial chat with People Operations
Interview with a Senior Leader
Final discussion with a Co-Founder


Ready to make an impact? Join Dines and help shape the future of hospitality tech!
Show more

  • Support internal teams ‚Äì Deliver insights to improve company strategies and decision-making.
  • Write & refine SQL queries ‚Äì Manage large datasets efficiently to extract meaningful insights.

What We're Looking For

  • Detail-oriented ‚Äì Ensures data accuracy and integrity.
  • Problem-solver ‚Äì Tackles complex data challenges effectively.
  • Proactive & curious ‚Äì Continuously improves processes and uncovers insights.
  • Clear communicator ‚Äì Translates data into actionable insights for all teams.
  • Adaptable & independent ‚Äì Thrives in a fast-paced, self-driven environment.
  • Team player ‚Äì Collaborates across departments to drive decisions.
  • SQL proficiency & data analysis ‚Äì Strong analytical skills with SQL capabilities.
  • F&B experience is a plus ‚Äì Passion for data matters most; industry knowledge can be learned.

Why Join Dines?

  • Remote & Flexible: Work from anywhere in the UK and up to 30 days abroad annually.
  • Generous Leave: 30 days plus eight public holidays (five of which are flexible).
  • Personal Budgets: Invest in your well-being, learning, and workspace.
  • Impactful Work: Play a key role in shaping how top hospitality brands succeed.

Next Steps

After Reviewing Applications (please Submit a Cover Letter Along With Your CV!), We Will Invite Selected Candidates To Our Interview Process, Designed To Be Efficient And Engaging

  • Initial chat with People Operations
  • Interview with a Senior Leader
  • Final discussion with a Co-Founder

Ready to make an impact? Join Dines and help shape the future of hospitality tech!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì AI & Ad Performance Insights

¬£45,000 - ¬£55,000 base

‚ÄºÔ∏èLocation: Office-based (4 days per week near Liverpool St, London), with flexibility for customer and prospect meetings.




An innovative AI-driven SaaS company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their team and play a key role in transforming digital advertising. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data, AI, and product strategy, with a clear path to Product Ownership.




What You'll Do

Automate and enhance prospect account analysis to accelerate deal cycles
Assess digital advertising accounts using commercial, industry, and AI adoption insights
Develop Python-based analytics to measure performance and AI effectiveness
Standardise key metrics for paid media efficiency, AI scoring, and industry benchmarking
Build automation pipelines to reduce manual analysis and surface insights instantly
Work with engineers to productise automated performance assessments
Engage with sales and customers to translate data insights into business impact
Influence product direction by identifying AI automation and reporting opportunities




What We‚Äôre Looking For

1 year+ technical Skills: Python, SQL, data visualisation (they use Shiny, but open to Looker, Tablaeau, matplotlib)
Communication: Ability to present insights and bridge technical analysis with commercial goals - storytelling and gravitas.
Ad-Tech & Analytics: Experience with Google Ads APIs, marketing automation - must have

Added bonus for:

AI & Product Thinking: Passion for AI-driven decision-making and structured analytical models
SaaS B2B start up exposure.




Why Join

Pathway to Product Ownership ‚Äì grow from data analyst to AI-driven product leader
Hands-on exposure to cutting-edge automation and decision intelligence
Work across Product, Sales, and Engineering in a hybrid, high-impact role
Join a fast-growing, dynamic environment where innovation and collaboration drive success




If you're passionate about AI, analytics, and automation, apply now and be part of the future of AI-driven advertising.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL / Python
Description:
We‚Äôd all like amazing work to do, and real work-life balance. That‚Äôs waiting for you at Sainsbury‚Äôs. We‚Äôre one of the biggest supermarkets in the UK with one of the largest websites. So marketing here really happens at scale. We move a lot faster than you‚Äôd think too, across Brand Planning, Brand Comms and Creative, Digital Marketing, CRM and Loyalty, Nectar 360, Insights, and Corporate Responsibility and Sustainability. More people shopping with us each week means more interactions. And thanks to data insight, we understand customers in a way that almost nobody else does. We work alongside incredible brand partners and the best agencies around. So if you have a passion to learn, grow and experience new teams, come and explore it all with us.

Sainsburys Data and Analytics - Data Analyst - SQL / Python - Hybrid Working/London Based

We are a multi-channel, multi-brand business serving millions of customers a day, with the UK‚Äôs largest loyalty scheme and an ever-evolving set of digital platforms. This equals over 1.2 billion transactions a year, presenting a volume, depth, and complexity of data that few can match.

We have one of the most exciting data sets in the country, from the insights gained, we build scalable, high-performance products using innovative technology that give our customers an amazing shopping experience e.g., our award-winning Smartshop app. In an inclusive, agile environment, you will have the space to be curious, to experiment, and to solve real-world challenges. And you will get to see your creations in the hands of millions of people across the UK.

In the Data & Analytics function you will stretch the imagination of what the power of data and insights can bring to how we do things. You will help to unlock the value of Sainsbury‚Äôs enormous multi-brand, multi-channel data asset. We are a team of data analysts dedicated to providing analytical solutions and actionable insights that support the strategic goals of our business.

What you‚Äôll do:

Sitting within Sainsbury‚Äôs Data & Analytics function you will work as a member of the Strategic Projects Analytics team.

We are committed to building innovative products, fostering experimentation, and promoting collaboration and transparency.


Liaise closely with members of Food Commercial & Retail.
Apply your analytical skills together with business knowledge of how we operate to investigate root causes of issues, uncover opportunities for optimisation and measure the impact of change projects.
Own projects, develop & maintain relationships with your stakeholders, championing a collaborative approach to requirements gathering and the formation of compelling analysis.
Move at pace, whilst still delivering high quality, accurate, professional outputs that land the real truths that sit within the data. You will proactively ensure you are always in touch with the ‚ÄòWhy‚Äô behind every project ‚Äì understanding the purpose of your analysis, and which decisions the business is looking to inform.
Deliver insights and recommendations through high quality data storytelling. We love data and deriving value from it. The key to the value is in being able to build and tell compelling stories based on this data.
Embrace our values of Owning It, Making it Better and Being Human.


What You Need To Know And Show


A highly numerate background. You may have a degree in mathematics, statistics or another analytical subject or analytical work experience.
SQL and Python knowledge is essential.
A proven history of delivering actionable insights and demonstrable business change through the application of analytics.
Brilliant communication skills, having the ability to explain complex information in simple terms.
An inquisitive mind, with the curiosity to be constantly on the lookout for opportunities and the ability to logically solve problems.
High attention to detail.
The ability to partner brilliantly with the business to understand their problems and deliver value, applying commercial acumen and communicating/connecting in a compelling way.
Keen to learn and develop. Proactive about driving your career development and progression.
A high level of team contribution ‚Äì looking for opportunities to provide input and support across the wider analytics community.


We are committed to being a truly inclusive retailer so you‚Äôll be welcomed whoever you are and wherever you work. Around here, there‚Äôs always the chance to try something new ‚Äî whether that‚Äôs as part of an evolving team or somewhere else across the business - and we take development seriously and promise to support you. We also recognise and celebrate colleagues when they go the extra mile and, where possible, offer flexible working. When you join our team, we‚Äôll also offer you an amazing range of benefits. Here are some of them:

‚ÄØ

Starting off with colleague discount, you'll be able to save 10% on your shopping online and instore at Sainsbury's, Argos, TU and Habitat, and we regularly increase the discount to 15% at points during the year. We've also got you covered for your future with our pensions scheme and life cover. You'll also be able to share in our success as you may be eligible for a performance-related bonus of up to 10% of salary, depending on how we perform.

‚ÄØ

Your wellbeing is important to us too. You'll receive an annual holiday allowance and you can buy up to an additional week's holiday. We also offer other benefits that will help your money go further such as season ticket loans, cycle to work scheme, health cash plans, salary advance (where you can access some of your pay before pay day) as well access to a great range of discounts from hundreds of other retailers. And if you ever need it there is also an employee assistance programme.

‚ÄØ

Moments that matter are as important to us as they are to you which is why we give up to 26 weeks‚Äô pay for maternity or adoption leave and up to 4 weeks‚Äô pay for paternity leave.

‚ÄØ

Please see www.sainsburys.jobs for a range of our benefits (note, length of service and eligibility criteria may apply).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Treasury Risk Solutions (TRS) team provides treasury management services and solutions to companies, including foreign exchange, commodities and rates hedging, and cash flow management solutions. As an embedded Analyst within TRS, you will deliver technical and analytical expertise to support a data-driven culture within TRS and the Specialist Bank. Your key responsibility will be to build processes that extract, manipulate, and visualise data, enabling the business to make informed, data-driven decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Deliver data analysis to business stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making and keeping them informed about business insights and performance.
Create interactive data visualisations using Power BI, collaborating with business teams to formulate KPIs and appropriate measures.
Migrate existing analytics processes to Power BI and the Microsoft Azure platform, where possible.
Develop a deep understanding of each business area to assist with day-to-day procedures, provide revenue generation insights, conduct cost reduction analysis, and enhance efficiency.
Engage with revenue-generating and business-enabling teams to understand their reporting and analytics requirements, converting these into actionable outputs.
Manage stakeholder expectations through clear and frequent communication, ensuring outputs are fit for purpose.
Document all processes and outputs created, actively monitor data and reporting processes, and investigate appropriate fixes in the event of process failures.
Collaborate with the Platform and Data Engineering Team to source all data from the ‚ÄúOne Data Platform‚Äù (ODP), identifying any sources not currently included and working with engineering to integrate them.




Core Skills and Knowledge:




Career Background: Do you have entrenched experience within the data and analytics function or industry? Do you have a proven track record of delivering data-driven business analysis? Can you share examples of how you have delivered impactful data-driven business analysis?
Technical Skills: Are you proficient in SQL and other languages needed to extract data? How skilled are you in data visualisation tools, especially Power BI? What experience do you have with Microsoft Azure Cloud-based tools such as Data Bricks, Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Analysis Services? Have you utilised Python in your previous roles?
Educational Background: Do you hold a Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a numerical, computer science, or financial discipline?
Analytical Skills: How do you interpret complex information to spot trends and "tell a story" back to the business? Can you provide examples of how you distil stakeholder requirements into succinct questions and deliver timely, actionable insights?
Communication Skills: How do you adapt your communication style to engage effectively with different audiences? Can you describe a situation where your influencing skills made a significant impact?
Project Management: Are you able to self-manage research, design, prioritise, implement, and deliver projects efficiently? How do you ensure that your projects are completed on time?
Personal Attributes: Are you willing to learn new tools and skills quickly? What motivates your commitment to follow projects through to completion, and how do you maintain attention to detail in your work?




We are looking for someone who is honest, punctual, takes initiative, and possesses a questioning mindset. If you have the innate drive to improve processes and foster collaboration across the Bank, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

¬£35,000 - ¬£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst (Excel specialist)
Description:
My client, a leading cloud-native global payments processor, with a multi-cloud platform offering is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team.




This is a contract position. It will be an initial 3 months and will be Inside IR35. It will be a hybrid position offering flexible working (2/3 days per week in their central London office).




Role overview: We are seeking someone who understands complex data and can break down data from pricing structures, in different countries, and onboarded at different times (Some are mature and some are early stage). You will be presenting the Data to senior stakeholders whilst also answering questions backed by the data (Break down the data simply for easy explanations).




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business improvement.
Develop and maintain Excel-based dashboards, reports, and data models for key stakeholders.
Utilize Power Query and VBA to automate data processing and reporting workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights.
Validate and clean data to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Support ad hoc reporting and analysis requests from internal teams.
Optimize Excel spreadsheets for better performance and efficiency.
Assist in integrating Excel-based reports with other analytical tools or databases.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the payments or fintech industry.
Expert-level proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, Power Query, VBA, and advanced formulas.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Experience with data visualisation techniques in Excel and other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is a plus.
Familiarity with SQL and database structures is an advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Operations Analyst

Hybrid (3 days + in)

London

Interim (6 months +)




Halliday Marx have exclusively partnered with a Financial Services data driven M&A advisor to hire a new Interim Dashboard builkding specialist.




Job Requirements:




Work closely with Commercial Ops Director, Chief Revenue Officer, CEO, Chief Content Officer, Marketing to monitor and report on business strategies, revenue growth, and KPIs to establish strategic operational priorities.

Collaborate to provide in-depth business analytics to inform planning and other strategic decisions

Create and maintain customised, intricate dashboards and automated reporting tools related to sales, customer success, marketing and product usage performance metrics

Support business reporting

Develop processes, workflows, and incentive programs

Provide ongoing training and guidance to use of the Tech stack including Sales Force, HubSpot.

Ability to work collaboratively and independently.







You Need to Have:




Good experience of working in B2B subscriptions business or SaaS environment

Salesforce experience

Advanced Excel

Financial and revenue modelling

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Results oriented, attention to detail, ability to prioritise multiple objectives and projects

Excellent communication skills

London

Interim (6 months +)


Halliday Marx have exclusively partnered with a Financial Services data driven M&A advisor to hire a new Interim Dashboard builkding specialist.


Job Requirements:


Work closely with Commercial Ops Director, Chief Revenue Officer, CEO, Chief Content Officer, Marketing to monitor and report on business strategies, revenue growth, and KPIs to establish strategic operational priorities.

Collaborate to provide in-depth business analytics to inform planning and other strategic decisions

Create and maintain customised, intricate dashboards and automated reporting tools related to sales, customer success, marketing and product usage performance metrics

Support business reporting

Develop processes, workflows, and incentive programs

Provide ongoing training and guidance to use of the Tech stack including Sales Force, HubSpot.

Ability to work collaboratively and independently.



You Need to Have:


Good experience of working in B2B subscriptions business or SaaS environment

Salesforce experience

Advanced Excel

Financial and revenue modelling

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Results oriented, attention to detail, ability to prioritise multiple objectives and projects

Excellent communication skills

Title: Insight Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.

With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, Bally's will own and/or manage 15 casinos across 10 states. Bally‚Äôs also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana.

Well, what about the team?

The Insights team is an integral and fast expanding and global department within Bally‚Äôs interactive. Working in a globally facing role across multiple areas of the business, you will support decision making by using data to provide actionable recommendations, empowering key stakeholders to make better decisions and drive business performance.

As an Insight Analyst you will implement varying analytical techniques and tools to provide the business with actionable insights that will drive us forward. Experience with SQL and Excel are essential and understanding of tools such as Python and Big Query are beneficial but not crucial. Experience in conducting financial analysis, modelling and forecasting are also beneficial for this role.

We are looking for a self-driven, proactive & resourceful candidate. This role offers the opportunity to work directly with key decision makers and senior stakeholders at Bally‚Äôs, and provide support and guidance on business strategy. This role reports to the Executive Director - Strategic Insights,

So, what will you be doing?


Using SQL to produce in-depth analysis of data from multiple sources, to understand patterns in customer behaviour and providing actionable recommendations.
Conducting ROI valuations for business initiatives & product developments to assist with internal technology prioritisation.
Reviewing the performance of the business‚Äô core KPIs and highlight any unusual trends.
Managing and maintaining ongoing forecasts, proactively seeking and evaluating opportunities for growth or profit optimisation.
Communicating and presenting findings to the team and senior stakeholders.
Keeping up to date with market trends and competitor innovations.


And what are we looking for?


Have experience as an Analyst with an understanding, or personal interest in the remote gaming market.
Have excellent modelling, analytical and numerical capabilities.
Possess advanced knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Possess the ability to form actionable recommendations from analysis.
Have high attention to detail and proficiency in report writing.
Be a confident communicator both verbally and written.
Be proactive with an ability to work independently, multi task, and manage multiple deadlines.
Be self-driven, resourceful, and ambitious.


This Is What You'll Get

Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here‚Äôs a taste of what may be on offer:


Annual leave
Annual bonus
Pension plan
Health insurance
Company share scheme
Volunteering days
Home office allowance
Wellness or Gym allowance


DNA / Values

At Bally‚Äôs Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!

We are Always Ready to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that You Make the Difference, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are All One Team, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are Learning Every Day by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally‚Äôs we Love to Lead by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.

Equal Opportunities

At Bally‚Äôs Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.

We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.


Show more
