Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Story

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organization that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organization. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.

Why Work For Us

We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work ‚Äì our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights, so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.

As a Data Analyst for the Professional Advisory Business Group you will report into the group‚Äôs Chief Operating Officer and Managing Director. You will work closely with the Market Intelligence, Valuation, Healthcare, Student Accommodation, Leisure and Hotels team that is spread around the UK with a focus on data analysis, extraction, visualisation and monitoring to provide innovative solutions when presented with large data sets.

Leveraging your understanding and passion for data analytics, the successful candidate will take proactive ownership of key data sets from across the Professional Advisory Business Group and have a positive impact on internal workflow, process optimisation and real estate market knowledge.


Compile, analyse and take ownership of multiple internal data sets within the Professional Advisory Business Group and wider company using ETL processes and a strong understanding of SQL platforms.
Design and build comprehensive models drawing from multiple data sets using excel, SAAS platforms and API‚Äôs.
Research, compile and extract inflowing real estate market data, utilising a strong knowledge of visualisation tools.
Produce deep dive data analysis into group KPI‚Äôs that positively influence the trajectory of the teams‚Äô roadmap.
Identify and close data gaps that will have a positive impact on workflow and process optimisation.
You can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, translating requirements into strong technical solutions.
You can communicate concepts, ideas and solutions to stakeholders across seniority levels in person within the business group and the wider company.
Work collaboratively with external stakeholders to reach effective solutions that will benefit the business group and the wider company.
Degree qualified with strong quantitative/analytical ability and attention to detail.
Excellent excel modelling skills.
Strong understanding and use of data visualisation tools. Previous use of Power BI is preferred.
Ability to interpret and draw conclusions from data sets and present findings to stakeholders in an accessible way.
Experience with extracting/transform/load (ETL) processes, SAAS platforms and API‚Äôs.
Strong understanding and utilisation of SQL databases.
Foundation knowledge of Python and/or R.
Take a proactive approach to problem solving, taking full ownership across the lifespan of a project.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly explain concepts concisely to stakeholders within the business group and wider company.
Ability to prioritise tasks and manage time effectively.


At Avison Young, we‚Äôve always put people at the heart of what we do.

In the last few years, we‚Äôve increased the diversity at our board, leadership and Principal levels. Avison Young stands out for our commitment to empowering women. In addition to increasing the number of women on our board and in our leadership ranks, our internal Women‚Äôs Network of more than 500 members come together for networking and learning, and advise the business on strategies for promoting access, opportunity and inclusion in our industry.

Our global DEI steering committee shapes our strategy to continue to increase industry access for underrepresented groups and accelerating initiatives led by our employee resource groups, including our Women‚Äôs Network, Black Professionals and LGBTQ+ groups. In addition to leading global initiatives, the steering committee‚Äôs work examines our policies and practices, creating accountability for results and communicating progress to our executive leadership, our clients and our communities.

Our Culture Is Underpinned By Our Approach To Diversity, Inclusion, And Well-being. We Are Committed To Building An Inclusive Culture That


empowers all our employees to thrive,
reflects all backgrounds and talents,
allows individuals to be successful and feel a sense of belonging,
and foster a workplace that is supported, inclusive and has a strong sense of community between colleagues.


Avison Young is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all its employees and job applicants equitably. This includes implementing deliberate strategies that advance underrepresented communities in commercial real estate careers.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to removing any obstacles to inclusion. If you need any adjustments to support your application or any part of the recruitment process, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or you are eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us at careers.uk@avisonyoung.comcareers.uk@avisonyoung.com> and we will do everything we can to help.

We are committed to inclusion in our hiring processes, and we want to give everyone a chance to show what they can bring to our organisation. If you are not sure that you have all the skills in the person specification, please still apply. We value passion and potential in our employees, so it would be great to hear from you and why you would suit this position.

Some of our roles may be remote and some roles may be specific to our offices, but you will need to confirm you have the right to work in the UK.
Show more
HTML:
Our Story

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organization that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organization. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.

Why Work For Us

We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work ‚Äì our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights, so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.

As a Data Analyst for the Professional Advisory Business Group you will report into the group‚Äôs Chief Operating Officer and Managing Director. You will work closely with the Market Intelligence, Valuation, Healthcare, Student Accommodation, Leisure and Hotels team that is spread around the UK with a focus on data analysis, extraction, visualisation and monitoring to provide innovative solutions when presented with large data sets.

Leveraging your understanding and passion for data analytics, the successful candidate will take proactive ownership of key data sets from across the Professional Advisory Business Group and have a positive impact on internal workflow, process optimisation and real estate market knowledge.

  • Compile, analyse and take ownership of multiple internal data sets within the Professional Advisory Business Group and wider company using ETL processes and a strong understanding of SQL platforms.
  • Design and build comprehensive models drawing from multiple data sets using excel, SAAS platforms and API‚Äôs.
  • Research, compile and extract inflowing real estate market data, utilising a strong knowledge of visualisation tools.
  • Produce deep dive data analysis into group KPI‚Äôs that positively influence the trajectory of the teams‚Äô roadmap.
  • Identify and close data gaps that will have a positive impact on workflow and process optimisation.
  • You can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, translating requirements into strong technical solutions.
  • You can communicate concepts, ideas and solutions to stakeholders across seniority levels in person within the business group and the wider company.
  • Work collaboratively with external stakeholders to reach effective solutions that will benefit the business group and the wider company.
  • Degree qualified with strong quantitative/analytical ability and attention to detail.
  • Excellent excel modelling skills.
  • Strong understanding and use of data visualisation tools. Previous use of Power BI is preferred.
  • Ability to interpret and draw conclusions from data sets and present findings to stakeholders in an accessible way.
  • Experience with extracting/transform/load (ETL) processes, SAAS platforms and API‚Äôs.
  • Strong understanding and utilisation of SQL databases.
  • Foundation knowledge of Python and/or R.
  • Take a proactive approach to problem solving, taking full ownership across the lifespan of a project.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly explain concepts concisely to stakeholders within the business group and wider company.
  • Ability to prioritise tasks and manage time effectively.

At Avison Young, we‚Äôve always put people at the heart of what we do.

In the last few years, we‚Äôve increased the diversity at our board, leadership and Principal levels. Avison Young stands out for our commitment to empowering women. In addition to increasing the number of women on our board and in our leadership ranks, our internal Women‚Äôs Network of more than 500 members come together for networking and learning, and advise the business on strategies for promoting access, opportunity and inclusion in our industry.

Our global DEI steering committee shapes our strategy to continue to increase industry access for underrepresented groups and accelerating initiatives led by our employee resource groups, including our Women‚Äôs Network, Black Professionals and LGBTQ+ groups. In addition to leading global initiatives, the steering committee‚Äôs work examines our policies and practices, creating accountability for results and communicating progress to our executive leadership, our clients and our communities.

Our Culture Is Underpinned By Our Approach To Diversity, Inclusion, And Well-being. We Are Committed To Building An Inclusive Culture That

  • empowers all our employees to thrive,
  • reflects all backgrounds and talents,
  • allows individuals to be successful and feel a sense of belonging,
  • and foster a workplace that is supported, inclusive and has a strong sense of community between colleagues.

Avison Young is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all its employees and job applicants equitably. This includes implementing deliberate strategies that advance underrepresented communities in commercial real estate careers.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to removing any obstacles to inclusion. If you need any adjustments to support your application or any part of the recruitment process, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or you are eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us at careers.uk@avisonyoung.comcareers.uk@avisonyoung.com> and we will do everything we can to help.

We are committed to inclusion in our hiring processes, and we want to give everyone a chance to show what they can bring to our organisation. If you are not sure that you have all the skills in the person specification, please still apply. We value passion and potential in our employees, so it would be great to hear from you and why you would suit this position.

Some of our roles may be remote and some roles may be specific to our offices, but you will need to confirm you have the right to work in the UK.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

To continue shaping the future of commerce, we‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst and this is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission.

We are seeking a driven and analytical Lead Analyst who thrives on turning data into actionable insights that shape company-wide KPIs. You will work cross-functionally, delivering insights that empower our teams across Marketing, Finance, and Growth to make data-driven decisions.

With your expertise in SQL and dbt you will play a pivotal role in ensuring data is at the heart of our decision-making processes, helping Gopuff achieve its key performance goals.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Drive Business Efficiency: Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation. Your insights will directly influence how we improve processes, drive customer satisfaction, and optimise cost-efficiency.
Build Data Models for Strategic KPIs: Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to provide transparency and clarity into our core business performance metrics.
Deep Dive into Company Performance: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our KPIs are aligned with overall business objectives, identifying areas for improvement and efficiency.
Collaborate Across the Business: Partner with teams across Marketing, Growth, and Finance to ensure your data insights are not only clear but actionable for driving performance improvements.
Problem-Solve with Data: Tackle real-world challenges by using data to provide practical, strategic solutions that enhance how we operate and grow as a company.
Present Data Insights Effectively: Clearly communicate complex analyses and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are grounded in data.


You Have:


3+ Years in Data Analytics: Proven experience in a data-driven environment, ideally in a high-growth e-commerce or retail setting.
Expertise in SQL: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and developing complex reports. Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
Tools Mastery: Familiarity with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a strong ability to translate data into strategic insights.
Problem-Solver: A passion for tackling business challenges, with the ability to identify issues and propose actionable, data-driven solutions.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Curiosity and Drive: A passion for problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. You‚Äôll be excited to dive into our business performance data and uncover opportunities to drive growth.


Benefits:


A high-impact role where you‚Äôll be directly involved in the company‚Äôs most critical operations.
Company RSU‚Äôs (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
Job description:

¬†

Job Title: ESG Data Analyst

Corporate Title: Analyst

Reporting to: Head of Investment (Equity)

Department: Nomura Asset Management - Equity

¬†

¬†

Company Overview

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning approximately 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Wealth Management, Investment Management, and Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking). Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Department Overview

Nomura Asset Management UK Global Equity team manages a range of mainly developed market Global Equity portfolios on behalf of retail & institutional clients to a total of around $7bn assets under management. The process is highly team-oriented, and Research Analyst recommendations have significant impact on portfolio decisions. ESG analysis is integrated into the investment process of our NAM UK Global Equity team and a significant amount of asset under management is in ESG/Sustainability strategies (SFDR 9 & 8).

¬†

¬†

Role Overview

You will support and help implement the overall ESG analysis, strategy and reporting as part of the team and working closely with our Sustainable Investment specialist. This role is integral to our increasing ESG footprint with clients, and ideally, we are looking for a highly motivated candidate that has a blend of initial ESG experience (independent of background) and solid data/analysis skills. If you are motivated to making a real contribution to this team‚Äôs ESG strategy, this is the right position for you.

¬†

¬†

Main Duties and Responsibilities

Working with our Sustainable Investment Specialist, support the implementation of the team‚Äôs sustainability strategy with respect to our Global Equity Funds.
Identify areas for improvement and solutions for better ESG integration into the investment process.
Support stock analysts in ESG analysis and monitoring of ESG controversies and risks.
Support our Engagement and Proxy Voting process, with Investee companies across the Team.
Help maintain, analyse, and report Engagement and Proxy voting databases and assist with report writing for both internal and external stakeholders.
Support the collection of data, measurement of investee companies‚Äô impact through products and services and report writing.
Support Climate reporting and analysis.
Assist and medium-term take on own topical engagement/collaboration projects on specific ESG/Impact issues.
Help to improve current ESG procedures, including data collection, analysis, monitoring, and reporting.
Support responses to internal and external ESG specific client queries.
Adhere to the NAM code of conduct and all regulatory requirements.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Skills & Experience

Ideally a couple of years of experience in an ESG role, in an Investment, Corporate or ESG data provider organisation.
Ideally Bachelor/Postgraduate in a Sustainability related topic; post graduate ESG qualifications a plus.
Some familiarity with ESG concepts, data, Climate, ESG reporting etc.
Experience in managing database/reporting tasks; ideally some experience with MSCI, ISS, Sustainalytics data.
Self-organisation and self-motivation.
Attention to detail.
Clear and concise communication.
Interest in investment.
MS Office, particularly Excel; ideally some database knowledge.

¬†

Attributes

Genuine passion for environmental and social issues and for exploring how to help better bring this into real world practice from an investment function.
Enthusiastic and motivated team player.
Willingness to learn and take on responsibility.

¬†

Nomura competencies¬†

¬†

Trusted Partner¬†

Acquire professional behaviours and foundational skills¬†
Communicate to others with respect¬†
Acquire basic knowledge and skills necessary for the role¬†
Continue to engage in self-improvement activities as a financial service professional¬†

¬†

Entrepreneurial leadership ¬†

Perform all tasks proactively with a sense of ownership¬†

¬†

Teamwork & Collaboration

Acquire professional behaviours and communication skills¬†
Seek advice from senior colleagues and act accordingly¬†

¬†

Influence¬†

Understand the role, responsibilities and business strategy and act accordingly¬†

¬†

Integrity ¬†

Understand the significance and importance of corporate philosophy, professional ethics, compliance risk management and code of conduct.

¬†

¬†

Right to Work

The UK Government have taken steps to reduce net migration to the UK by limiting the number of overseas workers from outside the EEA coming to the UK for employment. Please note that whilst we are able to consider applications from overseas workers from outside the EEA (who require a Tier 2 (General) visa) we can only employ them if we can provide evidence that there are no other suitable candidates for this vacancy from inside the EEA.

Please contact us if you are visiting our offices and require any form of personal assistance or physical adaptations to be provided for your appointment. A member of staff will be happy to help.

¬†

¬†

Diversity Statement

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. If you require any assistance or reasonable adjustments due to a disability or long-term health condition, please do not hesitate to contact us.

¬†

Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job description:

 

Job Title: ESG Data Analyst

Corporate Title: Analyst

Reporting to: Head of Investment (Equity)

Department: Nomura Asset Management - Equity

 

 

Company Overview

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning approximately 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Wealth Management, Investment Management, and Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking). Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.

 

 

 

Department Overview

Nomura Asset Management UK Global Equity team manages a range of mainly developed market Global Equity portfolios on behalf of retail & institutional clients to a total of around $7bn assets under management. The process is highly team-oriented, and Research Analyst recommendations have significant impact on portfolio decisions. ESG analysis is integrated into the investment process of our NAM UK Global Equity team and a significant amount of asset under management is in ESG/Sustainability strategies (SFDR 9 & 8).

 

 

Role Overview

You will support and help implement the overall ESG analysis, strategy and reporting as part of the team and working closely with our Sustainable Investment specialist. This role is integral to our increasing ESG footprint with clients, and ideally, we are looking for a highly motivated candidate that has a blend of initial ESG experience (independent of background) and solid data/analysis skills. If you are motivated to making a real contribution to this team‚Äôs ESG strategy, this is the right position for you.

 

 

Main Duties and Responsibilities

  • Working with our Sustainable Investment Specialist, support the implementation of the team‚Äôs sustainability strategy with respect to our Global Equity Funds.
  • Identify areas for improvement and solutions for better ESG integration into the investment process.
  • Support stock analysts in ESG analysis and monitoring of ESG controversies and risks.
  • Support our Engagement and Proxy Voting process, with Investee companies across the Team.
  • Help maintain, analyse, and report Engagement and Proxy voting databases and assist with report writing for both internal and external stakeholders.
  • Support the collection of data, measurement of investee companies‚Äô impact through products and services and report writing.
  • Support Climate reporting and analysis.
  • Assist and medium-term take on own topical engagement/collaboration projects on specific ESG/Impact issues.
  • Help to improve current ESG procedures, including data collection, analysis, monitoring, and reporting.
  • Support responses to internal and external ESG specific client queries.
  • Adhere to the NAM code of conduct and all regulatory requirements.

 

 

 

Skills & Experience

  • Ideally a couple of years of experience in an ESG role, in an Investment, Corporate or ESG data provider organisation.
  • Ideally Bachelor/Postgraduate in a Sustainability related topic; post graduate ESG qualifications a plus.
  • Some familiarity with ESG concepts, data, Climate, ESG reporting etc.
  • Experience in managing database/reporting tasks; ideally some experience with MSCI, ISS, Sustainalytics data.
  • Self-organisation and self-motivation.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Clear and concise communication.
  • Interest in investment.
  • MS Office, particularly Excel; ideally some database knowledge.

 

Attributes

  • Genuine passion for environmental and social issues and for exploring how to help better bring this into real world practice from an investment function.
  • Enthusiastic and motivated team player.
  • Willingness to learn and take on responsibility.

 

Nomura competencies 

 

Trusted Partner 

  • Acquire professional behaviours and foundational skills 
  • Communicate to others with respect 
  • Acquire basic knowledge and skills necessary for the role 
  • Continue to engage in self-improvement activities as a financial service professional 

 

Entrepreneurial leadership  

  • Perform all tasks proactively with a sense of ownership 

 

Teamwork & Collaboration

  • Acquire professional behaviours and communication skills 
  • Seek advice from senior colleagues and act accordingly 

 

Influence 

  • Understand the role, responsibilities and business strategy and act accordingly 

 

Integrity  

  • Understand the significance and importance of corporate philosophy, professional ethics, compliance risk management and code of conduct.

 

 

Right to Work

The UK Government have taken steps to reduce net migration to the UK by limiting the number of overseas workers from outside the EEA coming to the UK for employment. Please note that whilst we are able to consider applications from overseas workers from outside the EEA (who require a Tier 2 (General) visa) we can only employ them if we can provide evidence that there are no other suitable candidates for this vacancy from inside the EEA.

Please contact us if you are visiting our offices and require any form of personal assistance or physical adaptations to be provided for your appointment. A member of staff will be happy to help.

 

 

Diversity Statement

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. If you require any assistance or reasonable adjustments due to a disability or long-term health condition, please do not hesitate to contact us.

 

Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

London




Data Quality, Governance, and Catalog Analyst with 6+ years of experience

1. Develop and implement data quality frameworks, governance policies, and cataloging standards on AWS using AWS Glue services.

2. Monitor and improve data accuracy, consistency, and completeness across AWS services.

3. Collaborate with stakeholders to define data lineage, metadata management, and compliance requirements.

4. Utilize AWS-native and third-party tools for data profiling, validation, and governance enforcement.

5. Support data stewardship initiatives, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards and best practices.

Title: Data Analyst Contractor, UK
Description:
We are tech transformation specialists, uniting human expertise with AI to create scalable tech solutions.

With over 6,500 CI&Ters around the world, we‚Äôve built partnerships with more than 1,000 clients during our 30 years of history. Artificial Intelligence is our reality.¬†

When applying for one of our positions, you‚Äôre agreeing to the use of AI in the early phases of the selection process, where your profile will be evaluated by our virtual assistant. For more information, access our opportunities‚Äô page.




Data Analyst

Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team, working with clients in the UK. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization, and programming, with a focus on financial and investment data.

General Responsibilities:

-Collaborate with our Advisory Team business partners to understand key business objectives and define analytical frameworks and approaches to support them.

-Build advanced scripts in SQL and Python by connecting to a series of databases in the lake.

-Build advanced dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau by connecting data from D365, Datalake and Excel files.

-Iterate on existing data assets and provide quick turnarounds to ad-hoc insight requests from key Advisory Team stakeholders.

-Deliver and manage the lifecycle of a data project by working closely with both technical and non-technical across organizations and regions.

-Provide solutions to automate manual data reporting across teams who may be leveraging 3rd party data in Excel and execute.

-Documenting end-to-end data reporting processes managed within Advisory Team.

-Provide solutions to automate manual data reporting across teams who may be leveraging 3rd party data in Excel and execute.

¬†

Key Requirements

-Minimum 4 years‚Äô experience in a data analyst/science role within the investment and finance industry.

-Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Masters in a highly quantitative degree discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science or Economics) are highly desired.

-Advanced SQL, Python and Excel (VBA Macros is desirable)

-Strong proficiency in building dashboards in both PowerBI and Tableau.

-Experience in using AWS Athena and HIVE/Presto.

-Experience working within an agile framework and comfortable using project management tooling like JIRA.

-Proven experience presenting complex data finding and concepts to business stakeholders of varying levels of data literacy.

-Experience using statistical techniques and modelling is highly desirable.

-Previous exposure to working with CRM Databases, specifically D365 is highly desirable.

Bonus: Distinctive qualities of a data scientist or aspirations to become one in the near future.







Collaboration is our superpower, diversity unites us, and excellence is our standard.¬†

We value diverse identities and life experiences, fostering a diverse, inclusive, and safe work environment. We encourage applications from diverse and underrepresented groups to our job positions.

Data Analyst

Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team, working with clients in the UK. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization, and programming, with a focus on financial and investment data.

General Responsibilities:

-Collaborate with our Advisory Team business partners to understand key business objectives and define analytical frameworks and approaches to support them.

-Build advanced scripts in SQL and Python by connecting to a series of databases in the lake.

-Build advanced dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau by connecting data from D365, Datalake and Excel files.

-Iterate on existing data assets and provide quick turnarounds to ad-hoc insight requests from key Advisory Team stakeholders.

-Deliver and manage the lifecycle of a data project by working closely with both technical and non-technical across organizations and regions.

-Provide solutions to automate manual data reporting across teams who may be leveraging 3rd party data in Excel and execute.

-Documenting end-to-end data reporting processes managed within Advisory Team.

-Provide solutions to automate manual data reporting across teams who may be leveraging 3rd party data in Excel and execute.

 

Key Requirements

-Minimum 4 years‚Äô experience in a data analyst/science role within the investment and finance industry.

-Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Masters in a highly quantitative degree discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science or Economics) are highly desired.

-Advanced SQL, Python and Excel (VBA Macros is desirable)

-Strong proficiency in building dashboards in both PowerBI and Tableau.

-Experience in using AWS Athena and HIVE/Presto.

-Experience working within an agile framework and comfortable using project management tooling like JIRA.

-Proven experience presenting complex data finding and concepts to business stakeholders of varying levels of data literacy.

-Experience using statistical techniques and modelling is highly desirable.

-Previous exposure to working with CRM Databases, specifically D365 is highly desirable.

Bonus: Distinctive qualities of a data scientist or aspirations to become one in the near future.



Collaboration is our superpower, diversity unites us, and excellence is our standard. 

We value diverse identities and life experiences, fostering a diverse, inclusive, and safe work environment. We encourage applications from diverse and underrepresented groups to our job positions.

Title: Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We are a global socially-led creative agency, with unrivalled social media and influencer marketing expertise. With over 1,200 people in four continents, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture.

We're proud to be a multi award-winning agency, with Cannes Lions, One Show, Webby and Shorty Awards, to name but a few. Our most recent work has seen us help Amazon Music, Activision and Adidas deliver some of their biggest and most innovative campaigns to date.

As well as creating for clients, we help educate the wider industry. Our Instagram publication The Feed tracks culture at the speed of social. 6,500 people registered or tuned into our events last year, and our reports garnered more than 20 million views.

The Opportunity

Are you able to understand how social and behavioural trends are evolving and how to mine these for actionable insights for brands?

Do you feel comfortable with complex sets of data and feel proficient using pivot tables?

Are you an expert across tools such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, GWI and Emplify, using them to extensively generate insight? Are you happy to build dashboards and widgets without supervision?

Can you tailor your insights and reports to account for diverse and global audiences?

We are looking for a Research & Insights Analyst to be part of the Research & Insights team taking responsibility for the social media analysis and research products that are vital to the strategic direction of our consultancy and engagement plans.

We Are Social's Research & Insights team looks to deliver exceptionally high-quality results within three core service areas; Consultancy, Research & Insight and Engagement. We manipulate large sets of data, text and language in order to extract meaningful insights that can help shape recommendations and strategies.

The Research & Insights team serves both as a service to other We Are Social departments, and also works directly with clients on bespoke deep-dive projects. In addition, as the central hub for the We Are Social network the London Research & Insights team also supports other We Are Social offices.

Requirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere


Produced stellar regular and ad hoc research reports, including data collection, analysis, visualisation and commentary in delivering a project end-to-end within the agreed scope of work
Linked findings and recommendations to broader social, behavioural and cultural insights to ensure that these findings are adopted and implemented by the client.
Ensured there's a narrative and story to all work and allowed clients to easily understand the insights presented.
Interrogated a client brief and worked with internal teams across Strategy, Editorial and Creative in transforming research into world-class social campaigns.
Regularly present research and insight projects to internal stakeholders, teams and clients
Laddering social data up to business goals to demonstrate how campaigns have solved clients' business problems making sure we meet, exceed and develop the brief for the future.
Supporting Directors in managing projects as well as juniors within the team.


What Else Are We Looking For?


Sprinklr expert and have knowledge of Brandwatch, Netbase and Pulsar. Knowledge of audience segmentation tools is a plus.
Proven experience in consumer research and analytics, with a track record of interesting, innovative work that changed businesses.
A lover of music and an interest in FMCG brands.
If you can speak an additional language, in particular Spanish, German or Italian - this would be a bonus but not essential.


Benefits

Our Culture and the Nice Stuff

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion runs in the water here at We Are Social. We are transparent about the changes that are needed, we are focused on making real strides, both internally and within the industry and we strive to truly be a workplace that represents, supports and advocates for ALL. Our Charter for Change in the UK can be found here which details our focus areas across People, Work and Culture in 2023.

If you require any support, adjustments or accommodations for any reason whatsoever during the recruitment process, please let us know via recuitment@wearesocial.net

So let's get to the good stuff, we offer all those things you would naturally expect; 25 days holiday, pension scheme & life assurance. But what we love most is connection, so we have our WAS Passport and Work From Anywhere schemes which allow you to truly connect to colleagues all over the world!

About

But what's life around here really like day-to-day? Well, we ask our people regularly what they think about us/their role and here are some of the most common things they say:


I value my manager we have a good relationship
We love to ‚Äòget social' with the people I work with
Trusted to get on with the job, without ‚Äòmicro-management'!


If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction

Main Responsibilities

The Data Analyst is a key role in our journey to becoming a data driven organisation. This is a key operational role, which supports the CIO and Head of Data (Framework Owner) responsibilities for development, implementation and day-to-day operation of Data Management Frameworks. Specifically, this involves activities related to metadata management, data harmonisation, data quality score carding, data quality issue analysis, data profiling and data lineage; thereby establishing data governance and ongoing maturity of the Bank's prioritised business outputs.

This role provides fundamental support and guidance for Information Area Owners and data stewards, as well as project teams to translate their data requirements (aligned to data policy and frameworks) into data outcomes using technical (profiling, mining, score carding) and business analysis skills. Ongoing impact is being made through the data analyst skillset where the ability to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions, work arounds and technical thinking, showcases the way forward for a more mature and holistic data service.

The role reports directly to the Data Technical Lead and is part of a team of data analysts responsible for embedding best practice data governance and quality practices across the Bank whilst also helping support the wider change initiatives across the organisation.


Analytical problem solving with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management.
Quantitative proficiency in order to work across multiple data sets and information areas.
Problem solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Detailed scrutiny of data transformations and Data lineage in order to operationalise the Ab Initio system.
Undertake activities to support the enterprise-wide data catalogue, to document business glossary definitions, taxonomies, ontologies and alignment to Handelsbanken Group conceptual data models and standards.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the metadata management system and data dictionaries, working collaboratively with data owners and their teams.
Document source to target technical data lineage and data quality controls along the data flow for reports and business outputs.
Analyse data quality root causes and understand business problems, partnering with business and technology teams to remediate data quality issues.
Build data outcomes using technical data profiling, mining, utilising data analysis skills.
Undertake quantitative analysis using Power BI, Excel and SQL experience to source, analyse, normalise and process data across multiple data sets.
Conduct data analysis to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions.
Interpret data flows and models to understand lineage gaps and resolve missing data quality controls.
Apply best practice data quality and metadata management principles to resolve data quality issues and address underlying causes.
Support the development of trusted sources for critical data, working with other stakeholders including data consumers, data producers, data owners and stewards to define requirements.


Ideal Candidate

Research (by Harvard University) shows that women are particularly likely to second guess themselves and not apply - so if you are worried you don't meet all the criteria, get in touch anyhow and let us do the worrying‚Ä¶


Be passionate about data quality and continuously strive to promote data quality through the development of system and process controls.
Apply technical thinking with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management
Demonstrate detailed scrutiny of technical and business data flows and transformations in order to operationalise data lineage management.
Demonstrate experience leading data management activities to implement data frameworks and establish data controls and monitor their effectiveness.
Experience of leading data quality initiatives that have provided tangible efficiencies and/or business value.
Experience of data quality management, master data management and reference data management
Working knowledge of statutory frameworks such as CCPA, GDPR, BCBS and Data Protection Act
Demonstrate experience of problem-solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Experience using data visualisation tools to present complex analysis is essential e.g. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView
Strong presentation skills both written and oral, experienced in presenting complex data concepts to a business audience i.e. running workshops and formal data governance meetings.
Knowledge and understanding of master data elements and processes, understanding of static versus transactional data challenges.
Experience and/or knowledge of data quality and lineage tools: Ad Initio, Collibra, Informatica, IBM MDM etc.
Experience of data modelling is ideal but not essential.


Company Information

Handelsbanken is a relationship bank with a decentralised way of working, a strong local presence thanks to a nationwide network of branches, and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a local business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a bespoke service. The focus is always on the need of the individual customer and not on the sale of specific products.

We are embarking on an exciting Business Transformation journey. This transformation will significantly enhance our technology system systems, processes and services, bringing evolution to our ways of working. Join us in this transformative journey, where your dedication, adaptability and commitment will play a crucial role in shaping the future of banking for our valued customers.

The Bank is deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities. This is so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work that encourages everyone to apply, regardless of socio-economic background, age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), veteran status, marital and civil partnership status, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Check our Handelsbanken website for further information

At Handelsbanken, we deeply value our unique culture and values including trust in and respect for each individual. We take pride in nurturing a work environment where people flourish, and where they are empowered to take decisions in their areas of expertise. We take a long term perspective in everything we do and want each employee who joins us to build a long terms successful career with the Bank.

What is in it for you?


We have a wide range of learning and development available, empowering and enabling our colleagues to take ownership of their own development.
Competitive Salary and an extensive range of benefits is provided, including private medical insurance, income protection and life assurance
A market-leading pension contribution of 15% paid by the bank, which can be invested in a wide range of funds (including ESG and Shariah funds)


Application next steps

Your journey with us begins once you have submitted your application. One of our Handelsbanken recruiters will be reviewing your details and will later organise a phone conversation if you match the role requirements. If there is a mutual fit, we will extend an invitation for you to participate in an interview.

There will be a combination of technical and competency based interviews.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process ‚Äì just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities

Our People Solutions team are looking for bright, enthusiastic and articulate candidates keen to gain experience and start their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive and attention to detail essential.

The successful candidates will be working closely with other analysts to learn the role and to support on the day-to-day needs.

You will be provided with structured and ‚Äòon-the-job‚Äô training, support with professional qualifications.


Manage, cleanse, and interpret internal data as well as client data.
Responsible for monthly uploads of claims and membership data.
Develop internal models.
Develop PowerBI dashboards for internal and external purposes.
Deliver claims forecasts on PMI and assist the actuarial team.
Carry out ad-hoc projects, across all lines of business, to support the business where possible.
Internal ‚Äògo-to‚Äô for excel support, client and internal ad-hoc requests.
Responsible for financial reporting for the People Solutions Executive Team


Qualifications


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong interest in programming languages such as DAX/VBA, R/Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Thorough and great attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Interest in the healthcare and risk market

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Job Location: London(3 days in the office, 2 days from home)

Contract Length: 12 months

Industry: Banking

Working Hours: 8 per day/ 40 per week




Engagement via Umbrella ‚Äì Inside IR35




Profile Summary

The MIT BIT Programme is undergoing a large-scale application transformation. To support this initiative, we require to hire a dedicated Business Data Analyst who will play a critical role in analysing the current Database-based data landscape and facilitating the transition to a strategic solution. This role will be pivotal in evaluating existing data models, understanding data purpose, and designing the future data ecosystem aligned with business objectives.

Our Business/Data Analysis Team help to define and implement business/information system solutions. Their role is to help the business to determine and agree its requirements and support the Development through to a successful outcome.




Duties and Responsibilities

Specify business requirements for new and existing software applications
Conduct end-to-end analysis of the current As-Is system‚Äôs data structures, sources, and purposes within the database environment (Oracle etc).
Support the Delivery Team through the Software Development Lifecycle to a successful outcome
Adherence to Business/Data Analysis standards and targets
Identify fragmented or inconsistent data repositories and propose To-Be data models and architectures.
Work closely with Business Stakeholders, Enterprise Architects, and Database Engineers to define data governance strategies and standardization.
Identify and mitigate Key Person Dependency by creating documentation and knowledge-sharing processes, reducing reliance on a limited set of database developers.
Manage small Project deliverables - Planning, co-ordinating monitoring and reporting
Providing written progress updates to the Business Analysis Team Leader/Project manager on a weekly basis
Collaborate with offshore and external data analysis resources, ensuring scalability and adaptability for changing project demands.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

In-depth understanding of the software development process and overall project life cycle (Essential)
Able to understand business user requirements (Essential)
Excellent business acumen and client facing skills (Essential)
5+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in large-scale transformation projects
A conceptual thinker who can present complex ideas and topics to a wide audience (both technical and non-technical) (Essential)
Good analytical skills, able to contribute to major business change (Essential)
Self assured, dynamic, open to ideas, able to influence others (Essential)
Able to work to tight timescales, be commercially aware, and have the ability to work well within a team structure (Essential)
Ability to quickly react to situations whilst maintaining a high quality of work (Essential)
Self starter with a ‚Äúcan do, will do‚Äù attitude (Essential)
Knowledge of banking systems and products (Essential)




Other Essential Skills

SQL on SQL Server and Oracle
Excel (Advanced)
Data Modelling
Data Management & Quality Improvement




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with big data technologies
Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis
Understanding of data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPS, etc)
Strong understanding of E2E data lifecycle management and governance principles

We offer equal employment opportunities to all, promote diversity and inclusion and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, including on the grounds of gender, nationality, race, age, ethnic origin, religion, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity.




NOTE: They need to be a techy ‚Äì with change management and business knowledge

Oracle is primary over SQL

  • Good analytical skills, able to contribute to major business change (Essential)
  • Self assured, dynamic, open to ideas, able to influence others (Essential)
  • Able to work to tight timescales, be commercially aware, and have the ability to work well within a team structure (Essential)
  • Ability to quickly react to situations whilst maintaining a high quality of work (Essential)
  • Self starter with a ‚Äúcan do, will do‚Äù attitude (Essential)
  • Knowledge of banking systems and products (Essential)


Other Essential Skills

  • SQL on SQL Server and Oracle
  • Excel (Advanced)
  • Data Modelling
  • Data Management & Quality Improvement


Preferred Skills

  • Familiarity with big data technologies
  • Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis
  • Understanding of data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPS, etc)
  • Strong understanding of E2E data lifecycle management and governance principles

We offer equal employment opportunities to all, promote diversity and inclusion and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, including on the grounds of gender, nationality, race, age, ethnic origin, religion, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity.


NOTE: They need to be a techy ‚Äì with change management and business knowledge

Oracle is primary over SQL

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of 113 million registered users and 240,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 419+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.132.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation. We are also ready to consider candidates with more work experience as Senior Data Analyst.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go‚Äôs most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you‚Äôre passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product, mainly based in our HQ in Copenhagen.
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly. Our London office is located in Shoreditch.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Digital Analyst ‚Äì Defence




12 Month FTC




Northolt/Sandhurst




VINCI Facilities are looking for a Digital Analyst to join our defence contract in the South East.




This role is all about working with Asset Condition survey data to help shape the Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) schedule and ensure smooth management of key systems, particularly MAXIMO.




If you're someone who enjoys working with data to make real operational improvements, this could be a great fit for you!




Key Responsibilities:




Using Asset Condition survey data to support the development of the PPM schedule.
Keeping MAXIMO up to date and running smoothly for asset management and reporting.
Creating reports and dashboards to help teams make informed decisions.
Supporting digital projects that improve how we manage assets across the contract.
Finding ways to make processes more efficient based on data and user feedback.




Essential Skills/Qualifications:




MAXIMO experience ‚Äì ideally in asset and PPM management.
Strong analytical skills to interpret Asset Condition survey data and turn it into useful insights.
Confidence in working with reporting tools to help visualize data.
Some knowledge of asset management within Facilities Management or the MOD would be a bonus.

This is a great opportunity to play a key role in keeping critical assets running efficiently. If you enjoy working with data and making a real impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Senior Insights Analyst




Location: London - City of London / Hybrid 2 days a week

Salary: ¬£55,000










A fantastic opportunity has come up to join an exciting and creative Digital Agency, as they continue to grow and build out all areas of their teams due to lots of success, with them also having even more ambitious plans for 2025 and beyond.




This award-winning digital marketing agency is on the lookout for a senior insights Analyst to help with the following:




Responsibilities:

‚óè Be the lead analyst and point of contact across a selection of client accounts, understanding their requirements and translating to succinct performance updates and value reports.

‚óè Using historical data to forecast and map client targets to quarterly, monthly and daily

target sets, with detailed breakdowns by channel.

‚óè Hold company teams and clients accountable to the targets that are set, ensuring accurate data is available to monitor performance and enact change wherever necessary.

‚óè Analyse performance marketing data and identify actionable insights that drive growth and continuous improvements.

‚óè Build Google Looker Studio dashboards to surface key data points for clients using existing templates and building custom data sets/layouts as required.

‚óè Support the Head of Data with creating and implementing new tracking strategies for

clients to ensure all digital touch points are tracked effectively and efficiently.

‚óè Audit client Google Analytics accounts and implement updates and enhancements to create bespoke, best practise implementations.

‚óè Innovate and enhance our client offering with the deployment of data warehousing through BigQuery ensuring appropriate restrictions are in place and excellent foundations for future usage.




Experience Required

‚óè 4+ years of experience in a similar role

‚óè Experience using BigQuery, SQL

‚óè A passion for analysing data and a natural curiosity

‚óè Exposure to paid media activity and understanding of the key metrics and ability to identify insights

‚óè Understanding of SEO and common tools (Accuranker, Google Search Console)

‚óè Ability to process large amounts of data and provide actionable insights







Applying:

If you like the sound of this opportunity and wish to be considered, you can apply by forwarding an up-to-date version of your CV, and someone will get back to you within 24 hours if we feel you are a potentially suitable and good match.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Title: BI Reporting Analyst II

Client Location: London(Hybrid)

Starting: Asap

Pay Rate: ¬£212 per day(PAYE Inside IR35)

Duration: 4 months




We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented BI Reporting Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence (BI) reports and dashboards to support data-driven decision-making. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in data visualization tools, and the ability to transform raw data into meaningful insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Performs business analysis using various techniques, e.g. statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, data mining.
Determines best practices and develops actionable insights and recommendations for the current business operations.
Works directly with the internal or external client to identify analytical requirements.
May help to produce ad hoc data and reports. May assist in implementing or developing systems to capture business operation information.
May occasionally guide less experienced business data analysts.
Develop, design, and maintain BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to support business operations
Extract, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to provide accurate and timely insights.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and translate them into technical specifications.




Qualifications & Skills:

**SQL, Qlicksense, Tableau**

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a BI Reporting Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Strong SQL skills for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.




Client Description:

Our Client is a global technology platform that specialises in overcoming the world‚Äôs most important financial challenges. Their products and services are driven by artificial intelligence, and their accounting software is one of their most recognisable creations. Considered one of the top companies to work for, they are proud of their company culture and entrepreneurial spirit.




Aquent is dedicated to improving inclusivity & is proudly an equal opportunities employer. We encourage applications from under-represented groups & are committed to providing support to applicants with disabilities. We aim to provide reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, to those with a medical condition, disability or neurodivergence.

Other Requirements:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $121,800 - $220,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.
