About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:

  • Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
  • Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
  • Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English
  • Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
  • Good numerical reasoning skills
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It‚Äôs Great if you Have:

  • Experience in digital marketing
  • Academic research experience

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analytics Associate
Description:
About Us

RB Global (NYSE: RBA) (TSX: RBA) is a leading, omnichannel marketplace that provides value-added insights, services and transaction solutions for buyers and sellers of commercial assets and vehicles worldwide. Through its auction sites in 13 countries and digital platform, RB Global serves customers in more than 170 countries across a variety of asset classes, including automotive, commercial transportation, construction, government surplus, lifting and material handling, energy, mining and agriculture.

The company‚Äôs marketplace brands include Ritchie Bros., the world‚Äôs largest auctioneer of commercial assets and vehicles offering online bidding, and IAA, a leading global digital marketplace connecting vehicle buyers and sellers. RB Global‚Äôs portfolio of brands also includes Rouse Services, which provides a complete end-to-end asset management, data-driven intelligence and performance benchmarking system; SmartEquip, an innovative technology platform that supports customers‚Äô management of the equipment lifecycle and integrates parts procurement with both OEMs and dealers; Xcira, a leader in live simulcast auction technologies; and Veritread, an online marketplace for heavy haul transport.

About The Team

Ritchie Bros. Financial Services is our dynamic, fast-paced and passionate equipment financing business unit. Outgoing, entrepreneurial, collaborative, fun, energetic, resilient, competitive, friendly, customer-focused ‚Äì we like our coworkers and our adjectives. Our ultimate reward is successfully helping our coworkers achieve and develop within our organization.

Job Description

The Data Analytics Associate serves as a support partner to various department groups and leaders within Ritchie Bros. Financial Services. They provide objective and fact-based analytical reviews to deliver quantitative insights of past performance drivers (descriptive), forecasting of current and future opportunities (predictive), and opportunities to drive positive change (prescriptive). The data analyst will also be responsible for supporting a suite of business intelligence reports to ensure that performance metrics are transparent and accessible.

Responsibilities
Independently execute complex data analysis - structuring analysis, executing analysis, synthesizing results, presenting results. Act as an analytics partner for different department units and functional teams within the organization
Lead / take ownership of data related products - e.g., building report dashboards to support the business and teams
Translate business questions into specific requirements and then deliver meaningful insights through a combination of expert technical skill and deep understanding of the business problem
Execute analysis of the company‚Äôs customer and business data, including predictive modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis
Proactively identify solutions for improving the effectiveness of business activities within sales, credit, and funding operations
Routine reporting - Support regular monthly business reporting requirements
Presentation of analysis - convene groups & teams to collaborate on issue or questions
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics
Strong understanding of data analysis including collection, exploration, modeling, interpretation, and communication
Previous experience in creating data visualizations of insights and ‚Äúself-serve‚Äù dashboards / reporting tools
Additional experience in Tableau, Salesforce, KNIME, R, etc. is considered an asset.

Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, Data Digital Enablement, the Data Engineering Analyst will collaborate closely with the Data Architect to ensure the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data operations and cloud platform. This role will actively participate in maintaining and optimizing the organization‚Äôs data ecosystem. The Data Engineering Analyst demonstrates exceptional professionalism, initiative, and a proactive approach to challenges. They bring strong creative and analytical problem-solving skills, consistently deliver high-quality work within deadlines, contribute positively to team success, and embrace opportunities for continuous learning and growth.

Note: This position qualifies for an optional hybrid work schedule after 90 days of onsite work and onboarding. Employee will be subject to the terms of the Flexible Work Policy Agreement.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure Support


Assists in ensuring the technical support and high availability of Seaspan Marine Group's data infrastructure.
Collaborates with the Data Architect in designing, implementing, and optimizing scalable data infrastructure solutions within Microsoft's technology stack.
Monitors, troubleshoots, and debugs issues affecting the performance of the data infrastructure and its assets.
Develops root-cause analysis for incidents and contributes to lessons learned.
Supports the management and maintenance of the organization's data warehouse and lake house, ensuring its reliability, security, and operational efficiency.
Enhances existing infrastructure, solutions, and processes to meet technical standards and address business requirements.



ETL and Data Integration


Develop and supports the implementation of end-to-end ETL processes for data procurement and integration.
Collaborates with the team to continuously monitor, tune, and optimize the performance of data pipelines, databases, and datasets.
Actively participates in defining and implementing efficient data engineering workflows.



Data Modeling and Quality


Supports best practices in data modeling methodologies for the design and implementation of effective datasets.
Supports the establishment and enforcement of data quality standards and practices to ensure accuracy and reliability throughout the data life cycle.
Develops data quality monitoring, alerting, and profiling processes.
Collaborates with stakeholders to define and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs.



Documentation and Communication


Writes and maintains comprehensive documentation of the requirements collected, data infrastructure, data source catalogs, data models, ETL runbooks, and data quality standards.
Works closely with stakeholders to understand use cases and ensure developed data products meet their needs.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating technical concepts into understandable terms.



Project Collaboration


Supports the implementation of the Data and Digital Enablement Program‚Äôs roadmap.
Participates in Scrum ceremonies as part of the Data and Digital Enablement team.
Actively contributes towards data engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Works towards maintaining high standards in Seaspan Marine Group‚Äôs data engineering processes, aligning with industry best practices.



What You'll Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Engineering, Business Administration, or completion of a Post-secondary Diploma in Computer Science.
Minimum 2-3 years of experience as a Data Engineer in an environment using the Azure technology stack.
Familiarity with designing and building ETL mechanisms in Azure.
Proficiency in coding languages such as PowerShell, Python, SQL, Java, and Scala.
Experience using IDEs such as VS or VS Code for development and Git for version control.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and version control practices.
Understanding of data concepts, databases, data modeling, dimensional modeling, and star schemas.
Experience with physical and logical design of database architectures for relational databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Knowledge of database optimization, disaster recovery, and ETL performance tuning.
Solid working knowledge in Azure Data Factory, ADLS GEN2 and TSQL.
Exposure to Spark and Databricks in Azure is an asset.
Developing and maintaining integrations in Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).
Working knowledge of Data Engineering components in Microsoft Fabric.



Why you'll love working here


This is a full-time, permanent position. With multiple operations and long-term projects, Seaspan employees enjoy job stability as we look ahead to build ships for decades to come.
In addition to an annual bonus and pension plan matching, this role provides you a very competitive salary in line with the successful candidate‚Äôs experience.
We also provide a best-in-class health and wellness benefits package for this position, including such things as full health care (e.g. unlimited physiotherapy), dental, vision, life insurance, medical leave coverage, parental leave coverage, childcare benefit partnership, wellness/fitness reimbursement for memberships or registration fees, and an Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP).



The estimated salary for this position is $72,900 - $87,400. In determining final salary, Seaspan considers many factors including the successful Candidate‚Äôs skillset and experience as well as position location and internal equity. The final base salary offer will be at the Company‚Äôs sole discretion and presented as part of a competitive total compensation package.

About Us

With more than 130 years of experience navigating in some of the world‚Äôs most complex and difficult waters, Seaspan Marine is the largest and most diverse tug & barge company on Canada‚Äôs West Coast.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Resonance (resonanceco.com) is a leading global consultancy and branding agency for the world‚Äôs best destinations, cities and communities. Our projects take us around the world, from developing brands for communities, to tourism development plans for countries to economic development strategies for cities. We also publish the World‚Äôs Best Cities rankings, one of the most widely-read city rankings in the world.¬†




We are looking to hire a Research Analyst to join our growing team, a full-time position based in our Vancouver office. Reporting to the Research Director, the Research Analyst will be a key resource in driving insights and shaping recommendations to our clients, from mining and analyzing data to performing primary market research into perception and reputation of place. The Research Analyst will also help drive the data collection and insights behind our Best Cities reports that enhance both economic prosperity and quality of life for communities in the destinations we serve.¬†




Specific duties and responsibilities include:¬†

Collects and analyzes key third-party statistics and produces, charts, reports and presentations with respect to the livability of cities, economic development, tourism, and real estate
Conducts, analyzes and produces high quality work requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness of data and adherence to prescribed methodology
Synthesizes large amounts of information and communicates key findings clearly and concisely
Contributes to the the development, deployment, analysis, and reporting of online surveys and other quantitative research programs for clients
Contributes to research articles, marketing materials, and reports
Supports research projects of varying complexity utilizing knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
Works closely with the team to carry out all phases of research activities
Manages project resources, including assets from client and internal documents
Other duties, as required




Who We‚Äôre Looking For:

Must-haves:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 2+ years experience in an analytics role or Master‚Äôs degree with a specialization in data analytics, social sciences, economics, statistics, or related field
Strong quantitative skills and an aptitude for numbers - you‚Äôre comfortable working with data to identify trends and insights and are fluent in Excel or Google Sheets.¬†
Experience with data visualization and are comfortable telling a story with data.¬†
Detail-oriented, organized, and possesses finely-tuned skills in data collection and compiling information
Familiarity with publicly available data sources (e.g. U.S. Census, Statistics Canada and more) and data platforms such as EMSI Lightcast, ESRI, CoStar and others is a plus.
A passion for, or experience in, placemaking, cities, tourism and travel, economic development, and real estate development
Ability to work as part of a collaborative team and independently
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English; other languages are an asset

Bonus attributes:

Experience in GIS
Experience with statistical analysis tools such as R or Python
Experience in database management¬†




Why Join Us?

At Resonance, you‚Äôll work on meaningful projects that shape the places people love. We offer:

Exciting global projects with cities, travel brands, and real estate leaders
Flexible hybrid work options - this position is expected to work in our Vancouver office located in the heart of Yaletown 3 days a week
The ability to work fully remote up to 2 weeks per year
A competitive PTO policy
Medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
RRSP with company match
Regular performance evaluations with opportunities for promotions and merit increases
Professional development opportunities
Regular team/company events and activities including summer and holiday events




Location: Vancouver, BC




Compensation: Estimated pay range is $65,000 - $80,000 at the time of this posting. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors such as job-related skills, relevant experience, education and/or training.¬†




Equal Opportunity

At Resonance, we believe in creating vibrant and prosperous places, and that starts with fostering a workplace and culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and clients, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.




As a multicultural, multilingual, and multi-disciplinary team, we know diverse perspectives drive innovation and amazing work. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and bolder thinking, and reflect the destinations, cities, districts and developments where we operate. All applicants, employees, and clients can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Collaboration ‚Äì We build meaningful partnerships that create lasting impact.

Intelligence ‚Äì We embrace diverse perspectives to uncover unexpected insights.

Creativity ‚Äì We blend art and analysis to craft compelling stories and strategies.

Diversity ‚Äì We celebrate our global team, fostering an inclusive and equitable culture.

Ambition ‚Äì We think big, push boundaries, and shape the future of places.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Overview:




At Saje Natural Wellness, we're nature's original farmacy, blending the superpower of plants so you can remedy real life, naturally. And like nature, we're continually growing! As we continue to build our team, we're seeking talented people to join us: in our stores, support offices, and distribution centres. We are a purpose-driven, people-first organization where collaboration, innovation and entrepreneurial mindsets thrive.




We look for individuals who have drive and warmth, agility and passion, and keep customer experience at the centre of everything they do.




At Saje, you‚Äôll connect with a dynamic community and make a positive impact. Join our team and grow your career, alongside the most talented, hard working, and kind-hearted people out there.




The impact you'll make:




Reporting into our Sr. Director, Growth, as a Digital Analyst, you will have a unique opportunity to contribute to our digital strategy by gathering, analyzing, and reporting on key data across multiple channels. You‚Äôll collaborate with multiple key stakeholders across the growth, ecommerce, marketing teams, ensuring that your findings lead to actionable insights for both immediate optimizations and long-term strategy.




All Saje Team Members are responsible for contributing to Saje‚Äôs culture and maintaining a positive environment for themselves and their peers.




What you'll do:




Reporting & Analysis: Own the creation and maintenance of regular reports that track performance across key digital channels (web, social, email, paid media, etc.). Present findings to stakeholders, offering actionable insights to optimize current campaigns, improve performance, and guide decision-making.
Proactive Insights & Recommendations: Provide proactive, data-driven recommendations based on performance trends, helping the team make improvements before performance issues arise. This includes identifying optimization opportunities in user journeys, conversion rates, and campaign targeting.
Reactive Problem Solving: Respond to urgent performance issues by diving deep into data to identify root causes. Provide timely solutions or adjustments based on immediate needs, including troubleshooting traffic drops, underperforming campaigns, or customer behavior changes.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders across growth, ecommerce, & marketing to understand objectives and share insights that inform strategy. Act as a trusted advisor, translating data into actionable steps for optimization.
Dashboard Creation & Maintenance: Develop, maintain, and evolve customized dashboards and visualizations to deliver key insights and KPIs across the organization. Use platforms like Looker Studio & Power BI to provide real-time visibility into digital performance.
Website Tagging & GA4 Management: Audit, implement and maintain all website tagging and GA4 setup.
Testing & Experimentation: Manage A/B tests and other experiments, focusing on performance optimization. Help design and implement experiments, monitor and analyze results, and suggest adjustments to improve user experience and campaign outcomes.
Customer & Market Behavior Analysis: Use analytics tools to assess consumer behavior and identify trends that inform not only marketing but product and business strategy. Provide insights into customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and churn.
Data Integrity & Accuracy: Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all data used for analysis. Maintain a keen eye for detail to validate data inputs and outcomes, ensuring all insights are based on reliable information.




We'd love to hear from you if you have:




Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other analytics tools.
Experience working with multiple product SKUs, within a D2C organization.
Proven ability to produce detailed, actionable reports and dashboards for various stakeholders.
Experience with A/B testing and optimizing digital campaigns based on data.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, etc.) and experience with data visualization tools like Looker Studio & Power BI.
Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities and addressing issues.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data findings into clear recommendations.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to work with large datasets.
Experience with marketing automation platforms, CRM & CDP is an added bonus.
Google Analytics certification or other relevant analytics certifications is an added bonus.
Knowledge of SQL, R, Python and/or other programming languages is an added bonus.




Why Saje?




Here at Saje, we understand that joining a team is an important decision to make, so we want to be sure you're supported to do your best work.




The compensation range for this position is from $80,000‚Äì 92,500 annually. Base pay is dependent to market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity.




Other components of our total rewards offerings include:

Bonus Program
A hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours based on business needs
Wellness days to ensure you're taking care of you mental and physical health
Health benefits - comprehensive health, vision and dental packages
Paid sick days
Generous product discount
Full onboarding plan and onboarding buddy to help you settle in
Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 support, resources, and information available to you and your family
Paid time off to ensure you're resting & recharging
Product training to help you learn about the benefits and efficacy of our 100% natural products to support your own wellness journey




Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.




Join our team!




If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply in the link below. Not sure you're 100% the right fit? We encourage you to apply even if you don't have all of the listed qualifications. We offer a thorough onboarding experience to set you up for success, learning and development support, and help you to integrate seamlessly.




Saje provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and believe the best teams are made up of diverse perspectives and people. We offer reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and will work with you to ensure you are supported while working at Saje.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Economics
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world‚Äôs largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek‚Äôs 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

Chainlink Labs is pioneering the world‚Äôs first fully sustainable and decentralized oracle network, and the Economics team is searching for a Senior Analyst to play a critical role in building it. This role will sit at the intersection of blockchain technology, financial innovation, and economic systems, and shape the future of decentralized economics.

As a Senior Analyst, you will combine economics, data science, and blockchain expertise to shape incentives, optimize network design, and influence the decision-making of our Economics and Executive Leadership teams. You will design, analyze, and operationalize economic models for production applications. You will collaborate across departments to bring innovative solutions from concept to production, ensuring economic soundness and scalability throughout.

This is a high-impact role, offering visibility and influence as you contribute to the development of the Chainlink network. If you‚Äôre a meticulous, creative, and motivated individual ready to solve complex economic problems through data-driven decisions in the rapidly evolving world of Web3, this is the role for you.

Your Impact


You'll serve two primary functions: (1) designing and performing analyses that help the Economics and Executive Leadership teams make informed, data-driven decisions, and (2) building and maintaining systems for the parameterization of production applications.
You'll work on a wide array of blockchain economics projects, analyses, and systems, including:
Designing novel mechanisms and incentive schemes
Building models and simulations to evaluate investment opportunities
Designing and parameterizing trading systems
Optimizing parameters for production applications
Contributing to the design of Economics programs and applications
You'll optimize network incentives and systems by engaging directly with the Economics, Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science teams to understand network dynamics at the deepest level.
You'll operationalize processes and analytics systems, and coordinate cross-functionally to implement them.
This is both a highly technical and highly social role. You will have high visibility and a large impact on how Chainlink builds the world‚Äôs first fully sustainable decentralized oracle network.

Requirements


5+ years experience in a quantitative role, particularly trading or quant research
A deep understanding of financial and crypto markets and incentives
Extensive financial modeling background, including data engineering and model automation
Strong SQL and Python skills are mandatory
Experience solving economic problems through statistical/econometric analyses
Substantial data analysis and/or data science experience
Meticulous attention to detail.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong Economics and/or Finance background through Masters-level academics and/or multiple years of industry experience.
Strong organizational and coordination skills necessary to productionize/operationalize processes and applications.
Preferably smart contract programming experience (Rust, Go, Solidity), but familiarity with smart contract code and dApp architecture at a minimum
Published research with an economics or crypto focus (e.g., papers on MEV or PBS, staking and slashing dynamics, node compensation, tokenomics, etc.)


All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

Title: Systems Analyst, Data Services
Description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world‚Äôs most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It‚Äôs a place where you can genuinely make an impact ‚Äì and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your role:

We are looking for analytical candidates with solid technical aptitude to join our bright, diligent and dynamic team. As the Data Services Systems Analyst, you will carry out the technical implementation of all Data Services' Import requests, in addition to supporting the daily processes and business operations of our fast-paced organization. The Data Services Systems Analyst will focus on the backend operations and escalation of all customer-facing systems related issues within Data Services to ensure proper facilitation and completion of Import case queue of Client historical archives being ingested into Global Relay's archives. You will play a critical role in proposing solutions, testing new features and contributing to the development of internal products.

The Data Services team provides audit, eDiscovery, and data migration support to our global customer base. The team is a specialized professional services department that delivers service and industry expertise on audit, legal eDiscovery, and data management related inquiries.

Are you up for the challenge?

Your responsibilities:



Review, validate, approve and complete Data Service requests, according to departmental SLAs
Act as a customer liaison to Development and Operation teams, escalating bugs, system failures and data issues as necessary
Provide accurate completion timelines and project milestone estimates, and deliver accordingly
Provide archive information and support to customer-facing teams across the business
Demonstrate problem-solving and resourcefulness that deliver results for the customer
Communicate (verbal & written) technical explanations effectively to a non-technical audience
Actively guide and provide support to the Data Services team when they call for help
Maintain and adhere to information security standards and protocols, as directed by Global Relay‚Äôs Information Security Policies
Understands importance of quality control, information integrity, completeness and accuracy of data



Technical



Run/write PosgresQL (or SQL similar) queries for custom reporting and troubleshooting purposes
Build scripts/macros to automate or increase efficiency for data processing
Perform A9 archive changes (legal holds, flagging rules etc.)
Investigate and troubleshoot product, system and data errors
Participate in internal product testing and QA as needed



Administrative



Maintain detailed case documentation and perform customer request tracking
Perform case management using a ticketing system including: creation, action and closure of assigned import tickets
Generate processing logs and summary reports for customer review and verification
Research and document internal processes and industry knowledge on an ad hoc basis
Contribute to the maintenance of workstations and Windows servers



Management Support:



Provide the Data Services Team Leads with recommendations for policy and procedural improvements
Assist with cross-company issues and trouble-shooting
Support Management with completion of ah-hoc tasks and projects



Case Management:



Archive 9 Data Export Queue Management
Archive 9 Archive Query Requests
Archive 9 Legal Hold and Flagging Requests
Archive 9/Archive 10 Data Import and Migration Requests



Project Management:



Complete data investigation and project coordination in collaboration with Data Services Specialist as needed
Liaise with internal teams and stakeholders on operational issues
Provide basic Project Management in support of larger/more complex requests



Leadership, Coaching & Mentoring:



Train and mentor new hires; review and shadow new hire‚Äôs work to ensure quality



About you:



Post-secondary education or relevant work experience
1-3 years in a technical support role or equivalent work experience
Strong written and verbal communication in English
Experience in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Outlook
Technical/desktop trouble-shooting skills and computer proficiency
Logical, methodical and predictable in their work
Self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision
Exceptional organizational and problem-solving skills with proven accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to meet strict deadlines, while balancing multiple tasks or projects
Demonstrates technical aptitude and an appetite for continuous learning



Working conditions:



Prepared to work evening / weekend shifts on occasion, for scheduled activities or to meet project deadlines.
Prepared to work statutory holidays as needed
Repetitive work required



Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia‚Äôs pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$50,000‚Äî$60,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there‚Äôs no ceiling to what you can achieve. It‚Äôs the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You‚Äôll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You‚Äôll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you‚Äôll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it‚Äôs flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
ITC Infotech is looking for ‚ÄúBusiness System Analyst‚Äù to join our team in Vancouver, Canada.




Mode of Work- Hybrid, the person needs to be at premises 2-3 days in a week.




Position Details :




We are looking for Business System Analyst who will help us Business and functional requirement gathering for small medium complex scope; compiling needs from multiple stakeholders into a single set of prioritized requirements.
Identify business processes, document their workflow in process maps which reflect the relationship between the operating model and the technology platforms, and identify roles within these processes.
Work with stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, assist in aligning overall scope and sequencing recommendations with business stakeholders.
Include dependency management and architectural decisions in requirements.
Engages with engineering team to design technical solutions that meet business requirements.
Oversee the implementation of technical solutions, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget.
Assists in testing and participates in test phases prior to UAT.
Updates technical specs based on testing, prioritized defects or post-release lessons learned
Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Create and maintain reports to support business decision-making and provide actionable recommendations.
Supports communication for application/system deployment
Works to ensure application availability and SLAs for operational readiness
Utilize or develop artifacts such as business requirements documentation, JIRA. and Confluence to facilitate requirements alignment sessions, develop test scripts, and document requirements for SOX auditing.
Evaluate current business processes, workflows, and roadmaps to have a comprehensive understanding of current state and ideal future state.
Lead cross functional collaboration and drives to alignment with business partners within constraints of the project or work.







Qualifications:




Senior Business System Analyst with over 5+ years of experience supporting IT projects within an enterprise environment (1000+ employees). Ability to work with multiple cross-functional teams in an

agile environment.

2+ projects working as a BA on a POS solution end to end. Must have experience working with gateways/processors. Payment experience is a must in order to understand the complexity of the environment.
2+ projects (end to end) working with data integrations (APls, files) - must demonstrate the ability to analyze cross-functional flows and understand functional flows in Saas applications.
Experience creating technical specifications and documentation for large, complex projects
Strong understanding of retail systems, including POS, inventory management and e-commerce platforms.
Experience with data analysis tools and technologies, such as SOL, Excel. and Bl tools.
Knowledge of various project lifecycle methodologies, including Agile and Scrum.
Understanding of Cl/CD pipelines and automation, Container Management Application Performance Engineering, monitoring, alerting, AWS Services and Architecture
Ability to determine estimates of effort and impacts for a variety of solutions and influence technical discussions and decisions
Strong organizational skills with the ability to track and prioritize numerous tasks and to coordinate activities with a high sense of urgency
Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent presentation, verbal, written, interpersonal and listening skills
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation
Challenges the status quo, champions change and influences others to change.

Show more
HTML:
ITC Infotech is looking for ‚ÄúBusiness System Analyst‚Äù to join our team in Vancouver, Canada.


Mode of Work- Hybrid, the person needs to be at premises 2-3 days in a week.


Position Details :


  • We are looking for Business System Analyst who will help us Business and functional requirement gathering for small medium complex scope; compiling needs from multiple stakeholders into a single set of prioritized requirements.
  • Identify business processes, document their workflow in process maps which reflect the relationship between the operating model and the technology platforms, and identify roles within these processes.
  • Work with stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, assist in aligning overall scope and sequencing recommendations with business stakeholders.
  • Include dependency management and architectural decisions in requirements.
  • Engages with engineering team to design technical solutions that meet business requirements.
  • Oversee the implementation of technical solutions, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget.
  • Assists in testing and participates in test phases prior to UAT.
  • Updates technical specs based on testing, prioritized defects or post-release lessons learned
  • Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Create and maintain reports to support business decision-making and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Supports communication for application/system deployment
  • Works to ensure application availability and SLAs for operational readiness
  • Utilize or develop artifacts such as business requirements documentation, JIRA. and Confluence to facilitate requirements alignment sessions, develop test scripts, and document requirements for SOX auditing.
  • Evaluate current business processes, workflows, and roadmaps to have a comprehensive understanding of current state and ideal future state.
  • Lead cross functional collaboration and drives to alignment with business partners within constraints of the project or work.



Qualifications:


  • Senior Business System Analyst with over 5+ years of experience supporting IT projects within an enterprise environment (1000+ employees). Ability to work with multiple cross-functional teams in an

agile environment.

  • 2+ projects working as a BA on a POS solution end to end. Must have experience working with gateways/processors. Payment experience is a must in order to understand the complexity of the environment.
  • 2+ projects (end to end) working with data integrations (APls, files) - must demonstrate the ability to analyze cross-functional flows and understand functional flows in Saas applications.
  • Experience creating technical specifications and documentation for large, complex projects
  • Strong understanding of retail systems, including POS, inventory management and e-commerce platforms.
  • Experience with data analysis tools and technologies, such as SOL, Excel. and Bl tools.
  • Knowledge of various project lifecycle methodologies, including Agile and Scrum.
  • Understanding of Cl/CD pipelines and automation, Container Management Application Performance Engineering, monitoring, alerting, AWS Services and Architecture
  • Ability to determine estimates of effort and impacts for a variety of solutions and influence technical discussions and decisions
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to track and prioritize numerous tasks and to coordinate activities with a high sense of urgency
  • Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent presentation, verbal, written, interpersonal and listening skills
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation
  • Challenges the status quo, champions change and influences others to change.

Title: General Application
Description:
Blackbird Interactive is a creative-fueled, future-driven, independent game studio where the best talent in the industry can find long-term careers to help grow their abilities while working on a wide range of projects, which encompass world-class IPs as well as our own creations across multiple genres.

In 2022, we announced that our studio is implementing a four-day work week as well as supporting in-studio, remote within Canada, and hybrid work arrangements as permanent options to our employees.

Interested in a career with Blackbird Interactive? We are a creative-fueled, future-driven, independent studio located in Vancouver. We're also moving to a four day work week!

We're always on the look out for new talent in a number of fields including design, programming, art, production, community management, audio, and animation. If you are talented and passionate but don't fit into any of our current job openings, please apply here!

Requirements


To be an awesome and humble game developer!
Join a team of skilled and creative people, and create something bigger and better than anyone could have imagined
Experience developing creative and compelling entertainment products
Self direction and a proven ability to thrive in a highly dynamic and technical environment
Strong inter-disciplinary collaboration skills, including verbal and written skills

Show more

Title: Senior Analyst - NHL
Description:
We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

You will be a member of our Sports Analytics team and empower the NHL game team with data-driven insights, tools, and recommendations to make more data informed decisions, driving value for our business and players. This is a hybrid role located in Vancouver, B.C. and will report to the Director of Analytics of NHL and UFC.

Responsibilities


You will collaborate with your team to understand requirements and scope deliverables
You will guide the game team in being hypothesis focused, and data driven
You will deliver end to end analytics projects and present insights
You will develop a suite of dashboards to promote self-service data access
You will contribute to the aggregate layer of data to support efficient analysis
You will design game telemetry that meets analysis requirements


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis
1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans
Expertise in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources
Experience in statistical modeling with Python or R (e.g. regression, clustering)
Data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
Show more

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:

Desired Start Date: Asap

Contract Length: 6 months to start, long term extension to follow

Possibility of Extension: Likely

Location: Hybrid Vancouver (4 days/week)

Hours: 40/wk

Status: Inc or T4




Business Systems Analyst ‚Äì Technical and Process Focus




Our client is looking for a Business Systems Analyst focused on technical and process-driven projects. Initially, you will work on a REST API-based system integration project, collaborating with a squad handling diverse data and system integrations.




Responsibilities:

Analyze data workflows, dependencies, and integration patterns.
Document business requirements, technical specifications, and process flows.
Support QA and UAT processes, ensuring data integrity and integration success.

3+ years as a Business Analyst with technical and process-focused experience.
Strong understanding of REST APIs, data workflows, and integration tools.
Proficiency in JIRA, Confluence, and diagramming tools.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and Agile collaboration skills.

Title: Operations Analyst- Rotational Program
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Operations Team at Brex

The Operations team is the bridge between our product and our customers. Our priority is to keep our customers happy and their businesses protected, while delivering vital information back to our internal teams. We are responsible for underwriting all of our customers, while simultaneously managing Brex‚Äôs risk exposures. We work cross-functionally with Risk, Compliance, Data, and Engineering to allow Brex to scale efficiently, keeping quality top of mind.

What You‚Äôll Do

Throughout this 18-20 month program, you will rotate through two of our Operations teams, learning about risk management, operations processes, procedures, data reporting and analysis while also contributing to critical process improvements and developments.You will be testing different approaches and will challenge the status quo to bring insight from each rotation to the next, streamlining processes and improving cross-team communication. During each rotation, you will have one core project focused on key data insights, process implementation, or process improvement. You will have the opportunity to share your findings with your program class and Brex Executives.

The Operations Analyst Rotational Program is supported by the Leadership Team. Your class will have frequent meetings with various Brex leaders, providing a unique opportunity to work closely with and learn from Unicorn executives.

Where you‚Äôll work

This role will be based in our Vancouver office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year.

Responsibilities


Maintain day-to-day operations for each rotation
Analyze business inefficiencies and propose solutions to our leadership team
Work cross-functionally within operations and departments outside of operations to improve existing processes, and create multi-team procedures


Requirements


Bachelor's degree
Professional proficiency in spoken and written English
Demonstrated knowledge, understanding, and insight of business concepts and processes that are needed for making decisions
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while successfully adapting to change
A keen interest in business operations
Experience in financial modeling, data analysis, or a similar area where you have applied your knowledge of techniques and tools to promote effective analysis
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams as well as independently
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday


Bonus points


Strong understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Salesforce Reporting
Experience in SQL and Looker reporting
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to convey complex and relevant information to a wide range of audiences


Compensation

The expected salary range for this role is $69,000 - $72,000 CAD. However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




8 month contract opportunity, high potential to extend




"Hybrid" work environment - 2 times per week in downtown Vancouver office




Seeking a Data Engineer who is passionate about big data technology and delivering data solution to handle TB scale data per day and help the business meet the distinct needs of customers.




Role & responsibilities:

Data engineering activities including data ingestion, data modelling, data processing data governance
Work with team to improve the data pipeline to process large scale data efficiently
Be a data steward to educate and promote the data importance and data-driven culture
Collaborate with the key stakeholders, product owners, external vendors to define solutions for business and technical requirements
Be responsible for system architecture design and data engineering activities including data ingestion, data modelling, data processing and data governance
Work as a technical expert and strategic thought leader to the data platform by providing architectural leadership
Lead, participate, guide and mentor other team members on architecture and design with hands on




Desired skills & experience:

SQL
Python
Google Cloud (GCP)
Spark
Airflow
EKS
Experience working with data infrastructure (understand how spark runs, how airflow works with AWS)
Architecture design and development of large-scale data platform and data application with simple solutions
Have deep understanding on data engineering principles and data modeling
Strong knowledge of SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and preferably experience with NoSQL databases
Experience with engineering tools such as Airflow, EKS, EMR, Redshift, Kubernetes
Good Hadoop ecosystem knowledge (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive, Presto)
Experience on large-scale multi-tier cloud applications and environments
Hands-on experience of high availability systems and API design
Experience with CICD tools such as GitHub Actions
Familiar with Agile/Scrum software development methodologies




$70 - $80 per hour for an INC consultant




If you're interested, please apply with resume

If you are a strong fit, I will be in contact quickly to discuss additional details and next steps

Best regards,

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role: Data Engineer

Target Start Date: 2025-04-14

Expected Duration: 12 months

Workplace Arrangement: Hybrid

Experience level: Senior (5+ years)




About this team

This team is committed to enabling seamless, best in class experiences for our global workforce. The Data & Analytics Pillar is a newly formed team, focused on automating our core health & wealth offerings as well as work across the department to enable efforts driven by the People Systems, Digital Workplace & Learning, and Workforce Agility pillars. The Data Engineer is passionate about all the things that data can unlock for the business and our people.




A successful candidate will be a problem solver and an expert in ETL programming/scripting, data modelling, data integration, SQL and have exemplary communication skills. The candidate will need to be comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail. The candidate will know, and love working with new technologies, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner with cross functional business teams to answer key business questions. Apart from building data pipelines, you will be an advocate for automation, performance tuning and cost optimization. Be ready to question the status quo and bring forth intelligent solutions and proof of concepts.




Key Responsibilities

Interface with cross functional business teams, gather requirements and take ownership of the end-to-end delivery of the data product/pipelines.
Build robust and scalable data pipelines using Snowflake, Airflow and PySpark.
Embrace automation, reduce cost, and human dependencies wherever possible.
Build frameworks and reusable components.
Bring a product development mindset to every aspect of data engineering development activities.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research.
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
3+ years‚Äô experience in snowflake, airflow, data bricks.
Proficiency in Python.
Experience with any of cloud systems ‚Äì Azure, AWS or GCP.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines.
Knowledge of data management fundamentals, data storage principles, ETL, Data Modeling, and Data Architecture.
Excellent problem-solving skills, combined with the ability to present your findings/insights clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form.
Exhibit Entrepreneurship at every level of work.




Desired Qualifications:

Experience with Databricks and PySpark.
Familiarity with one of the DevOps tools like Azure DevOps, GitLab.
Working experience with any reporting tool.
Experience working with sensitive and restricted data.
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn‚Äôt take themselves too seriously.

  • 3+ years‚Äô experience in snowflake, airflow, data bricks.
  • Proficiency in Python.
  • Experience with any of cloud systems ‚Äì Azure, AWS or GCP.
  • Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines.
  • Knowledge of data management fundamentals, data storage principles, ETL, Data Modeling, and Data Architecture.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, combined with the ability to present your findings/insights clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form.
  • Exhibit Entrepreneurship at every level of work.


Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience with Databricks and PySpark.
  • Familiarity with one of the DevOps tools like Azure DevOps, GitLab.
  • Working experience with any reporting tool.
  • Experience working with sensitive and restricted data.
  • Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
  • Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn‚Äôt take themselves too seriously.

Title: Senior Business and Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada

Job Summary

Join Semtech to deliver exceptional service and support to our valued customers. This is an exciting opportunity to join a collaborative team committed to excellence and making a positive impact on our customers. We enable our customers and partners to achieve a new standard of IoT product performance and we have a versatile and exceptionally talented team of individuals to make this vision a reality!



Business Analysis and Strategy: 60%
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Design and analyze business processes and recommend improvements to optimize operational performance.
Identify deficiencies in business/data processes, data quality, usability or accuracy.
Perform impact analysis and ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù assessments for systems enhancements.
Collaborate with Salesforce developers to define and implement customizations, workflows, and automation within Salesforce.
Document all system-related processes and flows.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data solutions.
Present data visualizations that effectively communicate key insights and trends to stakeholders.
Collaborate with leadership to understand strategic objectives and align data analytics initiatives accordingly.
Project Management: 10%
Utilize Jira/Aha to manage tasks, track project progress, and prioritize deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of data projects.
Lead data-focused workshops, meetings, and presentations to drive alignment across teams.
Data Governance and Quality Assurance: 25%
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across systems.
Develop and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
Designing processes and proactively addressing data quality issues and improving reporting reliability.
Coordinates and conducts User Acceptance Testing.
Continuous Improvement and Innovation: 5%
Stay at the forefront of industry trends, technologies, and advancements in data analytics.
Propose and implement innovative solutions, methodologies, and tools to enhance the organization's data capabilities.


Minimum Qualifications



Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in business and data analysis.
Proficient in using Power BI and Qlik.
Extensive expertise in Excel and other data analysis tools for processing and analyzing large datasets.
Skilled in using JIRA and AHA for managing workflows and projects.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
Proven experience with Salesforce, including hands-on expertise in utilizing its features for customer support functions.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (e.g. AWS and SAP).
Knowledge of Agile or Scrum methodologies.


Career Growth Philosophy

At Semtech, we seek innovation and leadership from each and every member of our team. Our goal is to ensure that our talented professionals are equipped with support, resources, and the opportunity to excel. Our pay-for-performance philosophy provides recognition and prestige coupled with a competitive compensation package.

The intent of this job description is to describe the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. Incumbents may be required to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically included in this description.

All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

A reasonable estimate of the pay range for this position is CAD $75,000 - $95,000. There are several factors taken into consideration in determining base salary, including but not limited to: job-related qualifications, skills, education and experience, as well as job location and the value of other elements of an employee‚Äôs total compensation package.

Title: Sr Analyst, Business Analytics - Insights
Description:
Marketing Statement

As the largest operating company in the integrated TransLink enterprise, Coast Mountain Bus Company (CMBC) operates a fleet of clean-fuel conventional and community shuttle buses, zero-emission trolley buses, and passenger ferry SeaBuses in Metro Vancouver, the largest single transit service area in Canada.

At CMBC, one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, we're committed to providing an innovative, healthy, and engaging workforce. This is reflected in our workforce of over 5,500 employees performing over 400 unique jobs, who are committed and empowered to deliver service that attracts nearly 1.1 million passengers daily and connects people, businesses, and communities in the Metro Vancouver region.

We have the important job of helping our passengers get to work, appointments, visiting with family and friends, and back again every day. Metro Vancouver relies on us, and we take that as a point of pride.

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Provides technical expertise to the development of a data governance framework for CMBC, including leading stakeholder engagement, developing, and monitoring progress of long-term roadmap, establishing requisite business processes, and ensuring the Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Analytic (DW/BI&A) solutions align with the established framework. Provides technical leadership and supervision on the design, development, and quality assurance of monthly dashboard reports to the Executive Management Team (EMT), to ensure timely and accurate delivery. Supports the Manager, Business Analytics & Insights with leading the annual Corporate Business Planning and Reporting process through stakeholder engagement with leaders from across the organization, ensuring alignment to Corporate and Enterprise-level strategic plans.

Key Accountabilities

Provides technical leadership on planning and implementation of DW/BI&A solutions. Designs, implements, and maintains customized data warehouse, business intelligence and analytics (DW/BI&A) technical solutions. Ensures DW/BI&A solutions function effectively and align with standards, policies and supports ongoing Data Governance Program within CMBC. Ensures solutions adhere to best practices and Enterprise standards.

Designs, implements, and maintains the Corporate Business Plan BI reporting solution, data collection process and KPI integration to ensure the alignment of planned annual works to strategic long-range workplans, Enterprise goals, as well as ties together corporate-level KPIs to the annual initiatives to ensure alignment to planned works and performance measures assessed.

Provides technical expertise in the development and sustainment of a data governance framework for CMBC, including standardized documentation. Leads stakeholder engagement and ensures the DW/BI&A solutions developed align with the governance framework established. Leads discussions with those identified as part of the governance framework within the organization and looks for alignment opportunities from across the Enterprise.

Stays abreast of new techniques, technologies, and industry trends, and participates in relevant industry events related to Data Governance. Leads the team towards modern practices and techniques; establishes and participates in design reviews, regular or ad-hoc data quality reviews ensuring data quality throughout the data pipeline.

Manages and develops projects of moderate to high impact, risk, and complexity. Designs and develops project scope, schedules, and work plans; defining and prioritizing deliverables; ensuring compliance with Enterprise standards, policies and procedures. Alerts management to critical issues and risks. Identifies and resolves project issues, including scheduling overruns, conflicting agendas, and technical issues.

Provides technical support to the maintenance of custom Extract Transform Load (ETL) solution, as well as continual assessment of metadata reporting to ensure data integrity and quality assurance.

Consults and collaborates with business and technology stakeholders on data management and data architecture strategies, governance, practices, and policies.

Supports the Executive Management Team by providing KPIs to report on monthly performance; leads requirements gathering, target setting, report design and delivery and documentation. Carries out analysis related to variances in corporate performance measures, recommending best practices to the Senior Management team for problem areas.

Prepares quarterly reports for the CMBC Board of Directors and TransLink Statutory Reporting requirements.

Provides support to the Manager in the development and maintenance of the Team‚Äôs Strategic Plan Roadmap, planning and decisions making. Provides input on the dependency and sequencing of projects as well as highlights any potential project or compliance risks to ensure project priorities align to annual objectives.

Participates in the development and implementation of a continuous improvement strategy by offering Business Process advisory services to other departments. Supports the delivery of better value and greater efficiency through the identification and elimination of unnecessary complexity within business processes and identification of better ways of working, applying Lean methodology.

Acts as a key liaison with International Benchmarking Groups to conduct detailed surveys and analysis. Determines international best practices related to specific Key Performance Indicators and completes analysis of moderate to high impact, recommending business changes with financial/budgetary impacts. Completes follow-up analysis to confirm impacts and ROI. Presents findings to Executive Team, and at conferences as requested by Executive leadership.

Develops business cases to support KPIs with strategic objectives and leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices; provides comparable performance measures from other transit systems and business enterprises to stakeholders towards informed decision making. Forecasts the implications of various alternatives to maximize the effectiveness of KPIs for organizational success.

Represents the Business Analytics & Insights Team on inter-departmental committees and as a technical input for larger scale capital projects as requested.

Provides technical support and guidance to other Analysts and supports Managers within the organization by connecting them to relevant data sources for their reporting needs, including developing custom SQL views of required data.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or other relevant business-related fields plus seven (7) years of progressive experience in performance reporting functions in a multifaceted organization.

Other Requirements

Advanced knowledge of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards

Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Data Warehouse and BI technologies, both Cloud and on-prem (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Desktop, PowerBI Report Builder, PowerBI Service, Tableau etc.)

Strong knowledge of Microsoft PowerPlatform solutions including PowerApps, PowerAutomate and Power Platform Admin Centre.

Strong knowledge and understanding of the relevant concepts of data mining and data warehousing

Demonstrated ability to communicate the complexities of technical programs (e.g. Kimball methodology, modern data warehousing).

Advanced experience of data modeling and business process design software, such as Visio.

Advanced knowledge of coaching and mentoring teams on Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence Architect concepts and methodology.

Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills to handle conflict resolution, facilitating discussion and alternatives of different approaches.

Solid leadership skills with ability to manage and influence direct or indirect reporting staff, and to provide specialized guidance and expertise to all levels of the organization.

Excellent planning, organization, and time management skills with strong ability to organize competing priorities.

Experience maintaining ETL process using software such as SSIS

Prior experience in design, deployment, or sustainment of Data Governance Program

Advanced knowledge of concepts, principles, practices, and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards, and dashboards

Advanced interpersonal and communication skills to provide specialized guidance and expertise to managers, staff and customers; and to develop and manage critical relationships at all levels in the enterprise.

Experience in leading and facilitating Lean/process improvements event is an asset.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $82,400 - $123,600 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How to Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to https://www.translink.ca/About-Us/Careers.aspx to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: March 05, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Coast Mountain Bus Company is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca
