Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

Axiom Builders is a leading construction partner for many major developers in both residential and commercial construction, with over 5 million square feet under construction in Vancouver, Victoria, Calgary , Seattle and Nashville . Our skilled team of over 500 diverse construction professionals are dedicated to meeting client expectations, with the goal of becoming an extension of their project team. Together, we execute thoughtful community-centric projects, always with safety top of mind and backed by our COR safety certification.

From iconic residential towers, noteworthy rental developments, LEED Gold office buildings, and purpose-built tenant improvements, our portfolio and expertise continue to grow. Two of our projects ‚Äì Fifteen Fifteen in Vancouver and REN in Seattle ‚Äì received a 2023 Award of Excellence from the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat (CTBUH). We‚Äôre also proud to have representation on the UDI U40 Executive Committee, and to have made Kincentric‚Äôs Best Employers list a few times over the past few years.

Our expertise , determination and straightforward approach are derived from our values ‚Äì Accountability, Autonomy, Excellence, Humility, and Respect. The result: a quality product that‚Äôs built right ‚Äì the first time.

Learn more about life at Axiom and our projects .

About The Role

Axiom Builders is seeking a Data Engineer to support the development, implementation, and maintenance of our data infrastructure at our head office in Vancouver. Working with cross-functional stakeholders to understand and address data requirements, the Data Engineer will take ownership of the end-to-end data engineering components, develop data pipelines to collect, store and transform data effectively and accurately, while maintaining data engineering and architecture best practices.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Microsoft Fabric;
Implement medallion data architecture that supports batch data processing;
Integrate various data sources into a unified data model, leveraging Microsoft Fabric for storage and analytics;
Create and maintain ETL/ELT processes to load, transform, and cleanse data efficiently;
Build and maintain optimized, scalable data models for Power BI and other analytics tools and maintain comprehensive documentation for data pipelines, models, and workflows;
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective data solutions;
Enable advanced analytics and reporting by developing reusable data sets and semantic layers;
Optimize storage, compute, and data access strategies to balance performance and cost, focusing on Microsoft Fabric capabilities.
Provide support and guidance to team members or cross-functional teams using Microsoft tools.


What You Bring

The ideal candidate is a first-rate problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced environment where autonomy is encouraged. You are detail-oriented, analytical, and you possess exceptional customer service and communication skills. Most importantly, you take great pride and ownership in your work, and you want to be part of a team that embraces new technology and innovation.

Skills And Experience


Diploma or degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field;
3+ years of professional experience in Data Engineering;
Strong expertise in Microsoft data technology stack including Azure Data Factory, ADLS Gen 2, Azure SQL, Azure Key Vault and Power BI;
Strong expertise implementing medallion architectures (experience with Microsoft Fabric is an asset);
Strong expertise in programming PySpark and SQL;
Experience in Microsoft Power BI, Power Query and other Power Platform tools;
Analytical mindset with the ability to problem-solve and troubleshoot to resolve complex data-related issues;
Clear and effective communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders;
Experience in Construction industry or similar industries is considered an asset;
Excited to support the growth of data within an organization.


Your Rewards

We‚Äôre committed to the success and development of our people and recognize that they are the drivers behind our success. We provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

The base salary range for this role is posted below , depending on experience, plus a competitive bonus program. During the interview process, let‚Äôs t alk to get the right fit for your experience level.

In Addition, Our Total Rewards Package Offers

Rewards


Benefits & Perks | 100% health/dental coverage,* up to 5% match on retirement savings, virtual healthcare, and great perks
Mental Health Support ‚ÄØ| Unlimited counselling and support for you and your family
Compensation | Competitive pay with annual market analysis


Opportunities


Unique Projects | 40+ projects in motion, from skyline-changers to bespoke sales centres
Career Growth | Twice per year we level-up with our Performance Feedback Program
Learning & Development | 15 offerings from our dedicated L&D team


Community


The People | Annual events to bring us together and connect across markets and teams
Giving Back | 2000 + volunteer hours since launch of our Community Engagement program
Leadership | 12 passionate execs focused on developing our teams and emerging leaders


What‚Äôs Next: How to Apply

About

Want to love what you do? We‚Äôre always looking for talented people who fit our culture and are passionate about what they do. Here are t wo easy ways to apply:


Click ‚ÄòA pply Now ‚Äô
Email careers@axiombuilders.ca


Thank you for your interest in Axiom Builders! While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file for future opportunities.

Follow us on LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition team and Instagram to see updates on our current‚ÄØprojects.


For Canadian employees. Our US benefits package is equally competitive.


Apply Now

Title: Systems Analyst, Data Services
Description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world‚Äôs most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It‚Äôs a place where you can genuinely make an impact ‚Äì and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your role:

We are looking for analytical candidates with solid technical aptitude to join our bright, diligent and dynamic team. As the Data Services Systems Analyst, you will carry out the technical implementation of all Data Services' Import requests, in addition to supporting the daily processes and business operations of our fast-paced organization. The Data Services Systems Analyst will focus on the backend operations and escalation of all customer-facing systems related issues within Data Services to ensure proper facilitation and completion of Import case queue of Client historical archives being ingested into Global Relay's archives. You will play a critical role in proposing solutions, testing new features and contributing to the development of internal products.

The Data Services team provides audit, eDiscovery, and data migration support to our global customer base. The team is a specialized professional services department that delivers service and industry expertise on audit, legal eDiscovery, and data management related inquiries.

Are you up for the challenge?

Your responsibilities:



Review, validate, approve and complete Data Service requests, according to departmental SLAs
Act as a customer liaison to Development and Operation teams, escalating bugs, system failures and data issues as necessary
Provide accurate completion timelines and project milestone estimates, and deliver accordingly
Provide archive information and support to customer-facing teams across the business
Demonstrate problem-solving and resourcefulness that deliver results for the customer
Communicate (verbal & written) technical explanations effectively to a non-technical audience
Actively guide and provide support to the Data Services team when they call for help
Maintain and adhere to information security standards and protocols, as directed by Global Relay‚Äôs Information Security Policies
Understands importance of quality control, information integrity, completeness and accuracy of data



Technical



Run/write PosgresQL (or SQL similar) queries for custom reporting and troubleshooting purposes
Build scripts/macros to automate or increase efficiency for data processing
Perform A9 archive changes (legal holds, flagging rules etc.)
Investigate and troubleshoot product, system and data errors
Participate in internal product testing and QA as needed



Administrative



Maintain detailed case documentation and perform customer request tracking
Perform case management using a ticketing system including: creation, action and closure of assigned import tickets
Generate processing logs and summary reports for customer review and verification
Research and document internal processes and industry knowledge on an ad hoc basis
Contribute to the maintenance of workstations and Windows servers



Management Support:



Provide the Data Services Team Leads with recommendations for policy and procedural improvements
Assist with cross-company issues and trouble-shooting
Support Management with completion of ah-hoc tasks and projects



Case Management:



Archive 9 Data Export Queue Management
Archive 9 Archive Query Requests
Archive 9 Legal Hold and Flagging Requests
Archive 9/Archive 10 Data Import and Migration Requests



Project Management:



Complete data investigation and project coordination in collaboration with Data Services Specialist as needed
Liaise with internal teams and stakeholders on operational issues
Provide basic Project Management in support of larger/more complex requests



Leadership, Coaching & Mentoring:



Train and mentor new hires; review and shadow new hire‚Äôs work to ensure quality



About you:



Post-secondary education or relevant work experience
1-3 years in a technical support role or equivalent work experience
Strong written and verbal communication in English
Experience in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Outlook
Technical/desktop trouble-shooting skills and computer proficiency
Logical, methodical and predictable in their work
Self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision
Exceptional organizational and problem-solving skills with proven accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to meet strict deadlines, while balancing multiple tasks or projects
Demonstrates technical aptitude and an appetite for continuous learning



Working conditions:



Prepared to work evening / weekend shifts on occasion, for scheduled activities or to meet project deadlines.
Prepared to work statutory holidays as needed
Repetitive work required



Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia‚Äôs pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$50,000‚Äî$60,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there‚Äôs no ceiling to what you can achieve. It‚Äôs the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You‚Äôll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You‚Äôll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you‚Äôll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it‚Äôs flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.
Show more

  • Train and mentor new hires; review and shadow new hire‚Äôs work to ensure quality


About you:


  • Post-secondary education or relevant work experience
  • 1-3 years in a technical support role or equivalent work experience
  • Strong written and verbal communication in English
  • Experience in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Outlook
  • Technical/desktop trouble-shooting skills and computer proficiency
  • Logical, methodical and predictable in their work
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision
  • Exceptional organizational and problem-solving skills with proven accuracy and attention to detail
  • Ability to meet strict deadlines, while balancing multiple tasks or projects
  • Demonstrates technical aptitude and an appetite for continuous learning


Working conditions:


  • Prepared to work evening / weekend shifts on occasion, for scheduled activities or to meet project deadlines.
  • Prepared to work statutory holidays as needed
  • Repetitive work required


Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia‚Äôs pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$50,000‚Äî$60,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there‚Äôs no ceiling to what you can achieve. It‚Äôs the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You‚Äôll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You‚Äôll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you‚Äôll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it‚Äôs flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
ITC Infotech is looking for ‚ÄúBusiness System Analyst‚Äù to join our team in Vancouver, Canada.




Mode of Work- Hybrid, the person needs to be at premises 2-3 days in a week.




Position Details :




We are looking for Business System Analyst who will help us Business and functional requirement gathering for small medium complex scope; compiling needs from multiple stakeholders into a single set of prioritized requirements.
Identify business processes, document their workflow in process maps which reflect the relationship between the operating model and the technology platforms, and identify roles within these processes.
Work with stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, assist in aligning overall scope and sequencing recommendations with business stakeholders.
Include dependency management and architectural decisions in requirements.
Engages with engineering team to design technical solutions that meet business requirements.
Oversee the implementation of technical solutions, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget.
Assists in testing and participates in test phases prior to UAT.
Updates technical specs based on testing, prioritized defects or post-release lessons learned
Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Create and maintain reports to support business decision-making and provide actionable recommendations.
Supports communication for application/system deployment
Works to ensure application availability and SLAs for operational readiness
Utilize or develop artifacts such as business requirements documentation, JIRA. and Confluence to facilitate requirements alignment sessions, develop test scripts, and document requirements for SOX auditing.
Evaluate current business processes, workflows, and roadmaps to have a comprehensive understanding of current state and ideal future state.
Lead cross functional collaboration and drives to alignment with business partners within constraints of the project or work.







Qualifications:




Senior Business System Analyst with over 5+ years of experience supporting IT projects within an enterprise environment (1000+ employees). Ability to work with multiple cross-functional teams in an

agile environment.

2+ projects working as a BA on a POS solution end to end. Must have experience working with gateways/processors. Payment experience is a must in order to understand the complexity of the environment.
2+ projects (end to end) working with data integrations (APls, files) - must demonstrate the ability to analyze cross-functional flows and understand functional flows in Saas applications.
Experience creating technical specifications and documentation for large, complex projects
Strong understanding of retail systems, including POS, inventory management and e-commerce platforms.
Experience with data analysis tools and technologies, such as SOL, Excel. and Bl tools.
Knowledge of various project lifecycle methodologies, including Agile and Scrum.
Understanding of Cl/CD pipelines and automation, Container Management Application Performance Engineering, monitoring, alerting, AWS Services and Architecture
Ability to determine estimates of effort and impacts for a variety of solutions and influence technical discussions and decisions
Strong organizational skills with the ability to track and prioritize numerous tasks and to coordinate activities with a high sense of urgency
Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent presentation, verbal, written, interpersonal and listening skills
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation
Challenges the status quo, champions change and influences others to change.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Profile

TTT Studios is a digital consulting and software developing company working for a global client list in multiple industries. Over the past decade, we‚Äôve built multiple applications and patented a portfolio of technologies. This experience has put us in the best position to cater to larger accounts and launch our own products. Our culture is essential to our company, and we foster an open and welcoming environment for everyone on our team. We understand that success comes from sweating the details. Carefully considered design‚Äîwhether in our user interface work, technical architectures, or project management processes‚Äîis at the core of everything we do. We expect amazing things from each other, and through tight collaboration, we achieve greatness.




Priority given to the candidates currently based in the Vancouver Area.




About the Role - Data Engineer

We are seeking three experienced Data Engineers to join our team. These roles are essential for developing and optimizing our data and analytics infrastructure to support advanced data processing and analysis capabilities. The ideal candidates will have a robust background in data engineering, proficiency in programming languages, and a solid understanding of cloud-based data services.

Key Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Certifications in data engineering or cloud computing (e.g., Microsoft Azure Data Engineer, Google Professional Data Engineer).
Minimum of 7 years of experience in data engineering roles.
7 years of proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, T-SQL, and familiarity with data analytics tools like Tableau, Power BI, SAS.
Strong knowledge of ETL pipelines, data modelling, and both SQL and NoSQL database systems.
Expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, Cloudera, GCP, and tools like Apache Kafka or Apache Spark.
5 years of familiarity with data security, privacy, and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical findings effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
5 years of familiarity with government operations or public policy, providing insights into how public sector data is managed and utilized.




Hiring Process

Submit your application and include your CV
If shortlisted, you will be invited to a video interview with our HR Manager
Next, we will arrange an online technical interview to assess your experience, technical skills, and fit for the role, as well as your alignment with our company culture and values
After completing all rounds of interviews, we will make a final decision




Beyond the Paycheque




Never stop learning

Our commitment to growth also extends to your professional development. Take advantage of our education fund to attend conferences, workshops, and classes or pursue industry certifications. We also offer access to online learning resources to help you continue your education.




Invest in your well-being

We want you to be the best version of yourself. Our comprehensive benefits package includes generous paid time off, coverage for health, vision, dental, prescriptions, and subsidized health programs and perks. Our complete benefits package will take care of you and the well-being of your loved ones.




Surprise yourself with yoga & boxing lessons

Join our weekly expert-led yoga and boxing classes to enhance your physical and mental wellness. Learn how to throw a left uppercut or the latest asanas.




Enjoy profit-sharing bonuses

With each team member contributing to the overall success of TTT Studios, we reward everyone with performance and profit-sharing bonuses.

Show more

Title: General Application
Description:
Blackbird Interactive is a creative-fueled, future-driven, independent game studio where the best talent in the industry can find long-term careers to help grow their abilities while working on a wide range of projects, which encompass world-class IPs as well as our own creations across multiple genres.

In 2022, we announced that our studio is implementing a four-day work week as well as supporting in-studio, remote within Canada, and hybrid work arrangements as permanent options to our employees.

Interested in a career with Blackbird Interactive? We are a creative-fueled, future-driven, independent studio located in Vancouver. We're also moving to a four day work week!

We're always on the look out for new talent in a number of fields including design, programming, art, production, community management, audio, and animation. If you are talented and passionate but don't fit into any of our current job openings, please apply here!

Requirements


To be an awesome and humble game developer!
Join a team of skilled and creative people, and create something bigger and better than anyone could have imagined
Experience developing creative and compelling entertainment products
Self direction and a proven ability to thrive in a highly dynamic and technical environment
Strong inter-disciplinary collaboration skills, including verbal and written skills

Title: Senior Analyst - NHL
Description:
We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

You will be a member of our Sports Analytics team and empower the NHL game team with data-driven insights, tools, and recommendations to make more data informed decisions, driving value for our business and players. This is a hybrid role located in Vancouver, B.C. and will report to the Director of Analytics of NHL and UFC.

Responsibilities


You will collaborate with your team to understand requirements and scope deliverables
You will guide the game team in being hypothesis focused, and data driven
You will deliver end to end analytics projects and present insights
You will develop a suite of dashboards to promote self-service data access
You will contribute to the aggregate layer of data to support efficient analysis
You will design game telemetry that meets analysis requirements


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis
1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans
Expertise in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources
Experience in statistical modeling with Python or R (e.g. regression, clustering)
Data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Systems Analyst

Desired Start Date: Asap

Contract Length: 6 months to start, long term extension to follow

Possibility of Extension: Likely

Location: Hybrid Vancouver (4 days/week)

Hours: 40/wk

Status: Inc or T4




Business Systems Analyst ‚Äì Technical and Process Focus




Our client is looking for a Business Systems Analyst focused on technical and process-driven projects. Initially, you will work on a REST API-based system integration project, collaborating with a squad handling diverse data and system integrations.




Responsibilities:

Gather and translate business needs into technical and functional requirements.
Define user stories, acceptance criteria, and process flows for API integrations.
Analyze data workflows, dependencies, and integration patterns.
Document business requirements, technical specifications, and process flows.
Support QA and UAT processes, ensuring data integrity and integration success.
Identify process improvement opportunities and collaborate on implementation.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
3+ years as a Business Analyst with technical and process-focused experience.
Strong understanding of REST APIs, data workflows, and integration tools.
Proficiency in JIRA, Confluence, and diagramming tools.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and Agile collaboration skills.

Title: Operations Analyst- Rotational Program
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Operations Team at Brex

The Operations team is the bridge between our product and our customers. Our priority is to keep our customers happy and their businesses protected, while delivering vital information back to our internal teams. We are responsible for underwriting all of our customers, while simultaneously managing Brex‚Äôs risk exposures. We work cross-functionally with Risk, Compliance, Data, and Engineering to allow Brex to scale efficiently, keeping quality top of mind.

What You‚Äôll Do

Throughout this 18-20 month program, you will rotate through two of our Operations teams, learning about risk management, operations processes, procedures, data reporting and analysis while also contributing to critical process improvements and developments.You will be testing different approaches and will challenge the status quo to bring insight from each rotation to the next, streamlining processes and improving cross-team communication. During each rotation, you will have one core project focused on key data insights, process implementation, or process improvement. You will have the opportunity to share your findings with your program class and Brex Executives.

The Operations Analyst Rotational Program is supported by the Leadership Team. Your class will have frequent meetings with various Brex leaders, providing a unique opportunity to work closely with and learn from Unicorn executives.

Where you‚Äôll work

This role will be based in our Vancouver office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year.

Responsibilities


Maintain day-to-day operations for each rotation
Analyze business inefficiencies and propose solutions to our leadership team
Work cross-functionally within operations and departments outside of operations to improve existing processes, and create multi-team procedures


Requirements


Bachelor's degree
Professional proficiency in spoken and written English
Demonstrated knowledge, understanding, and insight of business concepts and processes that are needed for making decisions
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while successfully adapting to change
A keen interest in business operations
Experience in financial modeling, data analysis, or a similar area where you have applied your knowledge of techniques and tools to promote effective analysis
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams as well as independently
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday


Bonus points


Strong understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Salesforce Reporting
Experience in SQL and Looker reporting
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to convey complex and relevant information to a wide range of audiences


Compensation

The expected salary range for this role is $69,000 - $72,000 CAD. However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What We Do:

iQmetrix is the only provider of Interconnected Commerce software solutions for telecom retail. Interconnected Commerce is a complete set of software and technologies that are modular, flexible, and have telecom-specific capabilities, enabling telecom retailers to provide an uplifting experience for their customers. We empower telecom brands to transact, activate, and fulfill products, as well as operate their business, and unify the online and in-store experiences. We interconnect the entire industry, bridging carriers, retailers, manufacturers, and a huge ecosystem of vendors and external system integrations.

For 25 years, we‚Äôve been passionate about helping the leading brands in telecom to grow by providing best-in-class software, services, and expertise that enables them to adapt and thrive. Our solutions powered $17BN in sales last year, handling nearly 60 million invoices and more than 28 million activations, and are used by more than 370,000 professionals across almost 1,000 clients. iQmetrix is a privately held software-as-a-service (SaaS) company with employees in Canada, the U.S., India, and Europe. For more information, please visitwww.iqmetrix.com.

How We Do it:

We are on aself-managementjourney. As we work to move away from the restrictions ofhierarchy, teams are building collaborative peer-based networks where there are no bosses. Decisions are meant to be distributed to the people who are best able to make the decisions which means more freedom for individuals to contribute at their highest levels. We are purpose-driven, helping individuals connect to the meaning in their day-to-day work. Additionally, we are currently on the road to building a diverse and inclusive environment. Working atiQmetrixmeans always looking at ways to be better.

Reports To: Technical Lead

About the Team:

The Data and Analytics team is transforming data into a powerful, accessible product that drives strategic decisions. We modernize data infrastructure and refine analytics capabilities to deliver seamless, high-quality insights to all users. A key initiative is the development of the "Customer Lifecycle" product, set to enter beta, which embodies our innovation-first approach and our mission to unlock the full potential of data within our ecosystem.

About the Role:

As a Data Engineer, you'll design and implement scalable data pipelines, working with leading-edge technologies in a rapidly evolving environment. This role provides hands-on experience and the unique opportunity to directly impact how we leverage data to drive business success, while contributing to a system that's shaping the future of our data space.

Competitive salary starting at $90,000 CAD, commensurate with experience.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing:


Designing, implementing, and optimizingdata pipelines for processing large volumes of data
Developing and maintaining data storage solutions, including data lakes, data warehouses, and relational/non-relational databases
Partnering with product and cross-functional teams to translate data insights into impactful solutions
Integratingdata from multiple sources and ensure its quality, consistency, and accessibility
Optimizingperformance of data processing workflows and ensure scalability
Contributingto the evolution of data architecture and infrastructure to meet growing business needs
Troubleshooting and resolvingdata-related issues promptly and efficiently
Maintaining and documenting best practices for data engineering and architecture


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


2-5 years of experience in data engineering or a related field
Proficiency in SQL and one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, Scala)
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and big data technologies (e.g. Azure Databricks)
Familiarity with ETL/ELT frameworks and data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Dagster)
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and database management
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD workflows
Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly
Familiarity with machine learning tools and analytical methods, (e.g. MLflow)


What We Offer:


Begin your journey with a competitive starting salary!‚ÄØ
Enjoy peace of mind with a comprehensive benefits package for you and your entire family.‚ÄØ
Embrace work-life harmony with a flexible hybrid working environment and our trusted vacation and trusted sick program.‚ÄØ
Invest in your future with our RRSP/401K/PF and Share Ownership plans. What's even better? We offer a match program!
We care about your family, offering maternity, adoption, and paternity leave salary top ups as well as ten ‚ÄúNew Baby Days‚Äù for all parents welcoming a new child into their life.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Enjoy a ‚ÄúCultural Day‚Äù off annually to celebrate a day of religious or cultural significance.‚ÄØ
Give back with up to 6 days of paid time off annually for volunteering or personal learning.‚ÄØ
We believe in the value of taking time to refresh, re-energize, and reflect on your career journey. Employees are granted a seven-week sabbatical after every seven years of employment!‚ÄØ


What is an iQer?

An iQer is a term, used daily across all iQmetrix locations, is someone who works for iQmetrix. Sounds simple, but there‚Äôs more to being an iQer than meets the eye!

If you‚Äôre an iQer, you approach problems with humility and an open mind. You‚Äôre a go-getter who doesn‚Äôt wait around to be told what do to. Whether it‚Äôs on your own or with a team, you aren‚Äôt afraid to try new things, fail, succeed, and improve along the way. Your team, the company, and the well-being of others come before your personal agenda‚Äîyou‚Äôre an ally to your colleagues and the community.

The world changes fast and, as an iQer, you‚Äôre ready to adapt. You recognize diversity in the world, listen to others, and consider all perspectives.

Want to Join the Team?‚ÄØ

If you‚Äôre interested in a career with‚ÄØiQmetrix, please submit your resume and cover letter. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race,‚ÄØfaith, colour,‚ÄØcultural background, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.‚ÄØ

We are a hybrid work environment, remote and in-office for all employees in an office city.

You can view our job applicant privacy policy here.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to take your career to new heights?

As Canada's Leading Ultra-low-cost Carrier, Dedicated To Providing Affordable And Exceptional Travel Experiences To Canadians, Flair Airlines Is Always On The Lookout For Talented Individuals To Join Our Team And Contribute To Our Success As We Continue To Expand Our Route Network, Flight Frequency, And Services. Given Our Commitment To Growth And Excellence, We Are Currently Seeking Candidates For The Following Position

Job Title: Analytics Engineer

Department: IT

Location: Vancouver, BC (YVR)

Work Arrangement: This role is primarily based in the office environment.

Position Overview

Reporting to the Analytics Engineer Manager, The Analytics Engineer will be a key contributor to developing high-performance data solutions and delivering actionable insights that drive informed decision-making and business growth. This role involves defining business rules, documenting requirements, designing scalable data models, and supporting the development of dashboards and reports. Additionally, the Analytics Engineer will play a vital role in implementing data governance policies, ensuring data quality, and spearheading continuous improvement initiatives. Working closely with cross-functional teams, this position will help transform data into strategic insights that shape business direction. The incumbent works in an office environment. Occasional travel may be required. The position will require prolonged periods of sitting and using office equipment and computers. Long periods of intense concentration may be required. The position may require moving from a sitting to a standing position, bending, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, twisting, grasping, and lifting 50 lbs.

Primary Job Functions

The duties of the Analytics Engineerinclude:


Develop solutions that transform complex data into actionable knowledge and present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Support optimizing business strategies by leveraging data-driven insights to enhance decision-making and operational efficiency
Design, build, and optimize scalable data models to support analytics and reporting
Act as the main resource for complex report, integration, and dashboard requests using Power BI or other reporting tools
Collaborate with other analysts, engineers, business users, and external vendors to align data solutions with business needs
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by implementing best practices in data validation and testing
Maintain clear, up-to-date documentation for data models, pipelines, and processes to support knowledge sharing across teams
Perform additional duties as assigned


Qualifications & Requirements

The preferred candidate should exemplify Flair's core values of Respect, Integrity, Reliability, and Resilience while demonstrating success in previous roles. Additionally, we are seeking individuals who possess:


Education:
A University or College degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science/Engineering, or a related discipline, or equivalent specialized training/certification
Experience:
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics or business intelligence
Previous experience in the Airline industry or e-commerce is considered an asset
Skills & Abilities:
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities
Advanced proficiency in SQL and strong experience with data warehousing and ETL/ELT processes
Familiarity with Snowflake and dbt is a plus
Proven expertise in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker for data visualization and reporting
Hands-on experience with GA4 and other web analytics tools to track, analyze, and report on website performance, user behavior, and conversion metrics
Experience with Email and SMS marketing analytics, including campaign performance tracking, audience segmentation, and engagement metrics
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and experimentation frameworks to evaluate marketing and product performance
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and automation
Strong knowledge of data modeling, schema design, and data governance principles
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to prepare and present clear reports and presentations for diverse audiences
A proactive, results-driven approach with a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Excellent collaboration skills with the ability to engage stakeholders across departments and at various levels
Competencies:
Leading as a Flair teammate by demonstrating collaborative behavior and modeling the company's values in all interactions
Maintaining diverse relationships with peers and stakeholders to foster effective communication and collaboration
Delivering results with impact by setting clear goals, prioritizing tasks effectively, and continuously striving for improvement in performance and outcomes
Requirements:
Clear criminal record check and satisfactory employment references
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada without restriction

Why Join Flair Airlines

At Flair Airlines, we value our employees and provide a supportive and collaborative work environment that offers opportunities for growth and professional achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, effective on your first day of employment, which includes:


Competitive compensation package including medical and dental benefits, both short and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, dependent life insurance, and an employee & family assistance program
Pension plan with matched contributions
Individualized performance bonuses based on achievements
Attractive referral incentive program
Access to our staff travel program, allowing employees and their travel companions unlimited travel access across the Flair network


How To Apply

If you‚Äôre ready to embark on this exciting journey with Flair Airlines, please submit your resume through the job posting and answer a few questions about your experience and suitability for the role.

Application Deadline: March 27, 2025

Flair Airlines is committed to creating an inclusive, equal, and accessible environment that attracts diverse talent. We encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role. If you require accommodation during the selection process, please let us know. While we appreciate all applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage of the recruitment process.

We look forward to the possibility of welcoming you on board!

Website: www.flyflair.com

  • Pension plan with matched contributions
  • Individualized performance bonuses based on achievements
  • Attractive referral incentive program
  • Access to our staff travel program, allowing employees and their travel companions unlimited travel access across the Flair network

How To Apply

Application Deadline: March 27, 2025

Flair Airlines is committed to creating an inclusive, equal, and accessible environment that attracts diverse talent. We encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role. If you require accommodation during the selection process, please let us know. While we appreciate all applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage of the recruitment process.

Title: Data Protection Analyst (Global Security)
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for experienced Data Protection Analyst in the Greater Vancouver area. The opportunity is to work in a cross functional team with the primary goal to provide and maintain security infrastructure, providing stability by following and using the tools, policies, processes and procedures that are available while supporting RBC's constant growth, innovation and adoption of emerging technologies. The opportunity is to provide oversight, monitoring and technical control enhancements to existing data loss protection services and processes.

What will you do?


Proactively investigate and perform operational enhancements, support and protection efforts.
Communicate with internal areas at all reporting levels.
Collaborate with data protection teams while addressing operational issues and to enhancing monitoring controls.
Perform policy updates by coordinating with other team members.
Ensure that process documentation is maintained, reviewed, and updated on an ongoing basis
Create, review, maintain and update documentation. Undertake problem ownership and projects leadership.
Responsible for the planning and controlled execution of releases into the managed environment.
Improving the process by identify areas for automation and scripting wherever possible


What do you need to succeed?

Must have:


IT-security professional with solid experience in the infrastructure security domain or in the IT application security domain.
Experience running data discovery, loss and cloud-based protection services.
Familiar with data loss investigations and incident response processes.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and effectively manage multiple priorities.
A willingness to make a difference and help protect business areas and data.
Experience with global deployments of data loss prevention products and/or cloud-based solutions


Nice to have:


Industry related certification ‚Äì e.g. CASP+/CISSP/CISA/CISM
Knowledge of financial services business line(s) and associated applications and processes
Information Technology standards, methodologies, and audit requirements
Experience on administrating and maintaining Red Hat Enterprise Linux system
General Networking skill including but not limited to firewalls, routing, NAT, SI Model, packet trace and analysis knowledge
Knowledge on Shell Scripting Project management skills Interpersonal Skills Communication, flexibility, self-driven, team player


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work


#TechPJ

Job Skills

Communication, Confidentiality, Critical Thinking, Data Loss Protection, Data Privacy, Data Protection, Group Problem Solving, Information Security Management, Information Technology Security, Long Term Planning, Prioritization, Teamwork

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

#TechPJ

Communication, Confidentiality, Critical Thinking, Data Loss Protection, Data Privacy, Data Protection, Group Problem Solving, Information Security Management, Information Technology Security, Long Term Planning, Prioritization, Teamwork

Title: Market Analyst
Description:
Job Category

Data & Research

Pay Grade Range

$33,000.00 - $77,000.00

Disclaimer: The base salary range represents the low and high end of Altus Group‚Äôs ‚ÄúPay Grade Range‚Äù for this position in the primary work location. Actual hiring salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to work experience, and geographic market data for the role. The Pay Grade Range listed above does not reflect Altus Group‚Äôs total compensation for employees. Other rewards may include an annual bonus, flexible work arrangements, and region-specific benefits.

Unlock your Altus Experience!

If you‚Äôre looking to advance your career in data analytics, expertise, and technology for the rapidly growing global CRE market, there‚Äôs no better place than Altus Group. At Altus, our work is purposeful. Every day, our employees drive impact, innovate, and shape the global commercial real estate (CRE) and PropTech industry.

Our people-centric culture empowers you to deliver in a high trust, high performance culture, surrounded by an inclusive team that‚Äôs collaborating to modernize our industry. We invest in our people with training and growth opportunities designed to propel you further in your career while providing a flexible and progressive workplace that reflects our values and teams.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Regional Team Lead of Data Solutions, you will join a highly motivated, multi-disciplinary team of real estate professionals. The Data Solutions team is looking for a Market Analyst who wants to contribute to the reliability and accuracy of our commercial leasing database. This is an opportunity for someone who thrives in an autonomous role, who is a go-getter and clear communicator.

Key Responsibilities


Daily review of GSC Tracking file. Validate and resolve data issues daily to improve data quality and meet market requirements, including verbal communication and monitoring other secondary data sources.
Review broker reports, stakeholder/government websites, press releases, and other sources for secondary research validation.
Communicate verbally with stakeholders for secondary research updates not handled by GSC. Enter and update secondary research data in the system. (i.e. inventory and market expansions, new supply deliverables, direct requests, data validation from GSC entries, and collecting lease transactions, New Homes Now Selling, Sold Out, and Cancelled Project Data etc)
Prioritize and resolve any data issues identified by the Team Lead through regular data audits to enhance data quality and meet market requirements in a timely manner. Conduct regular data audits, escalate issues to Team Lead as needed.
Update secondary research data in the system as necessary. Triage direct inquiries from stakeholders based on task (GSC-related, system/technical issues, local market expertise etc).
Assist in preparing source data for primary research, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Conduct historical data updates (additions, area changes, deletions, construction status changes, classification changes etc.)
Resolve any client inquiries regarding record and process inquiries in a timely manner (direct or delegated by Team Lead). Triage any other requests as necessary to Team Lead, Customer Success, Support, Account Mgmt or IT.
Conduct property site visits (as necessary) and liaise with property stakeholders and brokers to gather value-added metrics for secondary research via verbal, email, or in-person communication.
Establish and maintain industry relationships with stakeholders through real estate events and networking to improve data cooperation and acquire data for secondary research focusing on value-added metrics (as needed)
Gain comprehension and training of all core Data Solution products. Complete product competency review.
Ability to conduct secondary research for all core Data Solutions products (as necessary)


Key Qualifications


Post-secondary education (either college or university) is required; Business, Geography, Economics, Data or Planning focus preferred
Minimum of 1 year of relevant experience
Genuine interest in the real estate industry, with a strong desire to learn.
This position requires the successful candidate to have a valid driver‚Äôs license and a clean driver‚Äôs abstract
Proficient in MS Office with an emphasis on Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
Knowledge of correct spelling, grammar and punctuation in the English language and/or French language
Adept skills in data collection, data interpretation, and compiling information: knows where data resides in the system and how data entries and changes may impact data in other parts of the system
Confident to make phone calls to new contacts to retrieve property/project information


What Altus Group Offers


Rewarding performance: We are pleased to be able to provide employees competitive compensation, incentive and bonus plans, and a total rewards package that prioritizes their mental, physical and overall financial health.
Growth and development: As a destination for top industry talent, we‚Äôre investing in you to meet the evolving needs of our clients and deliver on your professional goals. Our Altus Intelligence Academy offers over 150,000 hours of learning materials catering to diverse stages of an employee‚Äôs career journey.
Flexible work model: We‚Äôre modernizing our employee programs to reflect the new world of work. Our Activity-Based Work model provides you with flexibility to align your work location to the work being performed - office for connecting and collaborating, and remote for focused work.


Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where all clients and employees feel welcomed, accepted and valued. We provide an atmosphere free from barriers to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion, and encourage equal opportunities for all employees. We‚Äôre seeking candidates with diverse experiences and provide accessible candidate experiences throughout the selection process. If you need accommodation, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or +1 888 692 7487.

We appreciate all applicants who take the time to apply to Altus Group. Please note that only those who are selected to move forward in the process will be contacted. Thank you.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Job description

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:




In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community




Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.




Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.







Basic Requirements




Full Professional Proficiency in English & French language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment




In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

to diversity.

Title: Sr Analyst, Business Analytics & Insights
Description:
Marketing Statement

As the largest operating company in the integrated TransLink enterprise, Coast Mountain Bus Company (CMBC) operates a fleet of clean-fuel conventional and community shuttle buses, zero-emission trolley buses, and passenger ferry SeaBuses in Metro Vancouver, the largest single transit service area in Canada.

At CMBC, one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, we're committed to providing an innovative, healthy, and engaging workforce. This is reflected in our workforce of over 5,500 employees performing over 400 unique jobs, who are committed and empowered to deliver service that attracts nearly 1.1 million passengers daily and connects people, businesses, and communities in the Metro Vancouver region.

We have the important job of helping our passengers get to work, appointments, visiting with family and friends, and back again every day. Metro Vancouver relies on us, and we take that as a point of pride.

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Provides technical expertise to the development of a data governance framework for CMBC, including leading stakeholder engagement, developing, and monitoring progress of long-term roadmap, establishing requisite business processes, and ensuring the Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Analytic (DW/BI&A) solutions align with the established framework. Provides technical leadership and supervision on the design, development, and quality assurance of monthly dashboard reports to the Executive Management Team (EMT), to ensure timely and accurate delivery. Supports the Manager, Business Analytics & Insights with leading the annual Corporate Business Planning and Reporting process through stakeholder engagement with leaders from across the organization, ensuring alignment to Corporate and Enterprise-level strategic plans.

Key Accountabilities

Provides technical leadership on planning and implementation of DW/BI&A solutions. Designs, implements, and maintains customized data warehouse, business intelligence and analytics (DW/BI&A) technical solutions. Ensures DW/BI&A solutions function effectively and align with standards, policies and supports ongoing Data Governance Program within CMBC. Ensures solutions adhere to best practices and Enterprise standards.

Designs, implements, and maintains the Corporate Business Plan BI reporting solution, data collection process and KPI integration to ensure the alignment of planned annual works to strategic long-range workplans, Enterprise goals, as well as ties together corporate-level KPIs to the annual initiatives to ensure alignment to planned works and performance measures assessed.

Provides technical expertise in the development and sustainment of a data governance framework for CMBC, including standardized documentation. Leads stakeholder engagement and ensures the DW/BI&A solutions developed align with the governance framework established. Leads discussions with those identified as part of the governance framework within the organization and looks for alignment opportunities from across the Enterprise.

Stays abreast of new techniques, technologies, and industry trends, and participates in relevant industry events related to Data Governance. Leads the team towards modern practices and techniques; establishes and participates in design reviews, regular or ad-hoc data quality reviews ensuring data quality throughout the data pipeline.

Manages and develops projects of moderate to high impact, risk, and complexity. Designs and develops project scope, schedules, and work plans; defining and prioritizing deliverables; ensuring compliance with Enterprise standards, policies and procedures. Alerts management to critical issues and risks. Identifies and resolves project issues, including scheduling overruns, conflicting agendas, and technical issues.

Provides technical support to the maintenance of custom Extract Transform Load (ETL) solution, as well as continual assessment of metadata reporting to ensure data integrity and quality assurance.

Consults and collaborates with business and technology stakeholders on data management and data architecture strategies, governance, practices, and policies.

Supports the Executive Management Team by providing KPIs to report on monthly performance; leads requirements gathering, target setting, report design and delivery and documentation. Carries out analysis related to variances in corporate performance measures, recommending best practices to the Senior Management team for problem areas.

Prepares quarterly reports for the CMBC Board of Directors and TransLink Statutory Reporting requirements.

Provides support to the Manager in the development and maintenance of the Team‚Äôs Strategic Plan Roadmap, planning and decisions making. Provides input on the dependency and sequencing of projects as well as highlights any potential project or compliance risks to ensure project priorities align to annual objectives.

Participates in the development and implementation of a continuous improvement strategy by offering Business Process advisory services to other departments. Supports the delivery of better value and greater efficiency through the identification and elimination of unnecessary complexity within business processes and identification of better ways of working, applying Lean methodology.

Acts as a key liaison with International Benchmarking Groups to conduct detailed surveys and analysis. Determines international best practices related to specific Key Performance Indicators and completes analysis of moderate to high impact, recommending business changes with financial/budgetary impacts. Completes follow-up analysis to confirm impacts and ROI. Presents findings to Executive Team, and at conferences as requested by Executive leadership.

Develops business cases to support KPIs with strategic objectives and leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices; provides comparable performance measures from other transit systems and business enterprises to stakeholders towards informed decision making. Forecasts the implications of various alternatives to maximize the effectiveness of KPIs for organizational success.

Represents the Business Analytics & Insights Team on inter-departmental committees and as a technical input for larger scale capital projects as requested.

Provides technical support and guidance to other Analysts and supports Managers within the organization by connecting them to relevant data sources for their reporting needs, including developing custom SQL views of required data.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or other relevant business-related fields plus seven (7) years of progressive experience in performance reporting functions in a multifaceted organization.

Other Requirements

Advanced knowledge of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards

Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Data Warehouse and BI technologies, both Cloud and on-prem (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Desktop, PowerBI Report Builder, PowerBI Service, Tableau etc.)

Strong knowledge of Microsoft PowerPlatform solutions including PowerApps, PowerAutomate and Power Platform Admin Centre.

Strong knowledge and understanding of the relevant concepts of data mining and data warehousing

Demonstrated ability to communicate the complexities of technical programs (e.g. Kimball methodology, modern data warehousing).

Advanced experience of data modeling and business process design software, such as Visio.

Advanced knowledge of coaching and mentoring teams on Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence Architect concepts and methodology.

Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills to handle conflict resolution, facilitating discussion and alternatives of different approaches.

Solid leadership skills with ability to manage and influence direct or indirect reporting staff, and to provide specialized guidance and expertise to all levels of the organization.

Excellent planning, organization, and time management skills with strong ability to organize competing priorities.

Experience maintaining ETL process using software such as SSIS

Prior experience in design, deployment, or sustainment of Data Governance Program

Advanced knowledge of concepts, principles, practices, and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards, and dashboards

Advanced interpersonal and communication skills to provide specialized guidance and expertise to managers, staff and customers; and to develop and manage critical relationships at all levels in the enterprise.

Experience in leading and facilitating Lean/process improvements event is an asset.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $82,400 - $123,600 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to https://www.translink.ca/About-Us/Careers.aspx to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: March 05, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Coast Mountain Bus Company is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca
Show more
